story:
Our Story

The founders of Potentiam have worked in music management for a number of years and realise and understand the difficulties involved in promoting new emerging music artists. In 2016 they founded a music publication Britznbeatz to help discover and promote musicians which continues to gain respect and recognition in the industry. Together with our advisors we have over 75 years experience in the music industry. Our advisory team is unrivalled with their 4 grammy nominations, and 4 Billboard top 100 produced songs.

Music Industry Overview

The business structure of today's global music industry has been remarkably resilient during the digital revolution. The capital intensive process required to record a master, and produce and distribute physical copies to consumers is the reason for the rise in prominence behind the growth of record companies into industry controlling corporations. Advances in technology have drastically reduced these costs and yet we find major record labels and publishers at the center and in control of the entire industry.

The Problem

The current structure of the music industry concentrates power in the hands of relatively few middlemen, i.e. record labels and their subsidiaries. Labels invest around $4.5 billion annually into marketing and A&R, and in turn are still gateways between creatives and potential commercial success.   But not only do they determine which creatives are promoted to a wider audience, those fortunate enough to achieve commercial success will be lucky to see 10% of the revenue generated from the proceeds of their creations. In short, the problem is the structure of the industry itself.   Its outdated institutions not only restrict growth but also consume a majority of the wealth the industry generates.

The Solution

The chain of transactions present in the music industry from the use of middlemen will be replaced with the use of smart contracts (self-executing digital contracts) via the blockchain.
This offers a safer, transparent, and cost effective solution.  

  • A social network where composers and performers can create their own accounts to advertise themselves, seek out other artists for collaboration. ​
  • A catalog management suite where artists can manage their content, including associated copyrights, that has been created within or outside of Potentiam Core. ​

Potentiam Core will be four main distribution modules.

  • Digital sales 
  • Physical sales 
  • Sync Licensing and P.R.O./broadcast royalties.
  • A live performance module which connects performers with promoters.

Why Should I be part of Potentiam & buy PTM Tokens?

Potentiam PTM tokens are the platform’s backbone and will serve as the medium of exchange for all platform transactions. ​ As Potentiam will eliminate the need for middlemen, PTM token holders have an opportunity to directly control and benefit from the rewards of the music industry. ​Essentially earning them a slice of the billion dollar music industry.

  • PTM owners have the option to stake their tokens in the Potentiam Vault which will earn them special rights, privileges and (50% of platform fees generated).  
  • Because PTM tokens are staked it limits the amount in supply. ​
  • The Global Independent artists market is huge and growing meaning the utility of PTM tokens will increase surpassing supply. Providing potential for growth.  
  • PTM holders can crowdfund their favourite music artists projects.
  • Test alpha platform with over 5000 global independent artists onboard.
  • Proprietary open source smart contracts. Please see our Github.

Target Market

Comparison

Potentiam 

There are 2,500,000 PTM tokens available excluding bonuses here on Indiegogo. Our aim is to render an extensive and groundbreaking experience with the features on Potentiam.

Funds collected will be used for the technical development, legal, testing, deployment, and marketing. 

If the crowdsale does not reach the anticipated amount, we have a strategy to re-adjust our timelines, development, and marketing process to safely accommodate the outcome.

 

Website: https://www.potentiam.io
Telegram: https://t.me/potentiamgroup
Twitter: https://twitter.com/potentiam_io
Instagram: https://instagram.com/potentiam_io
Medium: https://medium.com/potentiam
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/potentiam.io
Faq: https://trello.com
Whitepaper: English 

Token: POTENTIAM TOKENS ($0.20 = 1 PTM)​
Regular Price: $100 - 500 PTM tokens

We have already raised over $100,000 USD in our initial round of funding.

Limited Offer

Participants that contribute $100 between the 7th and 9th of March will receive 540 PTM tokens.
Participants that contribute $100 between the 10th and 16th of March will receive 520 PTM tokens.

story:
Short Summary

Hailing from Oslo, Norway, the dystopian sludge//doom metal trio RONGEUR was formed in the autumn of 2012. The experienced band members came together with few limitations regarding sound or genre, except a shared desire to make raw, heavy and honest music. Rongeur therefore offer varying levels of angst and batter you with their unique brand of heavy. They draw inspiration from the likes of Eyehategod, Seigmen, High on Fire, Neurosis, Darkthrone and Arthur Schoupenhauer.

Check out Rongeur here: 

https://rongeur.bandcamp.com/ 

https://www.facebook.com/Rongeurband/

Past
Rongeur's first release was a compilation of demos, "The Catastrophist" (2013) and "As the Blind Strive" (2014), issued on cassette by the british label Aonair Productions in 2014, and later on compact disc by the norwegian label Disiplin Media in 2015. The release received great feedback from several reviewers worldwide. Later in 2015 Rongeur also released a digital split with Ampmandens Døtre (Rongeur contributing two tracks, "Nothing Has Improved"/"Traitors"). A two-track 7'' vinyl single "God and I"/"Good War" was then released in 2016. Both these releases were mixed and mastered by Jørgen Karlstrøm (ex-Hexed), and issued on the norwegian label Ampmandens Records. 

Present
Their debut full length LP "An Asphyxiating Embrace" was recorded at Norsk Lydstudio in late January 2017 with vocals and dubbing done elsewhere throughout 2017. Mixing and mastering was done by Ruben Willem at Caliban Studios (Haust, Okkultokrati, Nettlecarrier, Timeworn, Djevel).

The new effort is released digitally and on cassette tape on 9th of March 2018, and sees Rongeur perfecting their form of angry sludge//doom metal. Lyrically they still struggle with alienation, loss and general misanthropy.  

What We Need & What You Get

Poacher Records is a small DIY label run by the band themselves. There is thus limited funds available. The recording, mixing, and mastering is done, and has been financed by the band. The vinyl edition of the album will be co-released with Aonair Records and Ampmandens Records. However, Poacher Records and the band still has to shoulder the majority of the manufacturing costs. Shipping of the vinyl is estimated to begin in early June 2018.      

  • We are asking for EUR 1000 as a goal.  This will help pay for about half of the manufacturing costs, in addition to the licencing fees, taxes, postage, etc.
  • We offer the album "An Asphyxiating Embrace" in a limited run of three different vinyl colours: clear, white or standard black vinyl (100 copies of each colour). The LP is housed in a beautiful single jacket cover design by Ole Nymoen Design (Sibiir, Naga Siren, Hexed, Ieatheartattacks), with a high quality protective inner sleeve.  
  • ​All copies of the LP will be hand numbered by the band.
  • 20 copies of the coloured vinyl versions will contain a signed live band photo by Endre Lohne + a spot on the guest list to a Rongeur concert in Oslo in late summer 2018 (date/time: TBA).
  • ​For the die-hard fans, we also offer a bundle with an extremely limited test pressing of the album + other limited goodies.
  • Furthermore, we offer a bundle including the vinyl version of your choice, in addition to a copy of a very limited run of 50 hand numbered cassette tapes of the album, with exclusive artwork and a bonus track.
  • ​If we exceed our goal, we will consider adding more stuff to the packages.
  • Shipping will be added at checkout. Please observe that the shipping prices listed is set by the norwegian postal service. 
  • If you live in the Oslo area, or have friends here, we can arrange for local pick up if desired. Then select "Pitcairn" as shipping destination at checkout. You will then not be charged any shipping fees. If you order from Pitcairn however you are very lucky as you will get free shipping!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give money, but still love Rongeur, please help spread the word to any and all friends, family, co-workers, and music lovers.  We'll be very grateful for your efforts.

​If we exceed our goal, we will consider adding more stuff to the packages.
Shipping will be added at checkout. Please observe that the shipping prices listed is set by the norwegian postal service. 
If you live in the Oslo area, or have friends here, we can arrange for local pick up if desired. Then select "Pitcairn" as shipping destination at checkout. You will then not be charged any shipping fees. If you order from Pitcairn however you are very lucky as you will get free shipping!


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't give money, but still love Rongeur, please help spread the word to any and all friends, family, co-workers, and music lovers.  We'll be very grateful for your efforts.

story:
Short Summary 

Launched in 2011, Brasil Summerfest (BSF) has grown to be the largest international Brazilian music & arts festival in the world. We have presented some of the most exciting artists from Brazil including Seu Jorge, Elza Soares, Marcelo D2, Criolo, Emicida, Lenine and many others. We have been shaping Brazilian contemporary culture in New York and developing BSF as a landmark event in New York’s festival circuit. We are looking to extend BSF to two weeks filled with exciting music performances, films, workshops, parties, talks and a street fair featuring a variety of vendors. We want to turn BSF into an invigorating 360 Brazilian experience! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $10,000. Half of the funds will go towards helping the artists with their visa expenses, flights and lodging. We’re talking about 40+ musicians flying from Brazil to NYC. The other half of the funds will go towards festival production and staffing. It takes a village to put the festival together — a lot of time, energy and resources. To help us achieve our mission, we have put together some very special perks that you won’t find anywhere else! Get yourself a great perk and in return, you’ll also get yourself an amazing festival! 

 

The Impact

This year we want to create the biggest edition of our festival to date. We want to bring 15 truly unique bands from Brazil.  We want to expand our program to include workshops, talks, films, food and much more! We want to create a Brazilian experience the world will envy. We are on our way and you can help us get there! 

 

Risks & Challenges

We always deliver what we promise, but sometimes unpredictable things can happen. The greatest challenge is getting the artists that we love from Brazil to NYC. Sometimes the artists don’t have enough resources to make the trip or to file for visas, but this is exactly part of the purpose of this campaign. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us by sharing this with your friends, family and community. Do it online and offline. Thank you so much for your support. Muito Obrigado pelo seu apoio. See you at Brasil Summerfest 2018!

story:
Project Breakdown

From the heart of downtown Los Angeles, Marc Avery, Sean Carney, and Rockwell Sands came together in the fall of 2016 to form what they thought “the ultimate project” would be: a band with pop sensibilities that married urban and rock music into one unique sound.

WOLVES have been around for just under two years, and in that time, they have climbed Billboard and Mediabase charts, appeared on Sirius XM's "Hit's 1" station, played on radio stations across the country and played many live shows in the Los Angeles area at legendary venues such as Hotel Cafe and the Viper Room. The guys have accomplished all of this through consistent hard-work and determination, and the unconditional support of their fans.

"Freaky" is a song that throws all caution to the wind. WOLVES plan on making a memorable statement with this song which celebrates individuality, courage and fun! The band hopes to raise spirits by allowing the listener to embrace the qualities that make us unique, and let that freak flag fly.

With your support, WOLVES will be able to create an original audio-visual work in the way that they've always imagined it. They will be able to collaborate with some of the most talented film-makers in Los Angeles and let the message of "Freaky" be heard through carefully planned promotion. The guys know that this song has the potential to change lives and that is why they are so enthusiastic about this project.

What We Need

Here are the fine details of what we need:

  • Most of this money will go directly toward making this video. We will need:
    • A director
    • A team of filmogrpahers
    • A few locations
    • A video editor
    • Costumes
    • A cast of actors
    • Set design
    • Secret sauce
  • A good amount of this will go towards a PR campaign with one of the best publicists in Los Angeles. This will get us exclusive access to:
    • Spotify playlists
    • Blog/Magazine reviews
    • Airtime on radio stations
    • Music video placement
  • We've also allocated a budget to go towards additional marketing and producing merchandise for our backers.

If for whatever reason we don't meet our goal, we will use the funds collected to make the music video anyway. This song is just TOO GOOD.

The Impact

The men of WOLVES have shared a dream since they started working together to make music that inspires people with a positive message. The band understands the raw power of music and the impact that it can have on peoples lives. Your contribution could help WOLVES reach their goal of reaching a much bigger audience and touching the lives of many people who may need to hear this song.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for us right now is funding our passion. We dream really big, almost to a fault, but we wouldn't have it any other way. We understand that to create the best art possible, it takes involvement of experts in every field. The video for "Freaky" will involve some seriously talented artists...and they need to make a living too. By supporting us, you are supporting them to get to the next level as well.

The music industry is one of the toughest places to succeed, and we find many artists who are in it for all the wrong reasons. From the bottom of our hearts, all we want to do is make people understand one another and bring the world together through music.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time, NO PROBLEM. Please just help us by sharing via social media and getting the word out there! Pro-tip: You can share this project through this Indiegogo page!

Thanks again for your consideration in donating to this project.

Sincerely, WOLVES

story:
Hey guys!! Hannah here to tell you about what we are up to at New Hope Fellowship and how it came about.

We are excited to announce that we are making an album!!

The Story

For the past ten years, Jeff has been traveling around America leading worship in different churches with a passion to spark a prayer and worship revival in our region. Jeff recently became the worship pastor of New Hope Fellowship in Bloomfiield NY and since then has teamed up with many talented singers and musicians at New Hope, including Danielle and I.

The three of us led worship together for the first time at a prayer night about a year ago. We realized after that set that something really special happened when we sang together. Since then we have had the opportunity to worship together at our church and in other settings (house worship nights, prayer nights, etc). It has been through these times of worship and spontaneous singing that prophetic choruses and songs have come about. One of the songs we wrote that came out of a few different spontaneous times is called “Praise Arise.” This song has been done at several different churches and a few conferences and we have always seen it make a huge impact.  (check out "Praise Arise" at the BASIC Conference in Rochester, NY here). Because of the response that we have seen, and how powerful our times of worship have been we believe that God’s favor is on us now to join together in unity and believe for a move of God.

We really feel like  these songs are prophetic and ordained by God to impact our region and we want to share them with you. We want to start a movement of hope in an area where many feel like their hope has been lost, of joy where many have felt depressed, and of peace where many have felt anxiety and unrest. We know that God’s desire is to move and we want to be a part of it.

We need your help!

A lot of hard work goes into creating an album. Things like recording, mixing, mastering, videography, duplication, artwork, practice, songwriting and arranging all take time and money. 

Its up to you to help us get there! Would you consider joining with us as we reach to see God move by partnering with us to make this album happen??

story:
Short Summary

We are Belle of the Fall, an indie folk duo from CT. We are in the midst of making our second album and want you to help. 

As a backer you will get access to behind the scenes updates, videos, and rough mixes of the album as it comes together. It became an invaluable asset to have our backers insights and encouragement as we made our debut album. We felt like we couldn't make a second without you. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to take this album to greater heights than our first. With Earthbound we toured in 25 states and made connections with so many amazing people from Texas to Wisconsin, CT to Florida. Our goal is to bring this second album to more states and countries. We are trying to put a team together that can help us with booking and pr to make all of this a reality.

We came up with a bunch of great rewards that we are excited about. From handwritten lyrics, house concerts, t shirts, video producers... and of course the cd itself. We feel like there is something for everyone, and if you want to make a custom order, just send us a message and we will make it happen. 

Once the expense of ordering cds is taken care of, the rest of the money will go to promoting the album. So no matter what the number ends up at, we will use it all to bring this album to more people's ears. 

 

The Impact

We feel like the album has an important message that is needed in the world today. We want as many people as possible to hear it. Here is a message we got this morning from a fan:

What Your Earthbound Album is To Me:
An Honest & Transparent Paradigm Of Our Human Experience Here On Earth!

Messages like this are what motivate us to keep pushing. With your help we can reach more people. 

  • Our last campaign on indie go go received more funding than the goal we set, which was amazing. We used the money to promote the album and bring it across the country. 
  • We promise we will do everything in our power to make this album well known throughout the world. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge of making a record is becoming overwhelmed by the giant list of things that need to be done to make it a success. There is the recording itself, art work, videos, ordering ads and posters, etc... And it doesn't just stop at making  a good album. It has to be promoted well if people are going to hear it on a grand scale, (which is what we are going for.) Radio submissions, submitting for reviews, interviews, booking tours, touring, The part we loved about using indie go go for out first album is that our backers became a family of people behind us that kept us motivated and helped us to make decisions and give us an outside viewpoint. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone has a unique circle of friends that they can reach out to and help spread the word. Just by reading this you are a part of this journey. The success of this album depends on all of us, which is pretty amazing.

story:
Hi! We’re The London, a pop/rock band based out of Los Angeles, California! We’re in the studio right now working on our first new album in almost 10 years! Sometimes in your early 20s the world seems so vast and limitless that you need to break off from your friends and explore the world. The amazing thing about this limitless life is that sometimes you’re able to reconnect with the things that make you who you are…we’ve been watching a lot of our favorite bands from our touring days reunite and make new albums and go out and make new friends and new memories and we want in on the action. We started exchanging emails across the country about what a new album for The London would sound and look like, we started bouncing creative ideas off of one another and to our surprise we all had a similar picture in mind and still really enjoy working with one another…our skills are complimentary. We are a band in the truest sense of the word. Brothers. A gang. We are making the best music and art of our lives and we can’t finish it without your help! Our last record, “Young and In Love” took us from a basement in Pittsburgh, Pa to a management/record deal in LA and helped us make friends all over North America and really all over the world while giving us a lifetime of memories and friends. We know this new album has the potential to connect with people everywhere and continue that adventure. 

We need to raise $10,000 by september 6 to finish the album. We have already paid for about half of it ourselves but with taking time off of work to all be in the same city and just how expensive making an album is we’re getting pretty close to being tapped out and being DOA. We’ve enlisted some really talented friends like: Paul Menotiades, Kenny Blake, George Jones, Lexa Terrestrial as well as music video directors Jordan Beckham and Jamie Wright. We need the money to: 1. Pay for a little bit more studio time. 2. Pay musicians. 3. Have the record mixed 4. Have the record mastered by Garrett Haines at Treelady Mastering 5. Get actual physical vinyl and CD’s pressed. 6. Finish the music video for our first single “Girls” with director Jordan Beckham. 7. Finish the music video for the song “You Keep Leaving Me Here” that we started shooting with Jamie Wright of Division St. Films. 8. Get out on tour and start playing these songs for you like a real rock n’ roll band. 

If you’re reading this, you know us individually or collectively and know that we live and breathe music. This is the culmination of our life’s work. <3 We’re still the same guys who self-booked their first 2 month US tour, the kids who took it from a basement in Pittsburgh to Webster Hall in NYC or The Viper Room on The Sunset Strip or Live on National TV on WGN Midday News in Chicago. We’re still the band some of you would drive hours to see and sing at the top of your lungs for…if anything we’re just more comfortable being ourselves and better at it. We can’t wait to see you guys at a show!

In the past we’ve went with the traditional management/label route that I think most bands had to do in the past before social media was what it is now and before we were all so connected. We’re hoping to bypass a lot of that stress and bad advice and deals by just dealing with our supporters directly. No middleman, just a band and their fans sustaining and growing together. If we don’t meet our goal I honestly don’t know what we’re going to do…this art is so good that we’ve been begging, borrowing and pawning guitars and studio gear to just keep the music flowing! We’re in the middle of the process and need your help to finish!

If you can’t contribute financially please share the video and campaign with your friends!

story:
Timka is liquid soul that takes you in a journey from Afro-Colombian roots to a worldly expression that transcends pop and beautifully blends poetry and Latin American rhythms. The group originates from Colombia combining their ancestral and traditional roots with modern music, expressing their unreleased songs and rich folklore.

 

This campaign it’s important for us because we are going to record our 1st professional album, which will open doors at an international level. By supporting our campaign you will be part of something really special, you are helping us to make change our destiny.

We need 5,000 USD that will help us to pay for the professional recording of 10 songs (500 USD per song).

There are other ways that you can help, like sharing this email with your friends.

Your support will help us open the doors to the world stage like international festivals and cultural concerts.

We would be so grateful for your help!

story:
Résumer plus de 40 ans de carrière c’est un exercice en soi, voici mon « court » parcours de carrière et celui du Yves Lambert TRIO.

Fécondée au célèbre Hôtel Champlain du lac des Français par de joyeux créatifs et d’une gestation estival très festive, c’est finalement Mario Forest,  André Marchand et moi-même qui  a mis  au monde à l’automne 1976 le groupe La Bottine souriante sans se douter qu’elle deviendrait légendaire.

La Bottine souriante a été pendant 26 ans mon école et mon repère où j’ai exploré sur plusieurs coutures et plusieurs angles la musique traditionnelle.

J’ai fait ma valise en janvier 2003 pour partir en quête  de nouvelles aventures.

Depuis 2010, avec mes talentueux complices depuis 2004, Olivier Rondeau et Tommy Gauthier, nous présentons notre spectacle en formule TRIO. Le disque éponyme gagnera un Félix en 2013 pour l’album traditionnel de l’année et le deuxième Laissez courir les chiens a gagné en 2017 le Félix pour l’album traditionnel de l’année.

Olivier Rondeau est un guitariste, arrangeur et réalisateur de grand talent. Il a obtenu un «Major in Music» spécialisé en guitare jazz de l’Université Concordia. Son talent exceptionnel d’instrumentiste inspiré et versatile l’ont amené a créé un jeu unique pour accompagner le trio. Par  une simple modification de sa guitare Olivier Rondeau a ajouté de la profondeur  à son jeu de guitare en élargissant la gamme dynamique de son instrument. Ce processus lui permet de jouer de la guitare et la basse en même temps. Sa conception de la musique et ses arrangements ont trouvé une identité originale et différente. La grande implication et la créativité aux arrangements d’Olivier, a été le cœur du Bébert Orchestra et maintenant du Trio. Ses talents d’arrangeurs et de réalisateur se fait remarquer dans l’album Héritage Humain de Marie Marine fille de Raymond Lévesque et du magnifique album de Lawrence Lepage- le temps. De plus il a accompagné en tournée européenne le groupe The McDades et en spectacle au Québec Charles Papasoff et Nicolas Pellerin.

Dans un style folk, country, populaire ou jazz, Tommy Gauthier navigue aisément dans tous ces styles, alliant polyvalence, agilité et musicalité. J’apprécie beaucoup les capacités multi instrumentiste de Tommy qui sont d’une fluidité étonnante et remarquable au violon, bouzouki, mandoline, pieds, percussion. Improvisateur, Tommy sait comment jouer en interaction avec la mélodie principale. Sa rigueur, sa passion, son esprit créatif et sa rythmique naturelle contribuent à l’originalité des arrangements essentiels dans le Trio. Malgré sa jeunesse, Tommy a une impressionnante feuille de route  qui l'a amené à réaliser plusieurs albums avec maints artistes et à participer également à des tournées américaines et européennes, entre autres avec Le Bébert Orchestra, Roch Voisine, Antoine Dufour, Richard Desjardins Robert Charlebois. Il est bachelier de l’Université de Montréal en improvisation Jazz où il enseigne depuis 2006.

Le défi et le risque artistique que le Trio relève à chaque nouveau projet se situe dans la pertinence de  la relecture de cette musique traditionnelle, tout en poursuivant notre objectif de créer une horizontalité entre le festif et l’engagement social, entre le passé et le présent. Comment transmettre la conscience de notre patrimoine dans un contexte contemporain et rester congruent authentique et créatif ? C’est un défi constant que nous désirons relever encore une fois

Un nouvel album c’est un moment de faire le point pour mieux nous aventurer et risquer la création d’un nouveau répertoire avec de nouveaux arrangements J’aime décortiquer, compresser, modifier un répertoire existant dans l’intention d’en bonifier la force d’authenticité tout en lui offrant une réponse musicale contemporaine, intelligente afin de mettre en lumière la richesse de notre patrimoine culturel. Le tout bien ficelé par notre complicité musical et le talent et la direction musicale d’Olivier Rondeau et Tommy Gauthier.

Pour « jongler » cette matière vivante qu’est notre musique traditionnelle, nous avons besoin de votre soutien.  Encouragez-nous en participant au financement du nouvel album qu’YVES LAMBERT TRIO est en train de vous mijoter!

Votre participation financière est un soutien à l’aventure du troisième album du TRIO  d’Yves Lambert, d’olivier Rondeau et de Tommy Gauthier

story:
What's Going Down

Since 2010, we have been writing and performing our own raucous brand of Americana from basements in Indiana to venues across New York City. Our last EP primarily featured a variety of reimagined traditional tunes with a handful of original songs. Since then, we have been singularly focused on developing a hefty cache of original material, personal pieces brought to life by a fuller 6-piece band, new instrumentation, and bold arrangements. After months and months of preparation, we are eager to record our first full-length studio album in April.

  Your contributions will help us make this album a reality, launching us into the next stage of our band’s career. We have recently gained a great deal of press and interest as a result of our last EP and we are primed and excited, with your support, to push forward as songwriters and release an album that we are proud to share with you.

 

How to Help / What You'll Get

Every contribution you make will go directly towards the creation of this album. Working with our producer, we have calculated the costs of studio rental, mixing, mastering, printing, marketing, and hiring our sound engineers and PR team. We have pared down our budget to the most essential costs so that every dollar you donate counts.

We have included a number of perks to welcome you into the Nag family. From a digital download to a full VIP concert experience, each tier provides a personal and exciting way to further enjoy our music. Your generosity and support are invaluable and any amount you donate will go a long way towards making this album a reality.

 

 

What Folks are Saying

Still on the fence? Don't take our word for it. Take a look at some of the great things people have been saying about us:

“The Good Morning Nags demonstrate superb musicianship and songwriting leaving no wonder of how they became a staple of the New York folk scene." - Indie Spoonful

"Six-piece NYC based ensemble The Good Morning Nags is currently in the middle of making a name for themselves... recipe for musical success” - Matheson’s Entertainment Blog

“A band poised to break it big." - NeuFutur

“The hardest working bands will do what it takes to make their dreams happen. Our recent discovery The Good Morning Nags has put in the work and is now ready to reap the benefits.”
“Music to make you dance.” - Indie Band Guru

“…brings back Americana in a way that is accessible, and very different from most of the music coming out of NYC” - Left Bank Mag

 

Tell Your Friends!

Whether or not you’re able to contribute at this time, please spread the word about our campaign! You can share our page and our video via Indiegogo at the top of this page!

 


Thank you for visiting our campaign!

Thank you for all of your support past, present and future!

If you're a new Nags fan, welcome! To stay up to date with Nags News, drop your email address into our contact page and we will add you to our monthly newsletter, which includes upcoming shows and recording updates! And, if you get antsy waiting for the new songs... Check out our earlier EP on Spotify.

story:
Heavy Music Artwork 7th issue 'NIHILISM'. In a Post-Modern world we ask, is there something to believe in? What does culture mean? Is NIHILISM at the centre of our cultural chaos? Is the metal world complicit in its collapse? One can argue that metal and especially black metal nourishes an excessive sense of the narcissistic and self-aggrandising beyond any form of art and music. In this issue 'NIHILISM', we dig and poke to find answers.

Everything in the world displeases me: but, above all, my displeasure in everything displeases me.
–Friedrich Nietzsche

  • Ethically sourced and FSC approved and using vegetable-based inks
  • Limited edition of 666 units hand numbered and stamp embossed
  • Perfect PUR binding on 250gsm (cover) Offset Paper
  • 100 pages
  • 1700 Total units printed 

The best artworks of 2017. 100 Artists with 100 Bands on 100 Releases. Bands, artists and Heavy Music Artwork commentary. We brought together the finest 2017 album art. 

  • A4 Hardback (210mmx297mm)
  • Printed on high gloss 200gm paper
  • 120 Pages 
  • Limited to 100 
  • Hand numbered and embossed

Our artist's lifetime commitment and dedication to art are immense. It resonates passion, beauty and intensity beyond words. Centred around the concept of creation and the act of creating. Like in religious tradition the one that creates is divine and of divine intention. Strictly focusing on inspiration, symbolism, philosophy, creativity and imagination. 

  • A4 Hardback (210mmx297mm) 
  • Printed on high gloss 200gm paper
  • 196 Pages 
  • Limited to 100 
  • Hand numbered and embossed

In an age of ugliness, a work of beauty is an act of defiance. 
– Sir Roger Scruton

Your contribution will help us release our 7th installation 'NIHILISM' and it is also a way to pre-sell before it hits the stores around the world. We are looking to raise a base of £3,000. This will help us with the release the magazine and of course help with bills, etc.

This is an estimate of our costs and where the funds will go towards

  • 30% Production costs
  • 20% Marketing
  • 18% Overheads
  • 25% Printing costs
  • 7% Campaign fees

  • End post-modernism
  • Promote graphic artists, music artists
  • Entice people to explore and experience life within the arts
  • Examine through music, art, and literature all aspects of the human condition

  • Your contributions will not only benefit us as a publisher but the artists and the metal community as a whole
  • We are dedicated to having our publications in places where you wouldn't normally see a metal magazine like art galleries and museums
  • Our work has helped young artists getting the attention they deserve as well as getting paid jobs from bands

Heavy metal is one of the most relevant and influential art forms and it must be celebrated as such, Heavy Music Artwork is the first to make this statement. Since our launch www.heavymusicartwork.com great popularity, reaching nearly 1 million page views, and 25,000+ monthly visitors. Promoted via all HMA social networks 80K+ Followers. Newsletter to 12K HMA email subscribers. We also have an online store where you can buy directly from us www.heavymusicartwork.bigcartel.com.

Debemur Morti Productions, Lion Music, Mascot Group, Pitch Black Records, Snapper Music, SPV, Warner Music, Svart Records, Adrenaline PR, Asher Media, Audacious PR, Clawhammer PR, Cosa Nostra, Devil PR, Dewar PR, Domino Media, Duff Press, Earsplit, Factory Music, Fly PR, Future PR, I Like Press, Noble PR, Noise Cartel, Old Empire, Perfect Storm PR, Pioneer Music Press, Publicity PR, Rarely Unable, Red Sand PR, Savage Gringo, Scream Promotion, Silverblack, Stampede Press, Speakeasy PR, Stereo Sanctity, Team All About The Music, Visible Noise, Wilful Publicity and Work Hard PR.

As with any project, there are risks involved in releasing a publication. We might not be able to deliver the end product on time, or we might run into problems with the printing and shipping. Our team has over 15 years of delivering creative projects of all sizes and shapes. We are already in the 3rd book and 7th magazine release.

If you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ask your fellow metal head to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Please share and make the world know that metal is art in all its forms.
story_txt:
Heavy Music Artwork 7th issue 'NIHILISM'. In a Post-Modern world we ask, is there something to believe in? What does culture mean? Is NIHILISM at the centre of our cultural chaos? Is the metal world complicit in its collapse? One can argue that metal and especially black metal nourishes an excessive sense of the narcissistic and self-aggrandising beyond any form of art and music. In this issue 'NIHILISM', we dig and poke to find answers.Everything in the world displeases me: but, above all, my displeasure in everything displeases me.–Friedrich Nietzsche
Ethically sourced and FSC approved and using vegetable-based inks
Limited edition of 666 units hand numbered and stamp embossed
Perfect PUR binding on 250gsm (cover) Offset Paper
100 pages
1700 Total units printed 
The best artworks of 2017. 100 Artists with 100 Bands on 100 Releases. Bands, artists and Heavy Music Artwork commentary. We brought together the finest 2017 album art. 
A4 Hardback (210mmx297mm)
Printed on high gloss 200gm paper
120 Pages 
Limited to 100 
Hand numbered and embossed
Our artist's lifetime commitment and dedication to art are immense. It resonates passion, beauty and intensity beyond words. Centred around the concept of creation and the act of creating. Like in religious tradition the one that creates is divine and of divine intention. Strictly focusing on inspiration, symbolism, philosophy, creativity and imagination.  
A4 Hardback (210mmx297mm) 
Printed on high gloss 200gm paper
196 Pages 
Limited to 100 
Hand numbered and embossed

story:
I have been playing music now for 19 years. That’s more than half the time I’ve been on this earth. I know my music has the power to move people. To make them smile. To make them dance. Music is and always has been my biggest passion in life. I love to share music with anyone who is willing to listen. This album has taken me two years to create. I needed the experiences I had in those two years to write these songs. They are truly my greatest creations yet and knowing that means I need professionals to step in and finish the job.

    I have a great recording engineer, Adam Stehr from Philadelphia. He will be handling the electric side of the album and I know he can truly make it come to life. On the other side of things I have Nathan James in Oceanside, California. He will be recording the acoustic half. There are 10 brand new songs, all of which cover the span of musical styles and emotions. I feel like this is my “white album” but maybe I will call it my “yellow album”. That’s an inside joke if you follow me on social media :)

    I can’t do this without you. I’m a one man band with a gigantic dream. I’ve pulled every string I can find and called in every favor I have for this album. I have some great special guests lined up. I know this album will launch my career to a new level. Will you help me get there?

I know this album will launch my career to a new level. Will you help me get there?

story:
My name is Steffen Prentiss Yazvac, and I am a musician and producer from Minneapolis, MN. Ever since I've been writing music in my teenage years, it has been an avenue for vulnerability and processing my thoughts(initially without knowing it). When I discovered digital recording, I gained access to a whole new palette that opened up all sorts of creative options. I am always striving to improve at the challenge of taking the ideas in my head and carrying them through to a finished piece of art. 

This particular collection of songs deals with deeply emotional subjects and delves deep into fundamental questions that many of us ask. You’ll hear themes about overcoming anxiety, the search for meaning, fighting off nihilism, wrestling with Christianity, challenging rigid views of sexuality, reconciling the past, and looking forward with hope. One of my main endeavors right now is to contribute to the world by letting my voice be heard. This album is a giant step forward in that area. I know that not everyone will like everything I have to say, but I've decided that it is still worth saying. Although these songs express feelings of darkness and hopelessness at times, my end goal in writing them was to inspire and challenge people to move forward despite difficulty, pain, and suffering. 

One big difference that will set this record apart from my previous releases is having other people play on it and spending some extra bucks for pro mastering. I know so many amazing musicians, and I'm very excited to be collaborating with some of them on this recording.  I’ve realized there’s no good reason to limit the arrangement to instruments that I can play, and I believe it will improve my music exponentially. With your help, I’ll be able to make something beautiful that showcases top notch musicians and surpasses the level of production on my previous records. 

The funds you contribute to this record will go to pay the talented musicians that will play on it, mastering, a space to record in, and album art. 

Here is the cost breakdown:

Musicians: $1300

Mastering: $540

Distribution:$90

 

Any way you can help, whether that is financially, sharing on social media or by telling your friends, I appreciate any way that you are willing!

story:
Jamey & Martin

You know Martin (Stubbily Mug) as the enigma. You know Jamey (Royal Ruckus) as the always-positive storyteller and community leader. Together they form the worst white rap duo in the history of the United States of America. And they are spreading.

Your contributiuons go to god-knows-what, gas money, playing more shows, and the filming of a Bandturo documentary--if we raise the goal amount.

Please consider contributing to help fund us bringing Amber on tour with us to make extra stops and feature Martin's friends all over the country in the first ever Bandturo independent artist industry documentary. This is our core goal for this crowdfunding campaign. It is why we are donating our services and merch to the cause: to bring Amber to make the documentary happen.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need:

  1. Funds for rewards to pay Amber to take of her shitty job and still afford her rent, rising health costs, and other bills she pays every month. Please ask us for an itemized rundown of the costs we need to cover for her if it means you deciding to make a contribution.
  2. People, friends, fans, and the curious to spread the word. We are not only promoting our music, we are promoting other indie artists and workers through the documentary, as well as Martin and Amber's app/Alexa skill "Chapter One" which reads a new chapter of a book every day we can to get kids and adults more into reading. With "Chapter One" on Apple, Google, Alexa, and other platforms, anyone can listen to a new first chapter (or two) any time from anywhere for free and decide if they want to pick up the book and read the rest of it. All the books so far are in the public domain and thus free on Google, Gutenberg, and other literary databases and platforms.

What you get:

We've tried really hard to come up with meaningful and authentic rewards for you that are unique and special to you.

  1. Unique and limited quantity rewards you can keep on your hope chest, profile, or eBay account for resale when we get famous.
  2. Access to our exclusive email list where you will the first--and often the only--to get contacted about other rare stuff Martin will be doing over the course of his life.

The Impact

Giving Amber a chance to see more of the world from the confines of an ever more stressful corporate job at a company that's increasingly getting the bad press it deserves is a great human thing to do. If you can help one, you are helping others. If you know Amber, you know she is one of the few people that's ever touched your life with nothing but pure love and positivity. And while our company isn't quite yet at the point to get her the pay and benefits she deserves, we are always finding ways to get her trained, paid, and evolved.

The impact of our "Chapter One" flash briefing can be great. Right now we're just focusing on keeping it running with all the other things on our plate, and we have great faith that over time we will gain an even bigger following to create a huge impact on literary health and imagination in a now super digital, fleeting world.

Keeping funds in the tour and documentary budget allows the artists to focus on their craft and producing a DIY film that exhibits the tough-as-hell, often confusing and misleading independent music industry. This is a core mission of Bandturo and our other companies' duties.

With this campaign, you have the chance to inject directly into the nucleus of everything Martin, Jamey, and Amber are doing.

Risks & Challenges

If we don't raise enough fast enough (we need most of the target goal amount in the first 5 days so Amber can decide to give up her shifts) we will still be able to go on tour, fulfill our contributor's rewards, and get some footage for our documentary. If we don't, the thesis of the documentary will likely change, the hook will probably get softer, and Amber will spend her time continuing to keep herself occupied with helping book tours, 3-D printing cool stuff, and looking for the next step in her career. If we do, we get to focus on bringing you the coolest stuff possible, a great down-to-Earth documentary about our industry, and probably a daily live stream of our adventures featuring Martin the unpredictable idiot-savant-idiot, Jamey the actual good, wholesome person with a lot of secrets, and Amber the poor thing that we drag along with us in a Toyota Rav 4.

Final Thoughts

If you've read this much, we are already in your debt for your time and attention. And we truly mean that. As someone that spends 80% of his time talking with customers that aren't actually paying customers, I understand how far a few minutes of someone's time can go. If I didn't need eye surgery myself and to pay off some debt to get a home I would easily trade a check for the thank you emails I get from helping hundreds of people every year. Nothing feels better than that, and if you've just laid eyes on another one of my projects like this campaign then I have nothing adequate to say about you sticking with me and staying curious as a person. Staying curious is paramount this year. -Martin

story:
Short Summary

Hi Folks,
I did not make a video for this, because I don't beg for what I can earn.
My money situation will look up shortly, but a jump start would be nice to avoid foreclosure.
Plus, I'm getting married, which is how I prefer to be: committed, safe
and sane. This will add to my family's earning power as well!

What We Need & What You Get

I am rushing to get the word out because my earning this month went the opposite direction of my expectation. Now no one knows that I'm traveling to get married, and no one knows how to use this website to help me financially.

I need people to contribute either anonymously or by honoring me with a work order.
After hearing my band leader introduce me for 5 years as someone who drags a sousaphone everywhere, I decided to offer that as a gateway to fundraising, yet still "earn" your money.

My vision for the small business is good, but my marketing knowledge and advertising funds are both low. Perhaps I will gain new customers here, but I anticipate that people who didn't know that I planned to remarry will want to wish me well, seems as how I am travelling to Brazil in order to do so.

I bought the website name SousaPhoto.com, and began to upload photos of people with my sousaphones. You are welcome to join them, if you are so inclined. I can also bring my printer and photographic paper to make a copy on the spot of your SousaPhoto after I take it.
I just want well-meaning people to feel involved after I stayed so quiet for so long.

We will experiment together how to make this happen; I attempted to link a scheduling service and PayPal, along with the announcement capabilities of this crowd fundraising site. You will receive my attention until you get what you expect from me, whether it be paying in advance for an hour of musical fun, a 40 minute lesson, or an appointment to have your photo taken with a sousaphone, possibly while seated in a support chair as pictured. I simply ask publicly to help me here first.

The Impact

My business idea is years old, as is my business licence, but the recession was hard on my ability to self fund virtually anything. Longing for my children to live with me again is depressing when one pays for their original native home and the rent for them to stay someplace else. Even if they don't get to return, I need the car to function so that I can transport the instruments. My puzzle solving skills have increased since being forced to downsize from a minivan to a sedan, but I still have a reputation for bringing lots of equipment in a small space. 
The mental freedom it gives me to have a safe form of transport again would be priceless; and I'm not asking for a handout, just an advance order. 
Or call it a wedding gift; thank you very much for that thoughtfulness, and I apologize for the late notice.

Risks & Challenges

I have not been able to smoke-test the interaction of the scheduling and payment sections of these websites; it seems that my desire to make this procedure free of phone tag with me will not be fulfilled.
However, I trust you good people to be patient as I keep my word that your order will be fulfilled.

Other Ways You Can Help

I do understand that money is tight, even for a small wedding gift of money. But some of you have many more online friends than I do, and spreading the word of mouth about my music demonstrations is very valuable as well. Likewise, if you have expertise in marketing or fundraising or faxing to Learning Centers or Scout groups or Vacation Bible Schools, now you know that I am motivated to take advantage of your advice in how to do this better.
Keep in touch, please.

story:
Short Summary

Our music style has been labeled as The New Cool Guaracha: it blends danceable guaracha and Latin American rhythms along with melodic formulas of swing, blues, and jazz in an atypical and modest format: drums, guitar, and vocals.

Despite our recent formation [2014], we’ve been blessed with great opportunities. One of them was to have the renowned Diego "El Negro" Álvarez as our producer and to be able to work with a team of outstanding music professionals.

In addition to this, we were awarded as “Best New Artist", “Best World Music Artist” and “Best World Music Song” at the Pepsi Music Awards (2015) after releasing Cosas Cursis, our first single (which we composed, produced and recorded on our own, with the help of a couple of dear friends, when we started this journey).

Later, in 2017, Amnesty International gave us recognition as an 'Awareness Emissary' due to our constant support to activities in favor of human rights in Venezuela and the Latin American region.

Concert at la Plaza Los Palos Grandes, Caracas, Venezuela.

 

 

The minimum salary of a Venezuelan is now equivalent to one dollar (a few months after shooting our pitch video); money that can basically cover only one meal for two people at McDonald's. This, perhaps, summarizes why it has been impossible for us to cover the production costs of our first album, which is quite advanced to this point.

Actually, Alessandra and Armando recently moved to Mexico City looking for better opportunities to both grow professionally and be able to help their families who are still in Caracas. All of this happened after the shooting of the pitch video, just a few months ago.

More than ever, we need the support of our friends and family and music lovers around the world, especially outside of Venezuela, as we live under a strict currency exchange control that makes it difficult for our people to access foreign currency. With your support, we can afford the mix, the master, and the copies of this album, which we hope will open more doors and opportunities in this journey that’s just beginning.

10% of the proceeds will be donated to 'Opción Venezuela', an organization dedicated to providing tools and training to Venezuelans, helping them towards entrepreneurship and solution building.

We have played both in national and international festivals, sharing the stage with artists such as: Vicentico (Los Fabulosos Cadillacs, McKlopedia, Buena Fe, Caramelos de Cianuro, Aquiles Báez, C4 Trio, El Pollo Brito, Rawayana, Public Disorder , Gaélica, Soledad Bravo, Aditus, Okills , Yordano, Guillermo Carrasco, Daniel Somaró, El Guajeo by Alfredo Naranjo, and many others.

II Anniversary Concert at Discovery Bar (now closed). Caracas, Venezuela.

 

What We Need [Budget]

For this 11 song album, our goal is $8,000. Here is the breakdown:

  • $ 800 - For ‘Opción Venezuela’ (donation).
  • $ 400  For Indiegogo.
  • $ 3,000 - For mixing and mastering.
  • $ 2,000 - For getting CDs and packaging printed.
  • $ 500 - Artwork by Matías Toro (a wonderful Venezuelan artist).
  • $ 1,300 - For promotion, new photos, promo video, marketing expenses, and covering the costs of delivering IndieGoGo rewards.

 

De Donde Vengo [Videolyric in Spanish] - La Pagana Trinidad

The Impact

It's a no-brainer:

When you support an artist you are helping to bring art into the world! With art comes emotion, healing, and understanding. However it is that you support the arts, you make it possible for artists to keep creating. When you do so, you are guaranteeing that this world will continue to have original art and music.

This particular project gives Venezuelan people proof that there are still ways for Venezuelan artists to create and grow despite the terrible conditions their country is going through. Besides, most of our lyrics spread the word about what's going on in our country.

Anything you contribute to it is also helping us to take the next step in our musical careers and opening more doors and possibilities for the future!

Remember: 10% of the proceeds will be donated to 'Opción Venezuela', an organization dedicated to providing tools and training to Venezuelans, helping them towards entrepreneurship and solution building.

Still from Cosas Cursis (videoclip)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can comfortably contribute monetarily, then every dollar is greatly appreciated and will help us reach our goal. If you can't comfortably contribute, no sweat! Spreading the word over social media can connect us with brand new people who may love our music and who might want to check out our upcoming album.

From La Pagana Trinidad to you- THANK YOU!

Let's make an amazing record!

With love <3

Ale, Armando, and Fer.

 

Sesiones en ñ (Live session) - La Pagana Trinidad
story_txt:
Short Summary
Our music style has been labeled as The New Cool Guaracha: it blends danceable guaracha and Latin American rhythms along with melodic formulas of swing, blues, and jazz in an atypical and modest format: drums, guitar, and vocals.
Despite our recent formation [2014], we’ve been blessed with great opportunities. One of them was to have the renowned Diego "El Negro" Álvarez as our producer and to be able to work with a team of outstanding music professionals.
In addition to this, we were awarded as “Best New Artist", “Best World Music Artist” and “Best World Music Song” at the Pepsi Music Awards (2015) after releasing Cosas Cursis, our first single (which we composed, produced and recorded on our own, with the help of a couple of dear friends, when we started this journey).
Later, in 2017, Amnesty International gave us recognition as an 'Awareness Emissary' due to our constant support to activities in favor of human rights in Venezuela and the Latin American region.

Concert at la Plaza Los Palos Grandes, Caracas, Venezuela.
 
 
The minimum salary of a Venezuelan is now equivalent to one dollar (a few months after shooting our pitch video); money that can basically cover only one meal for two people at McDonald's. This, perhaps, summarizes why it has been impossible for us to cover the production costs of our first album, which is quite advanced to this point.
Actually, Alessandra and Armando recently moved to Mexico City looking for better opportunities to both grow professionally and be able to help their families who are still in Caracas. All of this happened after the shooting of the pitch video, just a few months ago.
More than ever, we need the support of our friends and family and music lovers around the world, especially outside of Venezuela, as we live under a strict currency exchange control that makes it difficult for our people to access foreign currency. With your support, we can afford the mix, the master, and the copies of this album, which we hope will open more doors and opportunities in this journey that’s just beginning.
10% of the proceeds will be donated to 'Opción Venezuela', an organization dedicated to providing tools and training to Venezuelans, helping them towards entrepreneurship and solution building.
We have played both in national and international festivals, sharing the stage with artists such as: Vicentico (Los Fabulosos Cadillacs, McKlopedia, Buena Fe, Caramelos de Cianuro, Aquiles Báez, C4 Trio, El Pollo Brito, Rawayana, Public Disorder , Gaélica, Soledad Bravo, Aditus, Okills , Yordano, Guillermo Carrasco, Daniel Somaró, El Guajeo by Alfredo Naranjo, and many others.


II Anniversary Concert at Discovery Bar (now closed). Caracas, Venezuela.
 
What We Need [Budget]
For this 11 song album, our goal is $8,000. Here is the breakdown:

$ 800 - For ‘Opción Venezuela’ (donation).
$ 400  For Indiegogo.
$ 3,000 - For mixing and mastering.
$ 2,000 - For getting CDs and packaging printed.
$ 500 - Artwork by Matías Toro (a wonderful Venezuelan artist).
$ 1,300 - For promotion, new photos, promo video, marketing expenses, and covering the costs of delivering IndieGoGo rewards.

This particular project gives Venezuelan people proof that there are still ways for Venezuelan artists to create and grow despite the terrible conditions their country is going through. Besides, most of our lyrics spread the word about what's going on in our country.
Anything you contribute to it is also helping us to take the next step in our musical careers and opening more doors and possibilities for the future!
Remember: 10% of the proceeds will be donated to 'Opción Venezuela', an organization dedicated to providing tools and training to Venezuelans, helping them towards entrepreneurship and solution building.

If you can comfortably contribute monetarily, then every dollar is greatly appreciated and will help us reach our goal. If you can't comfortably contribute, no sweat! Spreading the word over social media can connect us with brand new people who may love our music and who might want to check out our upcoming album.
From La Pagana Trinidad to you- THANK YOU!

With love <3

story:
SEE THE NEW UPDATE LISTING BONUS ITEMS THAT WILL NOW COME FREE WITH THE PERKS LISTED!

 

A Tale to Tell:

After many years of composing and gathering some of the best musicians from around the globe, The Fractured Dimension now returns with our most epic work yet. On the Precipice of Many Infinities carries the listener through life and death, through trials and tribulations, all inspired by the turbulent recent life events of primary composer, Jimmy Pitts. These themes, while inspired by personal struggles and triumphs, are completely universal in scope. Who hasn't had their ups and downs as they live life on the Pale Blue Dot? This album is for everyone. This is for you all, the heroes of your own singular journeys. 

Throughout the process of creating this album, many costs have been incurred, and will continue to add up. We have funded everything ourselves up until this point. Yet, to get us over the final hurdle of replication, promotion, and mastering, we approach you, the listeners, to join us in bringing this painstaking creation to life. 

Throughout the process of making this album, there has been the risk of it falling between the cracks of an immensely competitive market, or simply not finding its way to the right listeners. We have poured our hearts, souls, and untold amounts of  time and money into bringing the world something we are personally very proud of, something that will hopefully strike listeners as fresh and inspiring. 

The musicians involved in On the Precipice of Many Infinities are:

Jimmy Pitts (Eternity's End, Equipoise), Jerry Twyford (Pitts Minnemann Project, ex-Scholomance), Hannes Grossmann (Alkaloid, Blotted Science), Vishal J Singh (Amogh Symphony), Danny Tunker (Alkaloid), Marcel Coenen (Ayreon), Carl August Tidemann (Winds, ex-Arcturus), Tom Fountainhead Geldschlager (Defeated Sanity, ex-Obscura), Ron Jarzombek (Watchtower, Spastic Ink), Phil Tougas (First Fragment), Phyllis Rutter (Eynomia), Jason Sadites, Tom Kopyto, Mark Hawkins, Jeremy Barnes, Bill Bruce, Joe Deninzon (Stratospheerious), & Pete Generous.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, spread the word, and tell anyone who listens to adventurous music. These type of projects thrive on the support of a healthy underground. For that, we thank you in advance for your part in making our campaign a success!

story:
Hello Elevator 

Hello Elevator, a Delray Beach, Florida based alternative Hip-Hop band’s eclectic style mixes thought-provoking lyrics with hypnotic melodies for a truly compelling sound. With strong influences from old school Hip-Hop, Trip Hop, R&B and Gypsy music, Hello Elevator forges a significant lane in the Hip-Hop world.

Drummer Cory Ricardy drives the band’s sound with rhythms that powerfully glide through the songs’ variations.

Brazilian born bassist Eric Perna plays a melodic bassline of groove that fuses the intricacies of each song.

Classically trained powerhouse Adelin Jabrayan flips the Hip-Hop script with her electrified violin and arresting vocals.

The Vulture, a cerebral writer & rapper with in-your-face honesty, brings social relevance and vocal integrity to the stage with every performance.

Hello Elevator is ready to perform at venues beyond the typical Delray Beach scene.  With the funding to create a website and an electronic press kit, Hello Elevator can share our music far beyond Delray, introducing its unique vibe nationwide.

All of us have full time jobs and responsibilities, but we are committed to making music our lives.  We need your help with the professional tools we need to share our sound with venues nationwide.  Emerging artists often are trapped by the every day grind of making a living while they struggle to showcase their talent.  We have worked that way for two years and we are ready to push ourselves even harder.  Any donation you contribute pushes us toward a national stage and our personal dreams.

 

Here's what we need:

$1000 for a sweet website

$8000 for 10 audio recordings

$1000 for 3 video recordings

 

PERKS

Our perks for your contributions are fantastic.  From a simple EP download to a private performance, you will feel good about your donation long after you make it!  If for some reason, we find quality professionals to work on our website or recordings and we don't need every penny for the items we've listed, we will use any extra funds on a really dope photo shoot!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us by sharing our Indiegogo campaign!  Indiegogo has made that easy by giving us share tools, so please use them!  

 

Thank you so much from all of us,

Eric, Adelin, Cory & the Vulture!

story:
Adam's Fourth Album!

I am so excited to start work on my new Adam Hawley album, which will be finished in September 2021.  The first three were made with contributions from crowdfunding, and they would not have been the same without your generous help.  If you choose to contribute, not only will you receive the album before it is released but you can also take part in several different and exciting reward options.  Thank you in advance for your consideration and support!

 

The Impact

Your contribution will be integral in the success of this record.  There are many costs associated with making an album such as:

Recording costs-studio time, musicians, mastering

Promotional costs-radio, print, internet campaigns

Photo/video shoot

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't support financial, you could be a huge help in the following ways:

Follow me on social media (Facebook, Instagram, etc.)

Sign up for my mailing list

Share this campaign and let people know

Thank you so much!

story:
Who is ya?


Hey! My name is ya and I am a female solo artist, originally from Moscow, Russia but now living in Spain. I have been making art and engaging in story telling for as long as I can remember, through any form; music, theatre, writing and film. My public music career was born in the midst of the pandemic in 2020 when I began releasing alternative pop singles while working in isolation, one of which was "Movie". The song became the most successful and was what got me signed to a record label Estabrook Road Records in the US with whom I released my debut album "Change Your Body" in January 2021. I included "Movie" in this album, knowing it's my listeners' favourite song and because the song is very important to me as an artist struggling with identity issues, as almost all of us do. "Movie" is a song of me desperately trying to find certainty in my identity, something which I know now is impossible for we are all ever-changing (yes, this is related to my album title). 


"Movie" - a pop anthem for the identity-less? 


I know there are people like me who feel like they need to be their very best self at all times and it's soul wrenching. I want to represent those people and remind them that whatever you are being, is you and you shouldn't ever limit yourself to any one identity. Moreover, "Movie" contributes to the future of pop music; romanticised but raw, groovy but mellow, it contains the stripped down and openly self-conceited demand for attention in the world of postmodern individualism. 


Music video 


I've got to let you know that I have had filmmakers in my family so it runs in my blood. My taste being particularly concerned with Surrealism seen in David Lynch and Federico Fellini. It might be strange to associate this menacing style with a modern pop song like "Movie" but after long, long thought I have come to a visual representation of the song that is peculiar, authentic and perfect to gift to my listeners who love the song more than any other. The plot of the music video is highly tied to the theme of dreams versus reality; I treat my dreams with the same importance as I treat everyday life and I will explore these ideas in the video, creating a unique setting independent of any living or dreaming spectrum.

What I Need & What You Get


For the filming of this music video which with all honestly will be my best video, at least so far, I need to ensure professional production. It's much harder to film a music video during a global pandemic but that won't stop me, I just need some help. I will be working with a filming company in Moscow so I will need to cover the costs of actors, set design, stylist, filming and post production editing; for this 4000 euros is the figure. I have set this campaign on Flexible Goal because even if I don't reach this particular goal I will do the best I can with the help that I do get. Whatever your contribution, I will not forget it or take it for granted.
For this reason, beyond the final product of the music video I have set up perks, depending on the contribution which include being credited in the video, free and new merchandise, ya community membership which includes exclusive content like songs no one else has heard and receiving the music video before anyone else.

 
If you aren't familiar with the song, you can listen here - https://songwhip.com/ya-music/movie2021


Thank you so much for taking your time and considering helping me grow!

story:
Cozy Recordings is...

Cozy Recordings is a full service recording studio aimed at artists as well as business professionals. We offer services for multi tracking and music production with a niche in podcast production and radio commercial development. We also serve as a music school, sub hiring music instructors for one on one lessons in guitar, bass, and drums to start. We hope to grow this concept leaning towards new technology to rewrite the idea of the multimillion dollar studio and steep it down to make it accessible to the community we serve as well as established recording artists.
story_txt:

Cozy Recordings is a full service recording studio aimed at artists as well as business professionals. We offer services for multi tracking and music production with a niche in podcast production and radio commercial development. We also serve as a music school, sub hiring music instructors for one on one lessons in guitar, bass, and drums to start. We hope to grow this concept leaning towards new technology to rewrite the idea of the multimillion dollar studio and steep it down to make it accessible to the community we serve as well as established recording artists.

story:
In March of 2020, just before the lockdown, I had completed work on my latest album, entitled “The Way Is Clear.”

I had been mostly on hiatus from gigging for several months while I put the finishing touches on the music and oversaw the development of the cover art. Little did I know what was looming...

Rock n Roll in the time of Covid

I knew from pressing previous albums that the process typically takes at least four months to complete from the time that the finished audio and art is delivered to the plant. At the time, in quarantine and with everything up in the air and all supply lines grinding to a halt, it occurred to me that it might take even longer and there might not be any shows at which I would sell said vinyl.

The decision was then made to release the album on all digital platforms on June 5th and follow that up with extensive radio and press campaigns to get the word out instead of touring. The idea being that people would all be captive in their homes and could really use the healing light of music in their lives, which I was all too happy to provide. 

This approach was very successful, with the album eventually reaching number 15 on the Jamband charts, getting over 100 radio adds in the US and reaching as high as #220 on the Americana charts. All this, plus a number of glowing reviews in several prominent music media outlets... Big news for a somewhat under the radar artist such as myself who makes music, first and foremost, to satisfy the muse.

The expense of that promotional push took up what funds might have been ordinarily allocated for the vinyl pressing, which is a labor of love and far more costly to produce than compact discs. So, in the aftermath, I began saving my pennies and was able to order the vinyl at the end of October.

My premonition about it taking longer was correct. Here we are, almost 6 months from that time and it’s finally in the finishing stages.

I’m expecting delivery any day and I can hardly wait!

Typically, one engages in crowdfunding to help pay for a project in the works. This time, the project is done and paid for, so funds from this presale will be funneled right in to studio time and production costs for my next recordings currently in the planning stages or already in the works! 

It’s expensive business, this making of records. But, at the end of the day, if it brings some enjoyment and/or gives the listener some cerebral or emotional stimulation, then it’s 100% worth it. Added to that, I am an audiophile and I care deeply about the sonic quality of my own work. I feel that vinyl records are the very best medium for the active listener and the big album art offers a better visual and tactile experience than CDs or, even worse, digital streaming platforms. Vinyl represents active, engaged listening and a pride of ownership in these days when music has been devalued to the point where most people think it should be free, despite all of the expenses involved with creating it and the personal risks and financial instabilities that a working musician must face. 

With that, I hope you will choose and enjoy one of these exciting perks. The creation and appreciation of art is one big collaborative circle of energy and the result is one of mutual elevation. 

Wishing you all lots of love, good health and bright hopes for the future!
