story:
Short Summary

UPDATE-Aug. 4th-The campaign has been extended to Aug. 19th. It has been tough going, but I believe I will meet my goal..........whatever happens, this record will be made.....we may have to make adjustments, but it will be made. So, take heart and believe and help me push this over the edge!

It's time to make a new record. The last record, Some Comfort, was crowdfunded right here on Indiegogo. I consider it the best record I ever made......Fear Nothing grew up. I could not have made it without you.

I now have a collection of songs that i've written or co-written with Beth Neilson Chapman, Graham Gouldman from 10cc, rising star Robert Vincent, and my recent UK tour co-hort, Kelli Jones. Most of the songs were written during the Buddy Holly Foundation's songwriting weeks and a couple were specifically geared towards the songs Buddy Holly and my Dad wrote together for the Everly Brothers.

I had not intended to make a new record this year, but this crazy lockdown changed things for me. All of my live shows have been moved to later in the winter and 2021, so, like everyone else.....the world stopped for awhile and I had some time to think.....maybe too much time!  All of my records start with a list of songs, so I went to the piano with my guitar and a notepad and started playing the songs i'd written. I got inspired. I got excited about the possibilities. 

I called my friend Bob Britt, who plays guitar with Bob Dylan, and asked him if he would be interested. He said, "let me check my book" and immediately came back and said "yes!".........all of his shows with Dylan for June and July were canceled. I called Garry Tallent from Springsteen's E Street Band and got the thumbs up. I called my engineer/co-producer Mike Esser........we spoke for 2 hours about who would play on the record, the how and where we would record, and then he said, "hey Kev, I've got to get going. I've got to be downtown by 2pm"......I said, "cool, where are you going?"......he said, "they have a food kitchen set up and I need to get down there and get something to eat"................right then and there I knew we had to make this record happen. I said, "dude, we are doing this record and as soon as it gets funded you are getting an advance".................that kid has worked his butt off to build Sundog Studios in East Nashville and this lockdown has nearly put him under. It's time to go to work.

     Me with the amazing Sammy Barrett and Mike Esser during the recording of Some Comfort

One of the most exciting conversations was with Ron Oates. He was my Dad's piano player and arranger on all of his productions......starting from Bobby Goldsboro's "Honey" and "Watching Scotty Grow". For those who may be reading this and not aware. My father was Bob Montgomery......his career started with Buddy Holly as a teen and he had a 60 year career in the music business.....producing such artists as Bobby Goldsboro, Waylon Jennings, Tammy Wynette, Janie Fricke, Razzy Bailey, Marty Robbins, Joe Diffie, Vern Gosdin and on and on. Ron Oates was my father's muse and right hand man and an integral part of my childhood.......because Dad was always in the studio and that was where I was any chance I got.  I sent Ron a song and asked him if he wanted to be involved, and then we came up with calling Dad's main studio players in to record with us. I've wanted to record with these guys for years, and for SO many reasons.......this will be special. 

So, that is the plan. I've got some songs I believe in, and my friends are some of the most talented musicians and singers in the world. We will record in Nashville in Mike Esser's Sundog Studios, and when we need a studio with a piano will go to Blackbird Studios. We will livestream much of the recording process so everyone can tune in daily. YOU will be able to tune in daily to see the progress and put in your two cents via the comments. 

Some Comfort from the last record.......funded by YOU 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $15,750 to complete this project and deliver it to you. I'll have the cd pressed and mailed out at the very latest by Dec. 1st......in time for Christmas, but the goal will be to ship them as soon as the record is complete, so could be even sooner. 

The monies will go to travel, food, studio time, musicians, pressing the cd.........I've been very conservative. 

You will get to tune into the live recording process via Facebook Live and Youtube. During the making of "Some Comfort" we live streamed from the studio and it was awesome to be able to see comments and your thoughts. 

I'm excited about the "perks"......my 1993 A&M debut Fear Nothing is very hard to find and I'm now making it available for the first time behind a password protected area of my website where I'll put some never seen photos from the recording, and go into detail about the recording process.......a process that defined every record i've ever done going forward-largely because of my producer, Ed Cherney. What I learned from the making of Fear Nothing has informed every record i've made since. 

The signed copies of Another Long Story and True.......art begats art, and I figured what better way to make a new record than to sell those two records. I happen to have copies on hand and since I can't go out and play shows and sell them at the merch table........sell them as a perk! Even if you already have a copy......there is always someone's birthday, or Christmas coming up. Another Long Story was released in 1999 and features Doug Pettibone on guitars. True has guest slots by Ashley Monroe and Andrea Zonn. 

100% the most exciting perk is Good Thing will now be in Vinyl!!!!!!!......this will be my first printing of any of the cds in vinyl. I got a record player this past Christmas and have found myself yearning to listen to records on vinyl lately........the whole process just makes it feel so much sweeter. I'm excited about this..........

The Virtual Concert perk.........I've enjoyed doing live webcasts from my dining room for the past 10 years or so, and one of the main things I love is seeing the comments scroll past. I find it interesting what people respond to..........which songs move them. These comments can literally bolster me when I need it most. This perk will be more one on one.......a two way street. I'll play the songs to be recorded and will welcome your input. You can even play me a song!

The Backstage Studio perk........my favorite place on Earth is inside a studio making a record. I guess it harkens back to seeking to be in the studio with my dad every chance I got when I was a kid. I spent years sitting on the couch in studios around Nashville watching him make records. I can smell the coffee.....hear the laughter from the jokes that are bandied about in the control room.....watch brilliant session guys take a song and turn it into magic. YOU will have the seat on the couch to hang with us while we try to create magic. You will be another member of the band when we take lunch or dinner break. Who knows? Maybe you even get handed a tamborine. We'll let you know if it works! I was invited to a Jackson Browne session once in Santa Monica. I played my producer Ed Cherney and a collection of folks the freshly made video for "Red-blooded American Boy" and after it ended Jackson invited me into the studio with the second engineer.......just the three of us. He played "All Good Things" from his in progress "I'm Alive" record. After it ended I said, "I'd love to put a harmony vocal on that"......Jackson said, "I think we have David Crosby coming in for that"...........I let it rest! Ha! It was less cowbell for me and more exit stage left................anyway, come join us. 

       Mike McAdam and Ken Coomer listening to playback during "Some Comfort" sessions

The Backyard Concert perks........as a veteran of four 50 States in 50 Days tours.....as you can imagine.....i've done more than a few house concerts. We live in strange times these days, but I refuse to believe that we are going to be prisoners to this pandemic indefinitely. So, I included this "house concert" option as an outdoors perk. By April of 2021,  I'm sure it will be ok to move it indoors if that is what you would like to do. You can invite as few or many friends to this event as you like. I have the sound system and will come to your home and play a full show. I actually prefer house concerts to regular venues. 

 

Triple Pack of signed cds perk.......I've included a range of options for someone who wants to help by buying cds. This particular one contains the new cd, plus copies of True and Another Long Story.

Executive Producer perk...........wow, first of all, if you go for this perk.......you are my hero. You will have an open invitation to come be with us in the studio while we make this record..........top to bottom. You will be credited as an Executive Producer on the album credits. This could put the project over the top.

The Impact

           As i've been putting this together I've suddenly realized it has been 10 years since you guys helped me fund "Some Comfort"............my son Beau was around 4 years old then. It was a full circle moment for me to have him with me in the studio for some of the recording. Watching him on the couch in the studio...........quietly observing, reminded me of myself as a child. This is one of my favorite photos of all time............Beau with Mike Esser at the mixing desk. 

Beau is now 15 and nearly as tall as me. It's time to record a new record!

Some Comfort was truly one of the best experiences i've had in the studio for several reasons. I broke through writer's block that had plagued me for years......even in the Fear Nothing days. I literally wrote most of the songs on the day.....in the studio......and then called my friends to come play on the song fresh from writing it. I started writing "The Greatest Love That Never Was" at 9am......I had already scheduled the band to come in at 12 noon to record.......John Hobbs showed up at 10:30am. I was stuck on what to do in the bridge.......I asked John if he'd help me write it. We had it 15 minutes later. The band showed up and nailed it in the first take. Check it out:

Some Comfort saw my musician friends come together to breath beautiful life into my songs. My friends and supporters came together to make it happen financially, and we all came together in the live webcasting of the record. There were times when it was 2am..........and I could see a few people viewing the webcast and chiming in.........I asked their opinion.......we came together to make the record. 

I know that Good Thing can be all that and more. I LOVE this photo of Ken Coomer, James Haggerty, and Mike McAdam. I asked them to look pensive while they studied to song's changes.......of course they became big goofballs. 

I know these are strange times we are living in and it probably isn't the best time to be launching a crowdfunding campaign. I get it. I'm in the same boat. I appreciate you taking the time to read this far................if you can join us on the journey.............then please check out the perks and see if something suits you. 
Beau sitting on Ken Coomer's drums during the recording of Some Comfort. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

100 percent need everyone's help in getting the word out. 

1) Check out the share tools at the top of this page. Share it on your social media. This helps. Don't forget to make it personal when you share. If the music or live shows has affected you then put in a personal blurb with the share.

2) Follow me on my facebook page http://www.facebook.com/kevinmontgomeryes

3) Follow me on my instagram page http://www.instagram/kevmontgomery615

4) Follow me on Twitter http://www.twitter.com/kevinmontgomery

story:
Hello Everyone,

 

For those of you who don’t know me, my name is Cody Apache Grosse and I am a musician based out Chicago IL. I've created this Indiegogo because I want to ask for your help, but before we get into that I want to tell you my story. That story starts about 5 years ago. I had just moved to Chicago for work. I was wide-eyed and eager to experience a life in business in the big city. I had a great job, I was making great money, I was going out all the time, but I wasn’t happy. I thought that if I just worked hard enough and climbed the corporate ladder, that one day I would be satisfied. So I did just that and I worked around the clock to earn the promotion that I wanted so badly. When that day finally came, guess what,  I got my promotion but it didn’t make me happy. So I decided to do something crazy.  I quit my job, sold my house and bought a one-way ticket overseas with nothing but a backpack and a guitar. I travelled from London as far as Japan. And by the end of my journey, I knew that music was the one thing that would make me happy and what I wanted to dedicate my life to.

 

Over the last 5 years I have been practicing my craft. I've released bodies of work containing music and visuals. I'm proud of that work but more importantly, I have been learning from that work. Every step I've taken up until this point has led me to what will come next, and this is where I need your help.

 

For the last 2 years, I have been working on a body of work that I believe will become my magnum opus, or in other words, the project I believe will come to define my artistry. I don't want to ruin the surprise so I won't go into too much, but I can tell you this project contain 3 main elements. I will be releasing a 5 song EP that will be accompanied by a 20-minute limited series as well as a 24-page conceptual editorial.

 

As you have come to probably guess none of this is going to be cheap, and this is why I am asking for your help. In total, this project should require $50k to complete. Over the course of these last 6 months, I have been saving up as well as working with brands to raise funds for this project. But ultimately you are going to be the one to help me pull this project across the finish line. Every dollar you donate is going to the progression of my art. 

 

I wanted to make sure to give you something in return for your support so I gave a lot of thought into some unlockable perks. Some of these range all the way from unreleased music, to a copy of the signed conceptual editorial, even a private performance for you and your friends.

 

I can’t thank you enough and I am truly honored to be creating my passion with you.

 

Love,

Cody Apache Grosse

story:
Who We Are

Paper Crane is a collective of artists/musicians from St. Petersburg, FL. It is also the name of the DIY warehouse event space from which we have operated over the last few years. The space itself is beloved by the community, with a rich history of hard work and love put in over the years by many artists who preceded the current collective. Starting as a milk bottling plant, the space has had many transformations. In the last 10 years it has changed hands many times as it has become a hub for local artists, each adding something to elevate the space and its potential. With each change of hands, the space has taken on a different look, persona and often a different name. 

The current collective has had the tremendous honor and luck of operating the space for the last 2+ years, with the goal of hosting events to enrich and empower the local art and music community in St. Petersburg. 

 

What Happened?

While our space has afforded us incredible opportunity, it is also fraught with problems and challenges, not the least of which being the general condition of the building. 

In January 2020, we had a fire inspection which left us suddenly unable to operate out of the space that we, and so many others, have put our hearts and souls into. The resultant inspection report deemed the space unfit for assembly unless considerable repairs be made, which the owner was unwilling to do, and which are well beyond our means. It is simply not feasible to attempt to save the space itself; the general condition of the building is such that making such a large financial investment to bring it up to code would be tremendously foolish.

It is with a heavy heart that we realize the need to relinquish the space and move our operations elsewhere. And while it is sad to lose such a beloved place, this is also an opportunity to create something new. Something safer, longer lasting, more immersive, more empowering to the community, and less encumbered by the myriad challenges of a decaying building. 

 

What We're Asking

We are seeking donations to further the mission of our art collective and event production crew, Paper Crane. Our primary goal is to find a new space where we can continue to produce fantastical and immersive experiences and bolster the creative community. This will be a considerable undertaking for our small art collective, and we are looking to you to help us get there. Your donations will go directly toward a new space for Paper Crane.

 

What's Our Plan?

In the short term, out of necessity, we are making our operations mobile and bringing our unique brand of event production into other spaces in a "pop-up" format. 

In the long term, Paper Crane is in need of a new home. This space has been our workshop, our meeting space, event venue, creative hub and space to collaborate with and provide resources to other local artists. It has been our home. We are committed to finding a new place where we can regularly host events that enrich and empower the community, and where we can continually transform the space to consistently provide new experiences to our guests.

Something safer, longer lasting, more immersive, more empowering to the community, and less encumbered by the myriad challenges of a decaying building. 
 
What We're Asking
We are seeking donations to further the mission of our art collective and event production crew, Paper Crane. Our primary goal is to find a new space where we can continue to produce fantastical and immersive experiences and bolster the creative community. This will be a considerable undertaking for our small art collective, and we are looking to you to help us get there. Your donations will go directly toward a new space for Paper Crane.
 
What's Our Plan?
In the short term, out of necessity, we are making our operations mobile and bringing our unique brand of event production into other spaces in a "pop-up" format. 
In the long term, Paper Crane is in need of a new home. This space has been our workshop, our meeting space, event venue, creative hub and space to collaborate with and provide resources to other local artists. It has been our home. We are committed to finding a new place where we can regularly host events that enrich and empower the community, and where we can continually transform the space to consistently provide new experiences to our guests.

story:
Dear friends and followers,

A little less than a year ago I felt the urge to make a big step in my life: at the age of 47, I debuted as a composer with my first piano solo piece 'Tristesse'. I could not have imagined the support it would get from all of you, and I cannot explain what it means to me to hear you play my work and make it your own. 

Now, a year later, I feel the courage to release my first full length debut album. It will be called "Images" and will be out on September 25th. I can hardly wait...
I asked you in my newsletter and on my social media in which form you would like to have the album and many of you have responded, of which I'm very grateful. I've listened to you and want to make sure that all of this is available. To manufacture all these different things such as vinyl, cd's and books of sheet music, it would be so great if you would become part of this process and finalise the establishment of this album together.

If by any chance we would exceed our set goal, we would use it for the marketing and promotion for the album so that it can reach even more ears. 

I like being an independent musician. Rather than playing the game that's called "the music industry" it feels so good to be directly connected to my fans and to go on my own pace and to listen to what you give back to me. 

I promise you that this album is the best that I have to give you, and that I will continue my path as an artist and a composer. I hope, that one day when I'm able to travel and play live again, we'll meet each other so that I can thank you in person. 

I will make sure that any item you order, will reach you at least a week before it will be released into the rest of the world. Already looking forward to hearing what you think of it.

I hope you stay in good health, 

With love,

DeLange

story:
Pre-Order our LP. People Are The Worst!

Hello there reader, We're Cheap Meat, a distinguished Alternative Rock band from London, England. We released an EP back in 2016, got lots of lovely press, played some amazing shows, and then Back in 2018, we finished recording our debut LP.

2 years have passed, and a lot has happened:

  • We stopped working with the one we were signed to!
  • We lost our booking agent!
  • We started our own label, The Jerk Store!
  • Matt had two kids!
  • Pete started producing and performing Makola!
  • Ross went to Edinburgh as a comedian!
  • Ross and Pete got diagnosed with mental health issues!

So we've been busy living life and dealing with all that comes with it. We're immensely proud of this album, and we want to give it a good chance in the world. We've fronted the cash to get PR for it to help spread the word, but we need your help...

Here's where you come in.

We want to press this record physically; it's got some beautiful artwork designed by Chris Hilton and illustrated by Stephen Alan Yorke, it deserves a physical pressing. But to do that costs money and that's where you can help!

A 180gram vinyl run with good sleeves for the artwork costs around £1500. We've already spent around that on PR, and we've spent thousands more making it, which is why the target is at £2000 (but by all means lets go over that!)

We want to keep it to a nice limited run for the folks that supported us. (And frankly, 150 is probably pushing it!) 

But we don't want to give you the vinyl, folks like merch; we sure do so we've gone and made some!

You can get t-shirts, tote bags, posters, and for the super cool gang, an hour with us on zoom.

Any money received goes back into recouping the costs of pressing the records, not to mention the thousands of pounds we spent, making it, the music videos, touring, and countless other ways bands can spend money.

Risks & Challenges

Not many risks here, the only issue would be if the vinyl pressing takes longer than we anticipate, I've put March as a rough deadline. If we hit our target before the 29th of January, I'll get the order in sooner. The sooner it's in, the quicker we'll get them, but we're an indie label, so there are big rich major labels ahead of us. 

If we don't hit our target, but you've pre-ordered the album, we're still going to press it, so you'll get a copy of the album no matter what. Just means we'll be on stale bread and soup for the start of 2021. 

Alright, I'm in. I've given you some sweet cash, now what?

Spread the word! Share this campaign! Tell people about us, your new favourite band!

story:
Join our Commissioning Project!!!

Trumpet players Ashley Killam and Carrie Blosser founded Diversify the Stand as a way to expand our musical libraries and learn from underrepresented voices in music. We are commissioning the first-ever progressive solo book for trumpet and piano with 12 new works by diverse composers. Our book will include works of varying skill levels for beginner, intermediate, and advanced solo trumpet performers. These are also great pieces to program in recitals for trumpeters of all ages and skill levels. 

Perks:

We have a few tiers and ‘perks’ for different donation amounts. Give as you are able. We appreciate your support.

$10 - Bronze Sponsor - Social media shoutout on Diversify the Stand's platforms

$25 - Bronze Sponsor - Social media shoutout on Diversify the Stand's platforms

$50 - Silver Sponsor - Inclusion in our Sponsor thank yous in the published collection and a shoutout on Diversify the Stand's social media platforms

$125 - Gold Sponsor - Digital copy of the published collection, early access to the published collection, inclusion in our Sponsor thank yous in the published collection and a shoutout on Diversify the Stand's social media platforms

$300 - Platinum Sponsor - Printed AND digital copy of the published collection, early access to the published collection, inclusion in our Sponsor thank yous in the published collection, and a shoutout on Diversify the Stand's social media platforms

$1000 - Platinum Sponsor - Your choice of dedication for one of the solos (this could be in memory of a person, place, or thing) - we will work with you to find the piece that best fits with your dedication. You also receive a printed AND digital copy of the published collection, early access to the published collection, inclusion in our Sponsor thank yous in the published collection, and a shoutout on Diversify the Stand's social media platforms
 

To create the book, we are asking for your help! 

Our funding goal is $11,000. Here's the Breakdown!

  • Composer commission fees: $7,000

  • Indiegogo fees: $1,000

  • Self-publishing, copyrighting, and printing fees: $3,000

Total cost: $11,000
Total cost MINUS outside donations: $6,995

Our printing and shipping process only allows printed copies to be shipped within the United States and to Canada - but digital copies are available to everyone!

If we surpass our crowdfunding goals, we will commission additional composers!

60% of all profits will go back to the composers and 40% of the profits will be put toward creating book 2!
 

Timeline

Our books will be sent to print in September 2021. Early release copies will be sent to eligible sponsors in October 2021. The digital and printed copies of the book will be available for purchase beginning November 2021.

 

We are also receiving outside donations to fund this project and will update this page with our current donation numbers as we receive them. 

 

If we do not reach our goal, we will still be following through and finishing the project. If the funding goal is not met, the two of us will split the remaining costs needed to fund this project. 
 

The composers we have commissioned for this project:

Karen Amrhein - http://karenamrhein.com/ 

Zoe Cutler - https://www.zoecutler.com/ 

Devin Clara Fanslow - https://soundcloud.com/devin-fanslow 

Gala Flagello - https://www.galaflagello.com/ 

Gina Gillie - https://sites.google.com/a/plu.edu/gina-gillie-... 

Marcus Grant - https://www.msgrantmusic.com/ 

HyeKyung Lee - https://www.hyekyunglee.com/ 

Yukiko Nishimura - http://yukikonishimura.com/ 

Alonso Malik Pirio - https://www.alonsomalikpirio.com/ 

Lara Poe - https://www.larapoe.com/ 

Rylee Short - https://soundcloud.com/rdshort 

Angela Elizabeth Slater - https://www.angelaslatercomposer.co.uk/ 

 

Other ways to contribute:

If you are unable to contribute financially, there are other ways to help! We would love it if you shared our campaign with family, friends, colleagues, trumpet players, and students!

 

Diversify the Stand also has a monthly newsletter we use to send out information on all our projects, including this! Sign up for our newsletter (www.diversifythestand.com) to receive notifications once our book is published. 

 

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you so much for the support!

-Carrie & Ashley

story:
Organ music and hockey just go together.


James Witherite — jazz organist, play-by-play commentator for the University of Delaware hockey teams, sometimes on-ice official, sometimes AHL anthem singer, sometimes PA announcer, and yes, sometimes hockey organist — here.

If you're a hockey fan, you know you know that organ music is the perfect soundtrack to the game.

If you've played, coached or officiated the game, you know first hand that there's something about a live organist that gets you just that more amped up for the next shift.

Don't believe me? Have a listen below. 

 

As you can probably guess, live organists at sporting events aren't exactly commonplace anymore. But, in the past two years, I've had the good fortune to bring the classic vibe to countless Philadelphia Jr. Flyers (EHL) games, the 2019 College Hockey Mid-America tournament, and the 2020 Atlantic Youth Hockey League and Collegiate Hockey Federation playoffs. Through this project, once complete, I can help bring that same "game day experience" to your club, school or college — or even beer league team — from the opening strains of the American and Canadian national anthems all the way to the final horn.

Expected Costs

While I will arrange, perform, engineer and produce the entirety of this record — and thus not have to pay for studio time or an engineer — there's still considerable cost involved in a product of this scope. Most of that cost can be attributed to two elements:

• Mechanical licensing. For every song that does not exist in the public domain ("Lady of Spain," anyone?), I must pay the owners of that song 9.1¢ per unit produced for the right to record their song. And, let's face it: people want to hear popular music a heckuva lot more than original bebop and Latin jazz at sporting events.

So, if I print 500 copies of this record, that's $45.50 per song right there. Needless to say, it adds up.

• Replication. Pressing CDs and USB drives costs money, too, from production of glass masters to printing sleeves and liners.

What You (and your team!) Will Get

Not only am I no stranger to the hockey rink, but I'm no stranger to the studio and the radio airwaves, either. I've recorded three albums of original music in the last decade, one with a 17-piece big band and two with my Pittsburgh-based organ trio. This record will be a massive departure from those before it, though, as it is geared specifically toward sports teams and arena DJs to bolster their game-day playlists.

Once the project is complete, you will have a high-quality record (in CD or USB drive form) featuring stirring renditions of both the American and Canadian national anthems, a number of traditional "crowd chants," and a wide variety of popular songs — from classic rock to R&B and beyond — reimagined in the hockey organ vein. The playlist will offer something for every situation (yes, net-front dustups, too!) and every generation, and will be sure to evoke the "classic hockey feel" for players and spectators alike. 

Why Not Just Put It All On iTunes?

American copyright law as it pertains to recorded music is still pretty archaic, to be honest. For an independent artist like myself, who doesn't have the aid of record label staff to dot every i and cross every t, mechanical licensing for digital downloads is ... well, eep. Suffice it to say that it's downright cumbersome. As such, for a project so driven by non-original music, keeping it to CD and USB drive forms will do a lot to simplify the production and bookkeeping processes.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute — or don't have any direct ties to any hockey teams, that's OK! Here's how you can still help:

Share this campaign with friends who play (or have kids who play) hockey
Follow my social media networks: Facebook | Twitter
Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Estrella on the rise

Hola Amigos!

What a time to be alive and to be following your dreams. If there is one thing I've learned, it is that there is no time like the present. Life is too short to not believe in yourself. 

With that being said, I am here before you to share my song and story. About 4 years ago, I had that AHA moment where I realized that I no longer wanted to waste my time or talent on jobs that didn't support either. Slowly, I began to invest in myself. I started writing music, I found an artist to help produce my songs, I revisited voice lessons, and as of August 2020, I quit my job in Honolulu, Hawaii and moved back to Northern California to pursue this dream full time.  

I choose the stage name Estrella because it is my maiden name and it means star in spanish. My hispanic heritage combined with Native American roots and Scandinavian blood is a part of me that you are meeting now!

With an A+ team and community support, we have gotten ourselves this far and now need your help to get us to the next level. 

 

What Is Needed & What You Get

Let me break it down for you. As a team we have budgeted where this money will be put to good use. And being able to be transparent with where it will be used is extremely important to us.

With the money raised from this campaign, I will be able to:

  • Finish paying for my EP, a labor of love that has spanned over the last 3 years! With all the amazing help of creatives, this project has cost $4,000.
  • Launch an official website. It's no joke getting a website done, and one thing I've learned is that it matters! We have budgeted $1,500-$2,000 to make this happen.
  • Merchandise!  Estrella fan club unite! If you know me, you know that I love fashion! I have plans to start with simply designed items to sell, with a conscious effort to use more sustainable materials. Also, I will offer limited edition Estrella Vibe Tribe merchandise specially for you! From your caring donation, we have budgeted $1,000 of our ask towards this exciting venture.
  • The remaining $3,000 will be invested back into the music! A portion of it we will use to get new equipment so that we can sound even better live! We will also be investing in dope content, like music videos, collaborations with more established artists - cause their time is money! We know that :) -, and getting back into the studio!

The Impact

My team and I have a collective vision to bring healing and light to the world through music and action. We believe in community and understand that living in a state of self-acceptance, self-growth, and elevated thoughts is a powerful tool. 

With your contribution, we will be able to continue on this journey and extend our reach to more communities around the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Support does not have to come in the form of money! I appreciate you simply for visiting this page and reading more about my journey.

Indiegogo provides some helpful share tools! So please, share away, get the word out, let people know about Estrella! Word of mouth is so powerful!

And that's all there is to it.

Mahalo and Aloha!

story:
Toy Gory 2 Overview

Underground Hustlin', LLC and Forgotten Prophets Studios are teaming up once again to bring you Toy Gory 2, another stunning combination of hip hop, heavy metal, still frame action figure animation and motion picture starring Jamie Madrox of Twiztid and other elite underground emcees.

We are offering our contributors the chance to control the destiny of the project and even feature their likeness or brand in the video. 

Check out the original Toy Gory now:

 

All backer packages include a double feature DVD of Toy Gory 1 & 2 including behind the scenes featurettes and lots of bonus content.

story:
Tell Me To Stay - The Album

My name is Rob Murphy and I'm and east coast Singer/Songwriter from Cape Breton Island, Canada. In 2020 I was named by CBC Music as one of the Top 10 Artists to watch out for and one of the top finds of 2020 by Roots Music Canada. I was going to reinvest my live show income on this project but due to covid restrictions I've gone from 6 shows a month to 1 show.

I've already completed 5 out of the 12 Songs for this Album. The Album is being recorded at Broken Clock Studio and Mixed and Mastered by multiple East Coast Music Award Winner - Jamie Foulds.  There are 5 Songs that I co-wrote with Songwriters from Australia & Nashville over the pandemic. All Songs are ready for production.

Songs from the Album will be a mix of Alt. Country, Folk with a Bruce Springsteen, Jason Isbell, Damien Rice feel. There will be 2 Videos produced as well to give traction on Social Media. My last Video Ghosts has over 25,000 views.

My dream is to finish and release this album as I've been a Musician for over 15 years. I've worked hard and was on my way to complete this when we were struck by the pandemic. I'll be selling Merch, CD's and Vinyl for online sales of the Album. I'm also hiring local Musicians on this project.

My goal is to raise $5000.00 to complete this project. Monies raised will be for the following:

Studio Time, Mixing and Mastering, Video, Hiring Musicians, CD & Vinyl.

If I do not reach my goal I'll be cutting back to 10 Songs and 2 Videos. I'm a full time Musician and have proven that I take this very serious. From 2019 when I was named a Breakout Artist by the East Coast Music Association to the success I've had with a pandemic going on I believe you can rest assure that you'll be very pleased to be part of this project. My Production and Videos already released are top quality an you'll see that this is my passion.

There's Perks!!

You'll receive access to finished Songs before they're released. With your pledge of $25.00 or more you'll receive immediate access to the title track "Tell Me To Stay". A pledge of $50.00 or more you'll receive 5 tracks as they are Produced including Immediate access to "Tell Me To Stay". A pledge of over $100.00 you'll receive the 5 tracks plus a Full Length Vinyl Album 30 days before it's released for sale. Every dollar helps even a small amount is greatly appreciated to help make this dream come true. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to pledge you can always stream my music at this link, https://linktr.ee/robmurphmusic

story:
Our Story

Greetings curious strangers, beloved enemies, and cherished friends! We are Spectre Jones, an indie rock band based in Los Angeles, CA. Just before the recent and unanimously disliked public health crisis, we were busy working on some singles and tweaking our live set in preparation for a long strand of shows lined up in 2020.

And then it was as if society as we know it quickly changed from concrete to abstract, from real to surreal. To be fair, things were already getting a bit surreal before we came into contact with the virus, and that’s not to mention everything else that’s happened and come to light in the past year. But if we’re all being honest, not being able to hug your friends and family out fear of them getting sick and dying just really hits different. 

So, as we sat stuck at home and wondered how we could help, some songs flew in through an open window and gave us hope that something joyously better than the old “normal” is coming on the other side of all this chaos. And we want to share those tidings of joy with you and with the world. But, we have to properly record it all first, so we could really use your help!

This campaign marks the start of Spectre Jones’ debut album-making process and will allow listeners a front-row seat to all the action as we fly by the seat of our pants and see what happens! Just kidding, we are (and have been) planning very meticulously (see below). Those who choose to support us will get to watch us make a full-length record together literally for the first time! And for us, anyone who chooses to support us in this process is playing a vital role in bringing these songs to life and spreading a little more love and hope in the world. And that’s where it’s at.

 

What We Need & What You Get

So here’s our game plan for recording and how you can help! We’ll be tracking at Boulevard Recording, Clay Blair’s legendary room down in Hollywood in which we’ve been dying to record ever since we learned that Pink Floyd did some work on The Wall there. And we’ll have the privilege of working with engineer/producer extraordinaire James Krausse again, with whom we’ve been dying to collaborate with since working on Nobody Else!

We're going to be facing some major costs: these include recording for an entire week at the studio, mixing and mastering the record, and a bunch of other costs like photoshoots for album cover art and getting our album out to all of you. Crowdfunding gives us the ability to record with some of the best and ensure we can share our best music yet with the world.

 

Risks & Challenges

This is our first record together, which means the experience will be filled with a lot of “firsts.” While we’ve played so many hours of music together, we haven’t gotten to create a full body of work in this capacity before. A process like this isn’t without its challenges, but we’re excited to learn how to communicate and create in a new way together. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand the pandemic has had an overwhelming economic impact on many folks! If you are unable to contribute at this time we completely get it, and that’s okay! But if you still want to spread the word, go ahead and share this link with your friends and fam. We love and appreciate you all!

story:
Introduction/Background

Hi, I am Dain Norman, singer/songwriter, musician, and producer out of Tacoma, WA. Over the past 5+ years or so I have been acting as my own manager,  and booking agent, traveling and performing all around the states, both solo and with my band The Chrysalis Effect, often sleeping in my car and roughing it. I have been putting out self-produced music recorded at home, and have written 400+ songs. I play the guitar, drums, bass guitar, cello, piano, harmonica, mandolin, upright bass, and ukulele. My introduction to music was at age 4 listening to 1950's rock n' roll vinyls with my grandfather, then at age 10, classical music, I started playing the cello through my school's orchestra program. Throughout my entire childhood, my family moved around the country, so I essentially grew up in many places. I consider myself most from FL. My father/step-dad passed away when I was 18, and he always believed in me and my music, which has had a lasting impact on me. I also have a 6-year-old son, so my time is split between working, family, and being a performing musician. Some of my early musical influences included Elvis Presley, The Beach Boys, The Stray Cats, The Beatles, Little Richard, The Ramones, Nirvana, and Led Zeppelin. 

 

Objective

 

This campaign is to raise funds to record with legendary producer Jonathan Plum, part owner of London Bridge Studios in Seattle, WA. He has produced bands and artists such as Pearl Jam, Alice in Chains, Blind Melon, Temple of Dog, Soundgarden, and Brandi Carlile. This opportunity for me would be life-changing, I have never had the opportunity to record in an actual studio. I have always had to work jobs in addition to being a traveling musician so this opportunity would potentially allow me to be a full-time musician and spend more time with my family, especially my young son. I am looking to record an EP, titled "Shades Of Blue", a collection of songs I wrote that are a reflection of the Covid-19 pandemic and what we collectively, and what I personally endured in 2020. Along with some good old, fun, feel-good tunes, which I feel we all need a little bit of right now. 

With your help in this campaign, it would honestly mean the world and heavens to me and would be a dream come true in itself. I have literally fantasized for hours on end about how my songs would sound in a proper studio environment. I feel the type of songs I write would really flourish and bloom working with Jonathan.

I am looking to raise $2,500 for 2-3 days of recording time at London Bridge with Jonathan Plum. We plan on recording the songs with vintage 1970’s gear to tape. The basic tracks (drums/bass/guitar) will be performed and recorded live in studio like they used to in the old days, to capture the live energy, power, and emotion of a band at full force.

Perks for donations. If you would like to opt out of receiving the perks for your donation that is completely okay, no pressure! The perks include my past releases and future releases, with every higher amount you donate it builds on the previous perk. So depending on what you donate, you will receive all past perks, plus the new ones! 

If we don’t reach the $2,500 goal, whatever funds that are there will be used towards recording time, and/or buying higher quality gear to record better quality sounds at home at the very least. Anything truly helps!

Past releases-

Spotify-

https://open.spotify.com/artist/2MMnmNLXlafVJU5...

Bandcamp-

Https://Dainnormanmusic.bandcamp.com

What It Means 

This experience would allow me to reach a broader audience than I ever have before, and it will help me come closer to realizing a life-long dream, and hopefully introduce new people to my songs, and hopefully, those songs will help them cope with their everyday life, and fall in love again. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate and would like to help, sharing this campaign in your emails, on social media, and with friends and family will make a world of a difference alone! Spreading the word about this would be greatly appreciated, and very helpful!

Thank you so much for being a part of this journey with us, see you soon.

story:
Friends and family,

We're MODAL, an original jazz hip-hop band from Austin, Texas, founded on deep musicality and positive energy. We're working to raise $5,000 for a tour van to share our music in new cities and festivals. Our dream is to share our music globally. Last year we played over 40 shows throughout Austin, San Marcos, San Antonio, Houston, and Denton, Texas, refining our craft and having a great time doing it. This year, we want to cross into new states and take things to the next level. We love performing for new audiences and know we can reach this goal with your help.

The $5,000 will go directly to purchasing the tour van and getting it ready for the road (i.e. making sure the tires, brakes, belts, etc. are all in good running condition). For your donation, we will gift you with all kinds of great music-related goodies! We just released our new album, "Unfolding," and can give you digital download codes, physical CDs, stickers, posters, t-shirts, and more. In addition, we can get you tickets to our tour kick off show, special documentary footage from our tour, and original lyric books elucidating what our music's all about. We'll even play your private party for donating to help us get our tour van and share our music across the country.

Once we have the $5,000 we'll be sure to diligently inspect potential vehicles, getting certified mechanics to evaluate the van before we purchase it. Our friends in fellow bands can help us book the tours. We have all of the musical equipment we need to travel and perform. Our energy and passion is focused. We just need your aid in funding our tour van. 

Please, donate to our campaign as generously as you can and spread the word about it! If everyone contributes a little bit, we'll be there in no time. But hey! If you have any philanthropist friends who love great music, let them know about us! We put so much heart and soul into what we do and just need a little help making this dream come true.

So please, donate now! Share this on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, and we'll see you soon to play, fresh out of our new van!!

story:
My name is Gayle Dodd! I am a musician, and I have been singing since I was 18 months old. I started playing piano at age 8. I started writing song lyrics at age 13, and I took guitar lessons starting when I was 16. I taught myself how to sing harmony from being around a musically inclined family. My family sang at weddings and my father would often lead church services, and I was always there for practices since I was a baby. I have wanted to be a professional singer ever since I knew what one was. My first and biggest muse was Crystal Lewis. In my teens, I was inspired by Mariah Carey, Hanson, Alanis Morissette, and Michelle Branch, just to name a few. There are countless artists I have been inspired by. With that being said, I am finally at a time in my life where my music is at a point where it is begging to be heard by the masses. 

What I Need & What You Get

I am hoping to raise $6000 in 60 days. This cost will cover recording the album in a studio, musicians, mixing and mastering, photo shoots, as well as printing and producing the CDs that will be sold, primarily at our shows.

I have selected some very cool things to offer you in return for your contribution. This ranges from receiving a voicemail, to a PRIVATE CONCERT IN YOUR HOME. Not bad, huh? 

The Impact

I want to reach out to people with my music, and change their lives. I know that in the many times I've dealt with life's worst challenges, a simple song would change my entire perspective for the better. When I was 20, I released an album, and I have had multiple people state that it helped them through life's challenges. This has helped build my confidence, and I think that I can put out art that is not only on par with what is heard on the radio, but art that serves an inspiration to people. It is important to me that I record this album to share it with the public and it will happen. 

Risks & Challenges

I am a beautiful person on the inside and out. Just like everyone else in the world. We all have our quirks that others may see as flaws. I am comfortable in my own skin concerning my appearance, but the industry is still stuck on pushing women that are skinny to the forefront (It's ok. Eat a burger, hun). I have gotten multiple auditions where they would hear a tape and see photos, and they knew what I was capable of vocally. Once my bodacious self walked in the room, I was looked over. To fix this, I have taken modeling classes and learned how to pose, and how to carry myself and look beautiful. I am also a trained, licensed stylist. I know how to look good.  

The music industry is dog-eat-dog in and of itself. However, I want to change the face of the industry and show that curves are beautiful. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know the economy sucks these days. All I ask of anyone who lacks the ability to fund is to get the word out to those you think can help financially. Also, sharing my music on social media is the sign of a true fan. I would be incredibly thankful with you just clicking that "share" button. That's what it's all about right? Sharing the music?

story:
I've been writing music for over 15 years now and I have well over 30 songs, it's time to start putting albums out. 

I had this album planned about three years ago, but my life changed very suddenly when I took in my niece and nephew so they didn't end up in foster care.  It resulted in moving my studio at least three times, and getting them settled became my priority.  I work two jobs to support them and we as a family unit hope one day that I will have one job, writing music.  Strings of My Heart is the first Album of many I plan to release this year:

  • My name is Michol Mae (Said like Nicole but with an M) and I have been a singer, a musician and more since I was a child.  I sang with the choir when I was about 6, my mother put me in orchestra when I was in grade school, I learned the Cello, until I moved from VA to NY and they had enough Cellists and put me on the Viola. This was a great experience because it showed me how versatile I could be with strings.  In college I took piano and went back to the Cello, and took singing and ear training.   I also play the Guitar, Bass Guitar, Floor bass, and Violin.  I have a WaveDrum that I use for my beats and drum part and I LOVE it because it is loaded with all different cultural sounds.  I've been in bands and I currently do work as a Karaoke DeeJay.   
  • This campaign is to find people interested in investing in a completed and professional debut album.  This is the springboard to all the other albums I have in my head.  I don't want to put out music because it's popular, I do it because it gives a voice to people who can't, it gives people an outlet, and hopefully inspires them.  I like to be unique and I love all different kinds of music. I like to combine cultures and genres.  I can't be confined to one genre, and I describe myself as myself, so doing my album on my own as an independent artist is the best way to maintain my sound.  This campaign is important to me because it not only allows me to release my first album, but it also provides me with critical equipment for future albums. 
  • I did a lot of thinking about going into a studio vs building my own studio, and I decided we all get the most bang for our buck if I finish my current studio with the input of a sound engineer.  Investing in this campaign means you are joining my journey at it's core, the ripple effect of this campaign will be felt for the rest of my life and hopefully we will remain together on this journey.  A portion of the proceeds from every album will go to a designated charity because it's about giving back.  Music can help people express themselves, can mend a heart, save a life, and build bridges, it is intertwined in my soul.  They say if you do what you love you never work a day in your life.  Well I can tell you writing and producing music is very hard work, but I would love if one day it were my main focus and I didn't need to work two jobs and then work on my music.  This could be the first step toward realizing that dream. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I looked at other campaigns and then did some looking around for pricing. ultimately I decided that $15k - $20k would get the job done right.  I have included a Pie Chart for you, you can find it under photos.  Basically, the funds here go to purchasing equipment and production of the album.  Additional investments above our goal will go towards marketing and any other expenses that come up, like a music video.  If I am lucky enough to get investors above and beyond that I will take some time off from work to finish the album sooner!
  • So the perks:  I didn't want you to "Donate" I wanted you to invest in me, so I tried to set up perks that were worth your investment.  These were not created light, to the right of your screen you will see these perks include custom sketches, album art, and even future albums if you choose to invest on that level.  
  • One perk not listed, to the top investor I will request your top 3 charities and choose one of those charities to donate a percentage of the proceeds from the sale of the album once it goes live.
  • I am a go-getter, and very hard worker, if I don't find enough investments for this campaign I will do my best to carry on without them.  That means scaling back and I am sure I will have some challenges depending on the amount.  It might mean less songs on the album, or it might mean I have to get creative with my solutions in my studio, but one thing is certain.  I will complete this album and it will be the most professional album ever. 

The Impact

The potential impact is unlimited.  This campaign is a springboard, a starting point, the catalyst to putting out unique, heartfelt music written by someone who has lived through a great deal.  This campaign also sets us up for future albums one of which is dedicated to fighting depression and is named "Songs for Danni."  Another is "Through the Shattered Mirror" which is all about abuse, and a single album dedicated to the men and women in law enforcement are all on my radar to be completed within the next year.   Every Album I put out will donate a portion of the proceeds to a charity, the charity for this album will be selected from three choices of the top investor.  "Songs for Danni" will go to suicide prevention and to a scholarship that has been started by Danni's parents.  "Through the Shattered Mirror" will have proceeds going toward Domestic Violence.  So you see you are investing on a journey of a larger magnitude than just one album.  I won't forget those who were involved and I will keep you up dated and in the loop as long as you want to be!

  • I believe in music with all my heart, and I believe it can help people heal, grieve, love and process any array of emotions, Strings of My Heart is all about processing emotions, sometimes moving on, feeling stuck, love, loss and so much more.  A friend once told me to be able to sing and song-write was rare, but it wasn't until recently that I began to see that first hand.  I also had the pleasurable experience of having people reach out and thank me for lyrics that touch them, or helped them and that is what it really all about!  By investing in this project, you aren't just investing in me,  you are investing in anyone who identifies with any of the songs on this album.  
  • This is my first try at crowd funding. This method was suggested by a friend, when we were talking about how I spent every bit of savings I had when I took in the kids because they came to me with nothing. 
  • I promise you, I will fight to keep this dream alive, I will work hard everyday and I will succeed.  I have succeeded at every other goal I have set for myself.  I bought my car, my motorcycle, my house, graduated with my Masters Degree, and all of that is great, except I traded my passion to do it.  Now it is time to do what I love, and I hope I can inspire you to also do what you love!

Risks & Challenges

As with anything there are Risks and Challenges.  I work hard to keep risks to a minimum, but isn't life one big risk!  Now Challenges I can tell you all about those. One major challenge has been finding the time to practice my instruments, finding time to do my scales, and time to train my ear and my voice.  I get around those challenges by sacrificing sleep, because I won't sacrifice time with the kids, although I am able to get some musical instrument practices with them since I put them both in the orchestra!  

  • I am stubborn, so while I have had set backs, I come back from them every time. 
  • I am a hard worker, I am willing to put in the time and the work to be successful, nothing just falls into your lap.
  • I have pride in what I do, I have in the past posted rough cuts and first passes because everyone knew that was what they were.  I want this album to be something we can all be proud off. I want it to be of the highest quality.
  • I don't auto tune. There is a great debate about this in the music industry, and it can present a challenge, but I don't auto tune because I want to be authentic, and I want to be able to sing it for you live at a moments notice. 
  • Time, time is my biggest challenge, but like I said I am willing to sacrifice sleep, my kids have offered to help so we can still spend time together, and if it works out the right way I plan to take some time off work from at least one of my jobs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to Pre-order/invest at this time, no worries, you can still help in several  important ways:

  • direct people to my IndieGogo page.
  • share the campaign video on your FB page.
  • email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best).
  • tell music magazines/websites/blogs/other relevant pro's about my project.
  • tell your friends directly (old school style.... offline). 

Any noise you can make to let others know is a beautiful sound! Thank you! There are wonderful and easily accessed tools on IndieGogo that will help you share this campaign . 


If you are still with me and you read through all that, I am truly grateful for your time.  I hope we can journey together and I hope great things are on the horizon!  Thank you so very much, Be Blessed, Namaste and Salutations

Michol Mae

story:
Short Summary

You know the situation in Ukraine is quite difficult. People in Ukraine are really tired and depressed by problems of different fields.

With my music I would like to bring light, love and peace in the heart of everyone who listens to it.

I would appreciate any help. Supporting my campaign you contribute to positive thoughts and attitude to the life that I want to express and share with others! Thanks a lot!


Let me tell you my story. I’ve been singing since childhood. When I went to bed, I was imagining myself on the stage. I listened to the music day and night and I wanted to grow up more quickly to become a singer and dedicate my life to the music. I finished piano study in music school and started to write my own songs. When it came the time to choose the profession, I was thinking about entering the Music College, but my parents advised me to choose another way. Not because they didn’t believe in me, but because they knew that the profession of singer is quite difficult and it’s hard to have a success without money. So I started to learn languages and study Linguistics.

Music hasn’t become my specialty, but it was my strong hobby. I participated in a lot of concerts and competitions. I worked hard, had success and failure and finally I was invited to Ukrainian popular girl’s band. It gave me artistic skills and huge stage experience, but unfortunately the group suspended to give concerts and I had to search my own music path.

 It seems to me that the most difficult for musicians is to believe in themselves. You can never know if your music attracts the audience, because music is an Art, either people like it, or not. But I understood the main thing that the musician should be natural and honest. You have to compose the music which takes the beginning from your heart. You should be creative, don’t be afraid to explore the world and make mistakes. Every singer even very famous and talented had failures. You mustn’t loose heart, you should believe in your talent and in your power to make your dream come true. Everyone is individual and special. The problem is that we are afraid to show our ideas, share our thoughts and feelings. I’m not afraid anymore, I’ll do my best and it is my rule.

So my first single Perfect day is my lifestyle. Every day is perfect if we accept it as it comes. I wrote the song Perfect day to address to people who are afraid and don’t feel happy, because they don’t see the beauty of the world.

 My first music video is the instrument to share my positive attitude to the life and cheer up this world!

What We Need & What You Get

The sum that we want to raise includes expenses for:

  • Professional team (director, camera man, stylist, actors, dancers, assintants...);

  • Video equipment, light fixtures;

  • Postproduction;

  • Production and Shipping of perks;

  • Taxes, bank and PayPal frees, Indiegogo's fee.

You will get unique perks:

  • Every baker will get the unique opportunity to watch the music video before the opening night;
  • Postcards with words of personal graritude;
  • Magic cups that make your drink more tasty and cheer up;
  • CDs and USB flash drives with the song Perfect day, promo video and posters;
  • Personal greeting video recordings for you, your family member or friend;
  • Skype interview, where Virginia will sing personally for you;
  • Concert of Virginia at your party with your favorite songs.

We receive flexible funding, so we'll get any sum raised, but we really hope to raise the sum needed.

The Impact

Our world is difficult and beautiful at the same time and we have to enjoy every moment. A lot of people are depressed, espeially in Ukraine, because we are going through rough times, but we have to be strong and believe in better tomorrow. 

The music video for the positive song Perfect Day has to be shot to make the world a little bit brighter and you can join us and make your personal contribution. 

Risks & Challenges

The main risk in this project is not to raise the sum needed, but even in this case we'll be searching another way to achieve the goal. Anyway any support is highly appreciated and new audience is the main award for the singer.

The main challenge is the video shooting as it is the first one. We are going to shoot the video with not very rich budget. but creative ideas can cope with anything. So we prepare the ideas and invite you to share yours with us to make this video Perfect!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can:

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and social networks to inform your friends about the project;
  • Spread the information about the project in media if you have such possibility
  • Belive in our project and wish us success!!!

AND LET EACH DAY BE PERFECT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

About the Underground...

Hello, and welcome to the indiegogo page for United Underground Entertainment. A local production company based in Chico, California. We started down this journey just a few months ago with hopes of bringing the unique culture of festival entertainment to our town of Chico. As spring semester of 2015 came to a close we devised a plan to make that dream a reality. Pooling our unique talents together we organized a small scale festival in downtown Chico called Chicoachella. The event was an absolute success, raising over $1000 for a local artist charity fund. After such a drastic success we knew we couldn't stop there and so the idea for the Chico Downtown festival was born. 

All of us here at UUE want to bring a full scale festival to Chico, California, and with the recent growth and collaboration within the local music scene, we think that the town is more than ready for just that. There's just one problem with all of this, we're all college students and have bank accounts to reflect such. 

That's where you, the sponsors, come in. Our goal with this campaign is to raise  funds to purchase enough equipment to be able to fully operate our own stage as well as promotional equipment to start spreading the word about United Underground. We are already planning four major fundraising events for next school year as well as a myriad of small scale fundraisers. These events will both raise money for our large scale festival, to be held in spring of 2016,  as well as promote local artists in our very own Chico scene, but, they can't happen without proper equipment. They can't happen without you...

So this call goes out to every family member, friend, coworker, teacher and mentor that any of us have ever had. The name is United Underground Entertainment. The number is $15,000. Help us get there and you will be oh so handsomely rewarded. 


What We Need And What You'll Get

  • For this project to be fully funded we need $15,000. Of that 15,000, about 10,000 will go to purchasing all of the equipment that we need to run a stage at a live show as well as purchasing video equipment to create new multimedia content. $2,500 will be used to get UUE merchandise production off of the ground. (Get ready for UUE sunglasses, stickers, T-Shirts and more). $1,900 will be helping us pay all of our final business taxes and filing fees with the IRS, Butte county and the city of Chico, as well as purchase our first three months of venue insurance. The last $600 will be sent to indiegogo as their percentage for helping us start our crowd funding journey through their platform. 
  • For donating to our campaign you will be rewarded with things such as UUE merchandise, CD's from supporting UUE bands or even a stage named in your honor if you are feeling extra generous. 
  • Since we have chosen the flexible funding approach, should we not be fully funded then all of the money we have made will be used for further charity festivals in Chico as well as establishing a fund to assist local artists. 


Why Are We Doing This?

-We are very excited to put Chico back on the map as one of the premier music locations in California. We are very excited for this project to get funded so we can get working holding more charity events for local artists as well as get into some artist development. We also can't wait to start working on our year long project of a full scale festival in Chico. 


Risks & Challenges

  • It could be easy to discredit us all as college students who are too young to be undertaking a task this large. After all, festivals take time to build up. But rest assured that when you donate to us you are donating to a group of committed individuals whom are all constantly working to learn more and more from our mentors in the music industry. Some of us are even volunteering at large scale music festivals this summer to better learn the ropes of concert promotion and event planning.


Other Ways You Can Help!!!

  • Every single dollar makes a big impact to this campaign but even if you aren't in a situation that leaves you able to donate you can still help us out by sharing this page, following and supporting us on our social media, sharing the word about United Underground Entertainment and coming out to any UUE event that you can make it to throughout the year.

story:
Greetings from Lydia Pense and Cold Blood . We are in the process of recording our new CD , “Soul Of The Gypsy”

This is the latest in a long line of albums from Lydia Pense and Cold Blood . It will be the band's 10th album  .

We have been working on this CD project for two years, recording tracks at River City Recording in Roseville, CA . We are producing this album independently, with no financial support from a record label.

  Our goal is to release the CD in late July. In order to do that we need to raise money to finish the recording, mix the songs, master the album, have artwork and graphics done and also have the CDs duplicated and manufactured. We are hoping to raise $7500 to complete all of this.

  Through  IndieGoGo you can purchase a personalized, autographed CD ahead of it’s release . All contributions will go to finishing production of the CD.

  We have some great new original material on this album and are looking forward to sharing it with all of you ! Thanks for your support !

Cold Blood Bio:

Lydia Pense & Cold Blood debuted when the Fillmore was at its peak as one of the nation's musical Meccas. Owner Bill Graham was so impressed with Lydia's voice and the sound of the band that he immediately signed Cold Blood to his new record label. During the span of six original late-60's, early-70's albums, Lydia Pense and Cold Blood helped, along with Tower Of Power, forge their own specific brand of funk/soul and R&B which came to be known as East Bay Grease. That music still holds up today, proving that great music is timeless and will continue to inspire generations to come.

Cold Blood is one of the original R&B horn bands from the late 60's/ early 70's that exemplified the "East Bay Grease" melding of funk & rock with blues and jazz elements. Lydia Pense has been compared to Janis Joplin, but is a true original and a pioneer in the women's rock movement. Lydia Pense and Cold Blood packed the San Francisco Ballrooms in their heyday, but that was then and this is now. In the now, Lydia Pense and Cold Blood still fill halls with cheering, dancing, foot-stomping fans. Far from fading over the years, Cold Blood has flourished.

The word legend certainly applies to Lydia Pense and Cold Blood…and not in some past tense-make-a-living-as-an-oldies-act sort of way either. Pense can still shout like a 60's soul diva and purr a slow blues tune with spine-tingling subtlety. Cold Blood, as a whole, features a stellar group of musicians who have been playing together for nearly 20 years including Steve Dunne on guitar, Steve Salinas on keyboards, a gritty-growling horn section comprised of Rich Armstrong and Rob Zuckerman along with a stellar rhythm section featuring Evan Palmerston on bass and Donny Baldwin on drums. The band members are all veteran Bay Area musicians who have played with many great artists including Elvin Bishop, Jefferson Starship, Boz Skaggs, Albert Collins and more. Of course there is Lydia who still has the chops with the patina of a seasoned veteran who's done and seen it all. Together she and the band continue to twist together R&B, (both Old School and New School); into something that doesn't have a label...

Cold Blood has been blessed with the ability to reach backwards for original influences and the creativity to reach forward, working with new approaches. The music they play is ageless, and can still fill any room to the rafters.


www.lydiapense.com
story_txt:
Greetings
from Lydia Pense and Cold Blood . We are in the process of recording our new CD
, “Soul Of The Gypsy”
This
is the latest in a long line of albums from Lydia Pense and Cold Blood . It
will be the band's 10th album  .
We
have been working on this CD project for two years, recording tracks at River
City Recording in Roseville, CA . We are producing this album independently,
with no financial support from a record label. 
  Our goal is to release the CD in late July.
In order to do that we need to raise money to finish the recording, mix the
songs, master the album, have artwork and graphics done and also have the CDs
duplicated and manufactured. We are hoping to raise $7500 to complete all of
this.
  Through 
IndieGoGo you can purchase a personalized, autographed CD ahead of it’s
release . All contributions will go to finishing production of the CD.
  We have some great new original material on
this album and are looking forward to sharing it with all of you ! Thanks for
your support !Cold Blood Bio:
Lydia Pense & Cold Blood
debuted when the Fillmore was at its peak as one of the nation's musical
Meccas. Owner Bill Graham was so impressed with Lydia's voice and the sound of
the band that he immediately signed Cold Blood to his new record label. During
the span of six original late-60's, early-70's albums, Lydia Pense and Cold
Blood helped, along with Tower Of Power, forge their own specific brand of
funk/soul and R&B which came to be known as East Bay Grease. That music
still holds up today, proving that great music is timeless and will continue to
inspire generations to come. 

Cold Blood is one of the
original R&B horn bands from the late 60's/ early 70's that exemplified the
"East Bay Grease" melding of funk & rock with blues and jazz
elements. Lydia Pense has been compared to Janis Joplin, but is a true original
and a pioneer in the women's rock movement. Lydia Pense and Cold Blood packed
the San Francisco Ballrooms in their heyday, but that was then and this is now.
In the now, Lydia Pense and Cold Blood still fill halls with cheering, dancing,
foot-stomping fans. Far from fading over the years, Cold Blood has flourished. 

The word legend certainly
applies to Lydia Pense and Cold Blood…and not in some past
tense-make-a-living-as-an-oldies-act sort of way either. Pense can still shout
like a 60's soul diva and purr a slow blues tune with spine-tingling subtlety.
Cold Blood, as a whole, features a stellar group of musicians who have been
playing together for nearly 20 years including Steve Dunne on guitar, Steve
Salinas on keyboards, a gritty-growling horn section comprised of Rich
Armstrong and Rob Zuckerman along with a stellar rhythm section featuring Evan
Palmerston on bass and Donny Baldwin on drums. The band members are all veteran
Bay Area musicians who have played with many great artists including Elvin
Bishop, Jefferson Starship, Boz Skaggs, Albert Collins and more. Of course there
is Lydia who still has the chops with the patina of a seasoned veteran who's
done and seen it all. Together she and the band continue to twist together
R&B, (both Old School and New School); into something that doesn't have a
label...
Cold Blood has been blessed
with the ability to reach backwards for original influences and the creativity
to reach forward, working with new approaches. The music they play is ageless,
and can still fill any room to the rafters.
www.lydiapense.com

story:
Thanks so much for making time to learn about In Concert for Cancer. (ICFC)
Now in its fourth year, ICFC is an annual concert event that partners with some of the world’s most popular and compassionate recording artists.

Through sharing the JOY of live music performances, our mission is to inspire cancer patients everywhere, to unify communities in the fight against cancer, and to raise awareness and funding for life-saving cancer treatment and cures.

Why do we do this? We all know someone affected by cancer, and we know that funding cancer research is vital to eradicating this devastating disease. We are passionate about doing as much as we can, as often as we can, to improve the outcome and win the fight.

Why We Need Your Support: It takes a village! World class concerts are expensive to produce. We work hard all year to secure funding to offset our costs through corporate sponsorships, grants and individual donations. Your support will make a positive and direct impact for cancer patients, survivors, caregivers and the greater cancer community.


Music heals. Music spreads joy. Music unites us!

Who We Are:
I'm Michele Abrams, the founder, and proud trailblazer of ICFC. I lost both of my parents and a number of friends to cancer and thought there must  be a way to make a positive difference for everyone impacted by this horrible and painful disease. There isn't one person on this planet who hasn't either been a victim of cancer or is a relative or friend of someone who must battle this "beast." I decided to use my experience as a concert producer, and passion for music, to help the best way I could. 

We're a team of good hearted cancer warriors, music professionals, partners and sponsors. Along with our family and friends, we strive to make a difference in our community by combining our love of live music performances and our passionate commitment to funding ground-breaking, life-saving cancer treatment and research. 

Where the Money Goes:
We fund Seattle Children's Research Institute and their work in life-saving cancer immunotherapy, the next great advancement in cancer treatment. Through cellular engineering, this treatment enables the body’s own immune system to heal itself—without the harsh and often lifelong side effects of chemotherapy and radiation. View this inspiring video of how Dr. Michael Jensen, of Seattle Children's Research Institute, is helping make a world without childhood cancer a reality:


Date & Location of ICFC:
Our fourth annual event is Friday, September 18, 2015. Our concert is outdoors, festival style, at the fabulous Redhook Brewery, in Woodinville WA.

Our Exciting "All-Star" Concert Lineup!
We are thrilled and proud to present 9-time Grammy nominee, saxophonist Dave Koz with trumpeter Rick Braun and special guest, R&B vocalist Kenny Lattimore.

Thank you so much for your kind consideration in becoming a supporter of our  cancer-fighting community, and musical movement! Your support not only helps us share the inspirational power of music, but affords us the opportunity and privilege to donate a full 100% of our concert proceeds to lifesaving cancer treatment and cures.

ENJOY MUSIC. SUPPORT SCIENCE. GIVE HOPE.
www.InConcertforCancer.org
