story:
Hello fans, friends, family and new supporters! 

Thanks for coming here to help support my dream and passion. Music is my life and what I know and feel I was born to do. The music I create crosses all genres and styles, but it truly comes from one place, the soul.  I have put everything I've got and I mean EVERYTHING into my music.  So now, I need your help.  I want the world to hear my music and enjoy the gift I give.  My music is everything to me, but it means nothing if I do not have an audience to share it with.  Most of all, my music is inspired by YOU! So please help me get it out to the world by donating here and sharing this campaign with everyone you know.

I just released a single "Anything She Wants" along with a music video for it.  I want to present this body of work to the music industry in a progressive manner so that I can continue to create my music and further my career.  

Here is a link to a snippet of one of the NEW songs "In This Life"  off of my upcoming EP.  If you contribute to my campaign $10.00 or above you will receive the full download of "Moonshine on the Vine".  CLICK HERE TO LISTEN

Here is a link to the video "Anything She Wants"  

This is how your funding will help me.


  • I will market the "Anything She Wants" package with a professional video platform company so that the video and the song can go viral.
  • I will  market my song/songs through a reputable radio marketing company
  • I will promote my song and video through a media company that will launch my music in cities where it has not yet been heard
  • I want you to be a part of this journey, I cannot do this without you.

I realize campaigns are challenging but I have a team of people behind me that are willing to promote and work with me and you to get to the finish line.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me by sharing this campaign out on your social media pages and emailing your friends.  

I believe in my music and I know that there is a place in the music industry for it! The world needs soul-fulfilling music from the heart more now than ever. I write, sing and give my songs to you and the rest of the world with all the love and spirit in my soul. Thank you for always being there for me and for believing in me.  For all of my fans who come to my shows and buy my music I cannot thank you enough for your inspiration. I love you all.

Peace and Love Always,

BJ Wilbanks    You can also visit me at:  www.bjwilbanks.com

story:
Hi i'm Daz and I was once the drummer in You Slut! but now I'm starting a brand new project! Panji & The Buffalo.

What I Need & What You Get!

So, earlier this week I launched a song called Taneo - which you can listen to and download completely free here: https://panjiandthebuffalo.bandcamp.com/releases

I am now looking for £600 to write, record and launch an E.P and I need your help! Pledge money and get rewards! The more you spend the better reward you get! 

I will be launching the E.P digitally as well as physically! 

I really need your help to launching this project!

  • Even if you are completely skint you can still help by sharing this page and getting your friends to pledge! Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
In a Nut Shell...

I recently teamed up with an indie label called Eat Breathe sing Entertainment and formed a partnership to put out a single together and do what it takes to try and make their artist Lynda Rose (She just turned 18, Music and singing is her passion. Her dream is, to tour the world, share the stage with other known artists and  bring people together trough her music), a up coming R&B/POP singer, A STAR. If we fail to make her a star, we can at least feel good about putting her on tour, having her do radio interviews, TV show appearances, perform her music in front of thousands of people and MAKING HER DREAMS COME TRUE. The single (features platinum selling artist Maino) and the tour is called "What They Want". 

We have spent thousands of dollars on Producing, Writing, Recording sessions, Mixing, Mastering, traveling expenses and so on... and that is just to get the song done (it's only the tip of the iceberg). What we lack at the moment is the rest of the FUNDING to have Lynda Rose go ON TOUR with Maino along with other artists. We are scheduled to have her be one of the opening acts for such artist as: JUICY J, Flo-rida, 2 Chainz,​ Rae Sremmurd, Wale, Yo Gotti with more to be announced. WE WILL NOT BE GETTING PAID for any of these PROMO SHOWS and EVENTS ( artist will be PERFORMING FOR FREE) but, these shows and appearances will put the artist face to face with hundreds of thousands of people. This national Radio and promo tour will allow us to handle probably one of the most important and CRUCIAL parts of the "What They Want" project and that's... PROMOTION PROMOTION PROMOTION (We will be  documenting the entire process, to release a "What They Want" 2015 PROMO TOUR DVD (Watch our past promo campaigns video example in the gallery).

   What do you think of the song?

CLICK HERE AND LISTEN TO
                     "WHAT THEY WANT"                       
     From left to right (Maino, Lynda Rose and Producer Chance Uno).

If you like the song, even if you don't like the song, it would mean the world to us if you could contribute in any way you can to HELP US MAKE HER DREAMS COME TRUE.

We’re asking you, our friends, COMMUNITY, family and Fans, the lovers of GREAT music that we know you are, to HELP US see our vision through by MAKING A TEENAGERS DREAMS COME TRUE.  Please come along, share, contribute to the 'What They Want' - 2015 PROMO TOUR project, and take this exciting journey with us. We have certain packages set up where, artists, Websites and companies can benefit from all the promotions. 
 

What Do We Need and Why?

    • We need to raise 150,000 plus dollars to HELP US FUND the entire 'What They Want' - 2015 PROMOTIONAL TOUR EXPENSES, get on all and the big events we are offered and make the artists DREAM COME TRUE. 100% of all funds received will be going towards the expenses listed below and they are as follow:
  1. $ 14,500.00 - Travel (Flights, Hotel, Ground transportation (when the promo truck can not make the trip), food for a total of 8 people. That's Artist, 4 dancers, Videographer, 2 street team members), we need to be able to cover coast to coast to do interviews for radio, TV, Magazines.
  2. $ 11, 420.00 - Printing Promotional materials (50,000 Flyers $3,500.00, 2000 Posters $1,000.00, Banners $ 750.00, T-Shirts $ 2500.00, CD'S 2000 of what they want single $2,960.00, DVD'S 1000 copies, $1,710.00).
  3. $ 5,500.00 - Music Video Shoot (HD quality music Video for "What They Want" Song, with cast, Featuring Maino is scheduled to be shot and need to be TV quality so it can be submitted to major networks such as MTV, BET and so on).
  4. $ 3,400.00 - Street Teams (We are in the process of hiring people around the country who will go out and hand out flyers, Hang up posters, give away shirts, CD'S and more).
    EXAMPLE: A few past campaigns with artist and Street team & promo models.

  5. $ 2,100.00 - Online promotions (We have a decent amount of e-mail addresses but it costs money to send out to the 200,000 plus people in out database not only that we want pay companies such as mp3waxx, Online blogs, Blog magazines etc.).
  6. $ 4,899.96 - Video Camera's, Microphones and accessories ( We are purchasing two Canon EOS 7D Mark II DSLR Camera with 18–135mm Lens & Extra 70–300mm Telephoto Zoom Lens and accessories, SD Card, Lights) The entire Tour, Radio Interviews, appearances, Behind the scenes will all be filmed uploaded to our YOUTUBE JEI NETWORK CHANNEL (See video below), and a Documentary DVD will also be made from all the footage showing you the process and it will be titled "What They Want" 2015 TOUR). Songs from the mixtape will be used as the soundtrack to the Documentary DVD.
  7. $25,000.00 - Independent Radio Promoters (Multiple Indie radio promoters will be hire to get the song to everyone. Their job will be, to make sure all the dj's in with in their networks, from clubs to radio have received the song, get their feedback and see what people think about it).
  8. 4, 500.00 - Music Video Release Parties (places and locations where people seem to be more into the project, we will travel to and screen the video for them before it goes to TV).
  9. $ 10,500.00 - EDM and Reggae remix of the song (In order to reach an even bigger audience, we are going to have have some of the biggest producers in those genres remix the song for us and send to radio opening more doors.).
  10. $ 46,000.00 - Promo Shows and appearances (Events and shows that the artists will not be paid for to be there and we will have to pay out of pocket to satisfy fans, take photos, autograph signings and more).
  11. $ 28,999.00 - PROMO SUV PURCHASE (We will purchase a 2010 GMC Yukon Denali which will be used to travel and transport artists, Dancers, Managers and all necessary promotional material, from banners, flyers, CD's DVD'S, Camera crew and so on.

    EXAMPLE: From one of our past campaigns. It gives you the basic idea of what we will do with the promo vehicle in order to promote!

  12. $ 4,500.00 - GAS for SUV for the entire length of the promotional period, coast to coast.
  13. $3,400.00 - CD DUPLICATION: (We are duplicating 5000 units, Full Color, CD(s), Jacket with Shrinkwrap for our "What They Want" 2015 TOUR promotional Mixtape to hand out FREE at events , shows and concerts.)

The Impact

Our goals and priorities for the "What They Want" TOUR project is to have the ARTIST GO ON TOUR, have her Jump on other TOURS already slated, do a ton of PROMOTIONS for her while on TOUR: from magazines, radio interviews, TV, Concerts, we need to Travel, make hundreds of Appearances, hand out promotional materials, do Promo Shows, get on other promo tours and so on. 
I have done this sort of thing for major labels (with big budgets) as a consultant or booking agent an have an excellent track record, and I am constantly learning. This is a really wonderful opportunity to help us continue on our mission at the same time help brand indie music, new talent and most importantly make a teenagers dreams come true. 

Your contribution will allow to get on as many tours as we can this summer, travel for interviews (TV, RADIO, MAGAZINES), appearances all around the country and even a few dates out of the country. 

Risks & Challenges

It's not going to be all butterflies and daisies. We have until May 29th to raise all the funds and start making reservations get flyers printed, CD's Duplicated, Hire Street teas and so on.. so it's a bit of a race. The talent and work ethic is there, but for some reason, magical doors open when you have money. Weird! 
If we could afford to fund all the PROMOTIONAL EXPENSES for the "What They Want" project and MAKE THE ARTISTS DREAMS COME TRUE all on our own, we would. But the truth is... we can’t, especially all at once. In order to go on tour and get her on these other tours by our associates, it’s going to take a village helping us or a NETWORK of people working together as a unit. This is why we are using crowd funding to raise the necessary funds to HELP US run one of the hardest and biggest indie run promo campaigns possible.... we love you guys, we love what we do, and we want you to be part of that with us.

ASSOCIATES TOUR DATES WE ARE SCHEDULED TO HAVE HER ON AS AN OPENING ACT!

​JUICY J -  (The Hustle Continues Tour)​
May 30 – Denver, CO – Fillmore
June 3 – Minneapolis, MN – Skyway Theatre
June 5 – Indianapolis, IN – Egyptian Room
June 6 – Chicago, IL – House of Blues
June 7 – Detroit, MI – St Andrews Hall
June 8 – Cleveland, OH – House of Blues
June 10 – Boston, MA – House of Blues
June 12 – Wallingford, CT – The Dome
June 13 – Philadelphia, PA – TLA
June 15 – New York, NY – Irving Plaza
June 17 – Washington DC – Fillmore
June 18 – Raleigh, NC – The Ritz
June 19 – Charlotte, NC – Fillmore
June 20 – Myrtle Beach, SC – House of Blues
June 25 – Atlanta, GA – Tabernacle
June 26 – Orlando, FL – Venue 578
June 27 – Miami Beach, FL – Fillmore
June 28 – Tampa, FL – Ritz Ybor​
​Boosie Bad Azz​
May 22 - South Bend, ​IN​ ​@ The Morris Center
Summer Jam - Seattle: TI, KID INK, E-40, BOB, ACTION BRONSON, JOEY BADASS
June 20 - Summer Jam - Seattle, Wa
Flo-rida
May 1 - Las Veges @ Sapphire ​
2 Chainz /​ Rae Sremmurd
May 9 - San Jose, Ca @ Santa Clara Fairgrounds
Wale Music Festival - Anguilla Youth Sports Foundation - Caribean Islands
July 5 - Sandy Ground Beach - Anguilla
Greece - Europe Festival ​http://www.zanteshutdown.com
May 21 -​ 24th​
Brazil Tour - Bone Thugs & Harmony
May 8 - Rio De Janeiro @ ​Fundicao Progresso
May 9 - Brasilia @ Smurphies Disco Club​
May 10 - Sao Paulo @ Via Marques​
Festival - Dublin, Ireland
http://www.youbloom.com/
June ​11, 12, 13

​Yo Gotti
May 6 - Vancouver, BC CANADA @ ​Harbour Event Centre
I AM GlobaL Festival (French Montana / Rae Sremmurd) http://www.iamglobalfestival.com/line-up/
June 6 - Barcelona, Spain - UK
Together we can build more perks that involves your business, or create a unique gift for donors that promotes your business and supports this project. Lets get creative!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help... if you are unable to donate at this time,  you can still help in several  important ways:
  • direct people to our IndieGogo page.
  • share the campaign video on your FB page.
  • email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best).
  • tell music magazines/websites/blogs/and other relevant pros about our "What They Want" project.
  • tell your friends directly (old school style.... offline).
  • SUBSCRIBE to our JEI NETWORK youtube channel.
  • FOLLOW me J. Jewels on twitter.
  • Like our JEI NETWORK page on facebook.
  • visit our website browse, share news, castings, new music info or SUBSCRIBE to our mailing list.
Anything you can do to help generate some noise to let others know is a beautiful sound! There are wonderful and easily accessed tools on IndieGogo that will help you share this campaign .  This is almost as important to the campaign as actually getting donations from all of you. People need to know that this is happening.
  • DOWNLOAD the song from AMAZON for $0.99.
  • Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
What happens if we don't reach our target goal?
What ever we raise will help us with the campaign and funds will be use towards the "WHAT THEY WANT" promo tour CAMPAIGN we may need to cut out some dates, print less promo materials, and so on... we will not give up on trying to raise the funds.

If you have questions, feel free to contact us!
Or E-mail me J. Jewels directly: jjewels@jewelseinc.com

We have spent thousands of dollars on Producing, Writing, Recording sessions, Mixing, Mastering, traveling expenses and so on... and that is just to get the song done (it's only the tip of the iceberg). What we lack at the moment is the rest of the FUNDING to have Lynda Rose go ON TOUR with Maino along with other artists. We are scheduled to have her be one of the opening acts for such artist as: JUICY J, Flo-rida, 2 Chainz,​ Rae Sremmurd, Wale, Yo Gotti with more to be announced. WE WILL NOT BE GETTING PAID for any of these PROMO SHOWS and EVENTS ( artist will be PERFORMING FOR FREE) but, these shows and appearances will put the artist face to face with hundreds of thousands of people. This national Radio and promo tour will allow us to handle probably one of the most important and CRUCIAL parts of the "What They Want" project and that's... PROMOTION PROMOTION PROMOTION (We will be  documenting the entire process, to release a "What They Want" 2015 PROMO TOUR DVD (Watch our past promo campaigns video example in the gallery).
   What do you think of the song?
CLICK HERE AND LISTEN TO                      "WHAT THEY WANT"                            From left to right (Maino, Lynda Rose and Producer Chance Uno).

If you like the song, even if you don't like the song, it would mean the world to us if you could contribute in any way you can to HELP US MAKE HER DREAMS COME TRUE.We’re asking you, our friends, COMMUNITY, family and Fans, the lovers of GREAT music that we know you are, to HELP US see our vision through by MAKING A TEENAGERS DREAMS COME TRUE.  Please come along, share, contribute to the 'What They Want' - 2015 PROMO TOUR project, and take this exciting journey with us. We have certain packages set up where, artists, Websites and companies can benefit from all the promotions.  What Do We Need and Why?




We need to raise 150,000 plus dollars to HELP US FUND the entire 'What They Want' - 2015 PROMOTIONAL TOUR EXPENSES, get on all and the big events we are offered and make the artists DREAM COME TRUE. 100% of all funds received will be going towards the expenses listed below and they are as follow:



$ 14,500.00 - Travel (Flights, Hotel, Ground transportation (when the promo truck can not make the trip), food for a total of 8 people. That's Artist, 4 dancers, Videographer, 2 street team members), we need to be able to cover coast to coast to do interviews for radio, TV, Magazines.

$ 11, 420.00 - Printing Promotional materials (50,000 Flyers $3,500.00, 2000 Posters $1,000.00, Banners $ 750.00, T-Shirts $ 2500.00, CD'S 2000 of what they want single $2,960.00, DVD'S 1000 copies, $1,710.00).

$ 5,500.00 - Music Video Shoot (HD quality music Video for "What They Want" Song, with cast, Featuring Maino is scheduled to be shot and need to be TV quality so it can be submitted to major networks such as MTV, BET and so on).
$ 3,400.00 - Street Teams (We are in the process of hiring people around the country who will go out and hand out flyers, Hang up posters, give away shirts, CD'S and more).EXAMPLE: A few past campaigns with artist and Street team & promo models.
$ 2,100.00 - Online promotions (We have a decent amount of e-mail addresses but it costs money to send out to the 200,000 plus people in out database not only that we want pay companies such as mp3waxx, Online blogs, Blog magazines etc.).
$ 4,899.96 - Video Camera's, Microphones and accessories ( We are purchasing two Canon EOS 7D Mark II DSLR Camera with 18–135mm Lens & Extra 70–300mm Telephoto Zoom Lens and accessories, SD Card, Lights) The entire Tour, Radio Interviews, appearances, Behind the scenes will all be filmed uploaded to our YOUTUBE JEI NETWORK CHANNEL (See video below), and a Documentary DVD will also be made from all the footage showing you the process and it will be titled "What They Want" 2015 TOUR). Songs from the mixtape will be used as the soundtrack to the Documentary DVD.
$25,000.00 - Independent Radio Promoters (Multiple Indie radio promoters will be hire to get the song to everyone. Their job will be, to make sure all the dj's in with in their networks, from clubs to radio have received the song, get their feedback and see what people think about it).
4, 500.00 - Music Video Release Parties (places and locations where people seem to be more into the project, we will travel to and screen the video for them before it goes to TV).
$ 10,500.00 - EDM and Reggae remix of the song (In order to reach an even bigger audience, we are going to have have some of the biggest producers in those genres remix the song for us and send to radio opening more doors.).
$ 46,000.00 - Promo Shows and appearances (Events and shows that the artists will not be paid for to be there and we will have to pay out of pocket to satisfy fans, take photos, autograph signings and more).
$ 28,999.00 - PROMO SUV PURCHASE (We will purchase a 2010 GMC Yukon Denali which will be used to travel and transport artists, Dancers, Managers and all necessary promotional material, from banners, flyers, CD's DVD'S, Camera crew and so on.EXAMPLE: From one of our past campaigns. It gives you the basic idea of what we will do with the promo vehicle in order to promote!
$ 4,500.00 - GAS for SUV for the entire length of the promotional period, coast to coast.


$3,400.00 - CD DUPLICATION: (We are duplicating 5000 units, Full Color, CD(s), Jacket with Shrinkwrap for our "What They Want" 2015 TOUR promotional Mixtape to hand out FREE at events , shows and concerts.)




The ImpactOur goals and priorities for the "What They Want" TOUR project is to have the ARTIST GO ON TOUR, have her Jump on other TOURS already slated, do a ton of PROMOTIONS for her while on TOUR: from magazines, radio interviews, TV, Concerts, we need to Travel, make hundreds of Appearances, hand out promotional materials, do Promo Shows, get on other promo tours and so on. I have done this sort of thing for major labels (with big budgets) as a consultant or booking agent an have an excellent track record, and I am constantly learning. This is a really wonderful opportunity to help us continue on our mission at the same time help brand indie music, new talent and most importantly make a teenagers dreams come true. Your contribution will allow to get on as many tours as we can this summer, travel for interviews (TV, RADIO, MAGAZINES), appearances all around the country and even a few dates out of the country. 

Risks & Challenges
It's not going to be all butterflies and daisies. We have until May 29th to raise all the funds and start making reservations get flyers printed, CD's Duplicated, Hire Street teas and so on.. so it's a bit of a race. The talent and work ethic is there, but for some reason, magical doors open when you have money. Weird! 
If we could afford to fund all the PROMOTIONAL EXPENSES for the "What They Want" project and MAKE THE ARTISTS DREAMS COME TRUE all on our own, we would. But the truth is... we can’t, especially all at once. In order to go on tour and get her on these other tours by our associates, it’s going to take a village helping us or a NETWORK of people working together as a unit. This is why we are using crowd funding to raise the necessary funds to HELP US run one of the hardest and biggest indie run promo campaigns possible.... we love you guys, we love what we do, and we want you to be part of that with us.


ASSOCIATES TOUR DATES WE ARE SCHEDULED TO HAVE HER ON AS AN OPENING ACT!


​JUICY J -  (The Hustle Continues Tour)​May 30 – Denver, CO – FillmoreJune 3 – Minneapolis, MN – Skyway TheatreJune 5 – Indianapolis, IN – Egyptian RoomJune 6 – Chicago, IL – House of BluesJune 7 – Detroit, MI – St Andrews HallJune 8 – Cleveland, OH – House of BluesJune 10 – Boston, MA – House of BluesJune 12 – Wallingford, CT – The DomeJune 13 – Philadelphia, PA – TLAJune 15 – New York, NY – Irving PlazaJune 17 – Washington DC – FillmoreJune 18 – Raleigh, NC – The RitzJune 19 – Charlotte, NC – FillmoreJune 20 – Myrtle Beach, SC – House of BluesJune 25 – Atlanta, GA – TabernacleJune 26 – Orlando, FL – Venue 578June 27 – Miami Beach, FL – FillmoreJune 28 – Tampa, FL – Ritz Ybor​



​Boosie Bad Azz​May 22 - South Bend, ​IN​ ​@ The Morris Center



Summer Jam - Seattle:
TI, KID INK, E-40, BOB, ACTION BRONSON, JOEY BADASSJune 20 - Summer Jam - Seattle, Wa


Flo-ridaMay 1 - Las Veges @ Sapphire ​





2 Chainz /​ Rae SremmurdMay 9 - San Jose, Ca @ Santa Clara Fairgrounds


Wale
Music Festival - Anguilla Youth Sports Foundation - Caribean IslandsJuly 5 - Sandy Ground Beach - Anguilla


Greece - Europe Festival
​http://www.zanteshutdown.com
May 21 -​
24th​


Brazil Tour - Bone Thugs & Harmony
May 8 - Rio De Janeiro @ ​Fundicao ProgressoMay 9 - Brasilia @ Smurphies Disco Club​May 10 - Sao Paulo @ Via Marques​





Festival - Dublin, Irelandhttp://www.youbloom.com/June ​11, 12, 13


​Yo GottiMay 6 - Vancouver, BC CANADA @ ​Harbour Event Centre

I AM GlobaL Festival (French Montana / Rae Sremmurd)
http://www.iamglobalfestival.com/line-up/
June 6 - Barcelona, Spain - UK



Together we can build more perks that involves your business, or create a unique gift for donors that promotes your business and supports this project.
Lets get creative!


Other Ways You Can Help
We know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help... if you are unable to donate at this time,  you can still help in several  important ways:

direct people to our IndieGogo page.
share the campaign video on your FB page.
email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best).
tell music magazines/websites/blogs/and other relevant pros about our "What They Want" project.
tell your friends directly (old school style.... offline).
SUBSCRIBE to our JEI NETWORK youtube channel.
FOLLOW me J. Jewels on twitter.
Like our JEI NETWORK page on facebook.
visit our website browse, share news, castings, new music info or SUBSCRIBE to our mailing list.

Anything you can do to help generate some noise to let others know is a beautiful sound! There are wonderful and easily accessed tools on IndieGogo that will help you share this campaign .  This is almost as important to the campaign as actually getting donations from all of you. People need to know that this is happening.

DOWNLOAD the song from AMAZON for $0.99.


Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

What happens if we don't reach our target goal?What ever we raise will help us with the campaign and funds will be use towards the "WHAT THEY WANT" promo tour CAMPAIGN we may need to cut out some dates, print less promo materials, and so on... we will not give up on trying to raise the funds.
If you have questions, feel free to contact us!Or E-mail me J. Jewels directly: jjewels@jewelseinc.com

story:
The reason

We are Idler from Dallas, Texas and we want to share something with you. We absolutely love creating music and by supporting this campaign it will bring you something more than just being a part of an album.  We will share our world and give you the opportunity to witness thru video updates the passion and compromises it takes to make our goals obtainable as well as the path which we'll take to reach the cheese at the end of this maze. There are no shortcuts in life and in this "do it yourself" world and especially industry, every single one of you counts. 

No such thing as a free lunch. 

The studios that we are choosing are professional in every aspect down to the soap dispensers in the bathrooms so it can be a bit pricey as you may imagine. This next part will help you understand where the money is going as well as what we shall do if we surpass our goal.

Fifty50 studios

  • 10 recording sessions @ $400/per 8hr block
  • 5 mixing sessions @ $100/per session
  • and $500 to have everything mastered and sounding pretty
In the event that we raise more money than we anticipated, we would use it a number of ways. 
1. A trailer! We could put things in there. From traveling our cars have taken a beating, and that's no fun for anyone. 
2. Restock as well as introducing new merchandise! Everyone loves hats, socks, shirts, tanks, gloves, masks, capes, pillowcases, snuggies, slankets etc....
3. IDLER on Vinyl! We are looking to put out a limited edition vinyl with some special        gifts for everyone in there. And let's face it, they just sound better. 

"If there is no struggle, there is no progress."

If an artist gets signed to a major label today, most likely they spend their entire career just paying the label back instead of coming out ahead. That's why we're ok with working for it. If it takes clocking in at a job that you hate to achieve something you love whether that be a new car, to support your family, or taking a snapshot in time by recording an album that is part of your artistic legacy, it's always worth the struggle. 

Ways you can help without going broke:

Remember, you can always do more than donate. Please send all your lovely friends to facebook.com/idlerband and follow us on instagram @Idlerband and share our campaign! See you soon.

story:
Hola, gracias por leer mi historia.

Mas abajo encuentras un relato completo de la historia de Andrés Felipe, pero en estos tiempos de carreras, déjame muy rápidamente mencionarte algunas razones por las que te pedimos el favor de ayudar a Andrés Felipe:

1. Es uno de los pocos menores de edad en Colombia que ha aplicado a la beca de piano en Brevard Music Center y ha sido admitido. Eso lo logró compitiendo con más de 2000 aplicantes de todo el mundo.

2. De los aproximadamente 120 estudiantes que iniciaron estudios hace cuatro años en el Programa Básico del Conservatorio de la Universidad Nacional, es el único que ha persistido en el piano y uno de los pocos que sigue en el Programa a nivel general. Para Andrés Felipe el piano no es un pasatiempo: es su proyecto de vida y planea ser un gran pianista a nivel internacional.

3. A la fecha, es el único estudiante de piano del Programa Básico que, en términos de calidad y conocimiento, está a la altura de muchos de los estudiantes de 3 y 4 semestre de pregrado.

4. A la fecha, Andrés Felipe es considerado el mejor estudiante de piano del programa básico de la Universidad Nacional.

5. Gracias a su desempeño y calidad, Andrés Felipe cuenta con una beca en la Universidad Nacional de Colombia para cubrir sus estudios de piano.

6. Si logra ir a Brevard, estará aprendiendo de algunos de los mejores pianistas del mundo.

7. Andrés Felipe se ha comprometido con que, a su regreso, dará 3 conciertos para instituciones como clínicas, hospitales, etc. En el evento de que estas instituciones cobren por la presentación, todos los fondos recaudados por boletería serán donados.

Si quieres conocer mas de Andrés Felipe, sigue leyendo, pero no te olvides de hacer la donación.

Mi nombre es Andrés Felipe Rocha M. Vivo en Bogotá - Colombia, tengo 16 años y desde los seis estudio piano.

Quiero convertime en uno de los mejores pianistas del mundo, se que lo lograré con esfuerzo y dedicación y dependiendo de la voluntad de Dios.

Esta petición es para que me ayudes a aprovechar media beca que obtuve en el Brevard Music Center, http://www.brevardmusic.org/  si logro asistir mejoraré notablemente mi técnica y desempeño, porque aprenderé de la mano de los mejores pianistas del mundo.

En este momento curso 9 semestre de piano en el programa básico de música de la Universidad Nacional, estoy becado por mérito académico, puedes confirmarlo con mi maestro Sr. Raul Mesa en la Facultad de Música del Conservatorio de la Universidad Nacional: Ciudad Universitaria - Edificio 305 - Secretaria del Conservatorio Tel: 3165000 ext:12505, en Bogotá.

Apliqué y obtuve media beca en el Brevard Music Center, http://www.brevardmusic.org/  puedes ver el video de aplicación aquí: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PEs94rU9rkg .

La media beca no cubre toda la estadía, ni los transportes:  

Este es el cubrimiento:

Merit Award: $1,600.00
Financial Aid: $1,200.00
Total Award: $2,800.00

Y este es el dinero que me hace falta para cubrir el costo total:

Balance Due: $3,500.00

A tu solicitud puedo darte acceso a mi cuenta de usuario en http://www.brevardmusic.org/institute/application/ para que lo revises.

Así que para poder aprovechar la beca necesito cubrir al menos  tres áreas:

1. US$3500 - El excedente que exige Brevard Music Center y que debo pagar a mas tardar el 15 de junio de 2015
2. US$995 Para el tiquete aéreo Bogotá - Washington - Bogotá
3. US$200 Para transportarme, posiblemente en bus desde Washington a Brevard y el regreso y los gastos minimos de la estadía.

Aprovechar esta oportunidad me abrirá otras puertas  por ejemplo en Londrés o Alemania, si lo logro, posiblemente un día me veas en los grandes escenarios mundiales, ayúdame con una donación y difundiendo esta solicitud, con las herramientas que provee este portal.

Estos son los datos de contacto de mi papá:

Carlos E. Rocha M.
CC 19388547
Tels. 752 0964 - Cel. 311 588 2312
Mail: info@e-commerceagency.com

Y estos los mios:
Andrés Felipe Rocha
Tels. 752 0964 - Cel.305 266 8730
feliperocha_98@hotmail.com

story:
Short Summary

We are an up and coming high school metal band, composed of 5 very talented musicians,. Austin Gillette-Rhythm Guitar, Isaiah Swift-Lead Vocals, Joel Roeber (forged in the fiery depths of hell)-Lead Guitar/Vocals, Nathan Harms-Drums, and Trent Elizondo-Bass. We've all been playing music for at least 5 years, so we decided to come together to form a band, Amnija. Our first performance was in the winter of 2012, when we took first place in a Gorilla BOB, advancing to the finals and ultimately taking 2nd place. This opened up so many opportunities for us, which has given us the ability to perform numerous shows at venues such as The Hop, The Checkerboard, The Knitting Factory, The Viking Bar and Grill, and The Big Dipper, and continue as a band. Now Juniors (and a freshman) in high school, we're better than ever, and only getting better.

Our goal is to finish production on our first album by June or July. As of now, the album, yet to be named, sits at a litte under halfway done. In order for us to complete it, we need your help! Having only released a four song EP, Temporary Insanity, it is very important to us that we finish a whole album.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for an amount of $1500.00. This will allow us to finish tracking, mixing, and mastering on the album. This will also put a significant dent in the production of physical copies of our album. 

What we want to offer to you are physical copies of the new album, shirts, stickers, "A Special Thanks To..." credits on the album, and a chance to be heard on the album. 

If it happens to be that we don't reach our entire the goal, the money will be prioritized into finishing the tracking, mixing, and mastering of the album.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would very much appreciate if you could share this campaign with your friends and family! DOn't forget to use the IndiGogo share tools!

story:
This year I will be running 5 Half Marathons in 5 months in an attempt to break 5 Guinness World Records. Essentially this will be 65.5 miles of utter madness in order to raise money for Diabetes UK and Birmingham-based charity LoveBrum.

I will be attempting to set a new World Record for the Fastest Half Marathon in five different fancy dress categories.

Full Graduation Attire at Liverpool Rock n Roll Marathon (14 June)

Current Record: 1hr 57m 40sec

Dressed as a Rockstar at Dublin Rock n Roll Half Marathon (2 August)

Dressed as a TV Character at the Great North Run (13 September)

Current Record: 1hr 33m 46sec

Record Attempt TBC at Cardiff Half Marathon (4 October)

There’s a few options for this one but I guarantee it’ll be a good’un!!

Wearing a 3 Piece Suit at Great Birmingham Run (18 October)

Current Record: 1hr 39m 50sec

I first conjured up this crazy idea for charity when I decided to run my very first 26 miles at the Madrid Rock n Roll Marathon in April 2014. Like all good ideas it came after a few glasses of wine (the night before the run) and after many more glasses of wine here we are!!

·  2014 was the first time I had run more than 10k in over a decade.

·  It was the first time I had ever been to a gym in my entire life.

·  I have also never been part of a running club… ever.

·  I am still partial to the occasional (frequent) kebab and wine will always be a part of my life.

Stepping it up from being a casual runner to a multiple world record holder is going to be tough.......

Why Diabetes UK

My little brother has recently been diagnosed with Diabetes and it made me realise how life changing it actually is (he knows I would make a good back up and would happily stab him in the leg with his needle if it was ever called for!). When I made the decision to raise money for charity it was an easy choice to include Diabetes UK.

Diabetes UK is the leading charity that cares for, connects with and campaigns on behalf of every person affected by or at risk of diabetes. They provide information, help and peer support, so people with diabetes can manage their condition effectively. We are one of the largest funders of diabetes research in the UK.

And what is LoveBrum?

LoveBrum is a charity.  But not any normal charity.  Across Birmingham, there are great people and organisations working hard to make Birmingham better.  But, not all of these amazing causes receive the funding they need to have maximum impact. LoveBrum exists to bridge that gap. LoveBrum finds hard-to-reach projects doing great things for Birmingham, and then asks its members to vote for the causes they believe ought to be helped.

The projects that LoveBrum will support will be local and deliver specific projects that in turn make the city better.

LoveBrum will be directed by its members; their supporters will have their say; all money raised in Brum will stay in Brum; and LoveBrum will support a number of different projects every year. Nice, eh?  

You'll also be glad to know that 100% of all fundraising monies will go towards the supported projects.

I really hope you can dig deep to help me on this journey.  Every penny counts and thanks in advance.
story_txt:
This year I will be running 5 Half Marathons in 5 months in an attempt to
break 5 Guinness World Records. Essentially this will be 65.5 miles of utter
madness in order to raise money for Diabetes UK and Birmingham-based charity LoveBrum. 
I will be attempting to set a new World Record for the Fastest Half
Marathon in five different fancy dress categories. 
Full Graduation Attire
at Liverpool Rock n Roll Marathon (14 June)
Current Record: 1hr 57m 40sec
Dressed as a Rockstar at Dublin Rock n Roll Half Marathon (2 August)
Dressed as a TV
Character at the Great North Run (13 September)
Current Record: 1hr 33m 46sec
Record Attempt TBC at
Cardiff Half Marathon (4 October)
There’s a few options for this one but I guarantee it’ll be a good’un!!
Wearing a 3 Piece Suit
at Great Birmingham Run (18 October)
Current Record: 1hr 39m 50sec
I first conjured up this crazy idea for charity when I decided to run my
very first 26 miles at the Madrid Rock n Roll Marathon in April 2014. Like all
good ideas it came after a few glasses of wine (the night before the run) and after
many more glasses of wine here we are!!
· 
2014 was the first time I had run more than 10k in over a decade.
· 
It was the first time I had ever been to a gym in my entire life.
· 
I have also never been part of a running club… ever.
· 
I am still partial to the occasional (frequent) kebab and wine will

story:
My name is Emily Rumball. I am currently studying my double major BA at the University of Toronto. I am 20 years old. Currently all of my money goes towards rent, tuition and food (because staying alive is important). Music has been an outlet and passion of mine since I can remember. Two of my earliest memories are hopping up on the kitchen table and singing 'Part of Your World' from the Little Mermaid to my entire household and serenading my dog with A Whole New World' from Aladdin (as you may guess, I am a huge Disney fan). I started writing poetry at the age of 10 or 11 and for my 14th birthday I asked for a guitar. Since then my life has changed drastically. Music became my diary and has been the only outlet I have found that has allowed me to really express myself. It's like my own form of therapy. As cliche as it sounds it would really be a dream come true to be able to record an EP.

Recording an EP is something I would love to cross off my bucket list. I have met with a producer and he has told me that recording a simple acoustic recording of a song would cost about 300 dollars and songs with full band back up would cost 700 dollars. I will post the links below to my SoundCloud and YouTube pages for you to decide for yourself whether or not you believe I am worth investing in. If you choose to invest, it would really mean the world to me.

There's always a risk that comes with a project like this. But if none of us took any risks, none of us would attain our dreams. This is my effort to chase mine. 

SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/emilyrumballmusic

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/user/emilyrumballmusic

story:
HELP HOMBRE SURVIVE (AND IMPROVE)

After having spent more than a year relatively scraping by barely sustaining itself, we have encountered a few issues which we really can not afford as finances are tight and our shows very rarely hold the venue open, let alone turn a profit!
As we are the only All Ages venue in Newcastle, it's super important we can keep this going and working at a sustainable level, for everyone.


WHAT IS HOMBRE RECORDS?

Over the last year we have established ourselves as one of the most popular Newcastle venues for touring bands hosting a wide arrange of international acts of all sorts of genres including Weekend Nachos(US), Bury Tomorrow(UK), Heights(UK), Black Tongue(UK), Basement(UK), Real Friends(US), Birds in Row(Fr), Merauder(US), American Sharks(US), Counterparts(CN) and more!
As well as prominent Australian acts King Parrot, Graves, Clowns, Endless Heights, Against, With Confidence, Make Them Suffer Vices and Trophy Eyes.

We have been the launching pad for a large number of local bands who previously had no where else to play, in over one year we have hosted hundreds of bands and thousands of eager attendees.

WHAT WE NEED AND HOW YOU CAN HELP OUT

Basically we are due to pay for insurance and licenses to keep the shop open and going, we are also aiming to buy better quality, more powerful speakers for the front of house so that we can accommodate larger international acts.

To help out you can always donate and put us closer towards our goal!

If money is short (trust me, we more than understand) just give this a share, help us get some exposure for this and keep Newcastles all ages live music scene alive!

story:
We already got my 6th studio album in the can at the oh-so-fabulous Wire Road Studios with Engineer Andy Bradley at the helm & James Kelly the mastering wizard.  It's available as a digital download but we don't have tangible CDs and haven't been able to ship copies to my promotor because we need your help! There are some snazzy perks you can snatch up with your contribution and they're all win win! No freebie donations here (unless you don't want the perk, of course).

My life has been inundated with insurance company battles for reimbursement for my autistic son's therapy costs to the tune of $109,000 annually so, needless to say, I've been strapped financially. The only way this fantastic recording (with Guitarist Paul Chester, bassist David Craig, Drummer Sebastian Whittaker, trumpeter Dennis Dotson & Saxophonist Warren Sneed) will get on the airwaves like all my previous albums will be if I get help from you fine folks! Thanks in advance for whatever you can pitch in. -Tianna

*All perks are negotiable.  If you want to contribute $100 but would rather have 10 CDs, for instance, that's totally fine.  If you want to contribute $500 but would rather have me and a guitarist come play at your house, totally cool.  Just holler at me and let me know what you're thinking and I'll see if I can honor your request before you make your contribution: Tianna@TiannaHall.com

story:
Rhinestone Steel is committed to creating all-inclusive queer spaces that inspire, motivate, challenge and nurture. Rhinestone Steel is political. Rhinestone Steel is queers, music, art, dance and inspiration!

Our mission is to help facilitate growth within Pittsburgh’s queer music and arts scenes, ultimately furthering the LGBTQ community through cultural support. We seek to accomplish this by organizing events for local and national queer artists to showcase their art, performances, music, share information and educate, network, and provide a safer space to dance!

Rhinestone Steel (RSS) hosts local and nationally recognized musical performers, showcases queer art, and provides a platform for educational resources as well through our workshops and skill sharing events in a festival format. RSS allows queers and allies to come together in a safe and fun environment.  Rhinestone Steel is more than just a music festival; it is a political action in celebration of our community.  In an environment where queer voices are seldom heard in mainstream music and arts spaces, Rhinestone Steel aims to not only celebrate our community’s varied talents, but also spark new inspiration within our community.  Rhinestone Steel is a community run event. The outcome is a product of many artists taking part. RSS aims to serve a diverse group of people and experiences all within the queer umbrella.  The queer community is vast in our experiences and cultures. We are all queer, we are all in the same queer community, but we are not all the same.  We need to build connections between these diverse communities so that our artists have opportunities to perform. We show Pittsburgh that queer audiences are important, so that it is easier for everyone to get gigs and to grow a more vibrant and active community.  Therefore, while curating the Rhinestone Steel festival, we try to bring together a wide variety of voices.  We believe our oppression is intersectional and in order to truly represent the community and fight our oppression, our festival must be intersectional and draw from many different minorities and backgrounds within the queer landscape.

RSS is a space for queers to show the extent of their artistic expression.  We showcase a wide variety of music and arts from queer people with diverse backgrounds, including performance art, slam poetry and poetry readings, music performers, videos, dance, and puppet shows. Having our voices be heard, taken seriously, and encouraged is a challenge that many queer artists face, in the mainstream art world and even among ‘liberal’ artists.  Our experiences as people who are in marginalized groups are unique and are not always met with a receptive audience or a welcoming stage.  Now as always in the world, being queer is political.  Simply existing as a queer person directly questions mainstream society.  RSS is not only a festival, but also a space where queer folks can share resources: organizations come to “table” with political information, support resources, and opportunities to become involved.  It’s a way to get the community more educated about what’s going on in the area and a way for people to become involved.  

To make this year's Rhinestone Steel possible we will need $3000. The money we raise will go to performers travel and stage fees, our technical employees such as sound technicians, venue fees, insurance, sound and lighting equipment, etc.  Our gifts to you, other than some totally awesome Queer festivities, are totally one of a kind rhinestone steel t-shirts!! (while supplies last)

story:
Short Summary

Hey there! We are Live Like Glass. You may have seen our videos floating around on YouTube. (i.e. Bryan Stars, Etienne Sin, Live Like Glass Official.)


We're currently crossing the bridge of dream to reality! We finally have the opportunity to make it to so many new places! It's just not exactly the cheapest journey to pursue.

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $2,500. It's not enough to cover everything we need, but It's a great start! With the right financial backing we will be able to go farther and to newer places! No matter what we will find a way to get on the road and play for you!

There are so many great perks we've made for you! Thing's we've never done before! So many cool ways that we can interact directly with you! <3 

New perks will show up as we think of more!

The Impact

For three years we've been able to grow with you as a band, as people, as a family. That's really with this all is. We are family. We are people you can count on. This is OUR dream. This is OUR journey. Every one of you made this all possible.
Getting back on the road is the next level for us!

Risks & Challenges

Whenever a band makes the decision to take to the road there is infinite risks and challenged. That never scared us before! We've gone through tires blowing on icy roads, left in 14 degree weather overnight, light fuses blowing while driving on a pitch black road, and being stranded for days in Texas with no money! With your help and support we are ready to take on the world one tour at a time! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? No problem! :)
All we ask is that you share this link around! Let everyone know we need help!
You have more of an effect on us than you know!

Thank you for taking your time to look at this! <3

story:
Straight to the Point

We are a collection of Winnipeg's most talented DJ's, Producers, and Musicians who have been lucky to share our music with others. It is time for us to use our passion to help others. We would like to raise $5000, all of which will go to the Children's Wish Foundation.

Any amount of donation is appreciated, and all proceeds go towards making the dream of a special kid come true. The Children's Wish Foundation has granted thousands of wishes of children diagnosed with a life-threatening illness. So, every donation goes a long way in making dreams of many a reality, but sharing this project with other people too is hugely appreciated. 

A big thank you to all those who have helped out with this whole process. The amount of support from these special individuals and businesses means so much to us.

The cost for studio time and traveling to the studios is so expensive and this campaign is to hopefully get help reaching my goal. Please help as I can't do this without the support of my fans. I love you all.

story:
Hi all, my name is James Midambo (also known as El Mayor), a sound engineer living in Nairobi, Kenya.

Ever since I was a child I've had dreams of becoming a musician and have made that dream come true by studying hard and working hard.

I grew up in the slums of Nairobi and have throughout the last few years worked with children both at the ABC Children's Aid and SOS Villages.

Now I have been offered the opportunity to travel to Holland and meet with a music producer and learn more about creating music. However with low income, the travel cost, visa and insurance is not something I have available.

I'm only asking for enough to pay for my airfare, insurance and visa as I will be able to stay with a friend in Holland.

For more information on my music please check out my YouTube link and soundcloud:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dGI5BIB1YUA

https://soundcloud.com/user5179740

story:
My name is Dana Michael and I am a 26 year old country singer from Massachusetts. I am starting a campaign to raise money to record my debut solo album, Friday Night Sessions.

I have been doing music for over 10 years and I finally took a step in the direction to be the artist I always wanted to be, but never knew I had the capability to become.

With the help of my management team, I have gotten the chance to go down to Arkansas this summer and record the music that I am so incredibly proud of.  

Knowing full well that this is by far the biggest opportunity, I have to do everything I can to make this happen. This is why I am asking all of you to help me make this opportunity happen.

With this Indigogo project I am trying to raise $8,000 dollars. That is the cost of recording my full length album, having it mixed and mastered. Once the album is done I want to shoot a music video and do a small promo run to promote the album. 


With this Indigogo I am offering rewards from early digital copies of my single to a signed copy of the album and even a spot in my first ever music video. 

I can't stress how much every dollar helps. I am doing a feature on Indigogo that lets me keep fundraising even after I reach my goal. Recording an album, shooting a video, doing promo costs a lot of money so anything made over my goal will go right to the project to bring you bigger and better things. 

When I began on this journey I knew I could not do this alone. I needed to have not only a great team in place to help make everything physically happen but I would need amazing fans to be a part of this journey from start to finish. I want to have the amazing group of people that believe in me and what I am doing to have a hand in everything I am about to do. 

I am more than ready to start making my album but I need help. I know what I need to do but now I need my amazing fans, friends and anyone who is passionate about music to show me what they can do.

Previously, in the bands I've been in, we really depended on each other but now as a solo artist I realize how much I depend on my fans and friends. I have you all to lean on and help me. Although it may just be my name on this album, I know that I won't be doing it alone.

So I know all too well that asking for monetary donations is hard for some people. Hey it's hard for me, it's why I need to ask for help. If you can't donate monetarily please donate your time and efforts to spread the word to others who may be able to help monetarily.

Everything helps, whether you tweet about the project for the next 35 days or you donate a dollar. You are so amazing and I will be so grateful that you took the time to help with my journey.

Previously, in the bands I've been in, we really depended on each other but now as a solo artist I realize how much I depend on my fans and friends. I have you all to lean on and help me. Although it may just be my name on this album, I know that I won't be doing it alone.
So I know all too well that asking for monetary donations is hard for some people. Hey it's hard for me, it's why I need to ask for help. If you can't donate monetarily please donate your time and efforts to spread the word to others who may be able to help monetarily.
Everything helps, whether you tweet about the project for the next 35 days or you donate a dollar. You are so amazing and I will be so grateful that you took the time to help with my journey.

story:
What It's About

Hey,

My name is George and I'm the guy who is accidentally posing like Hussain Boult above. With me you can see my good friends and fellow musicians Holly Bowen, Dave Miller, Axton Ezekiela, Justin Manuel and Andrew Gould. 

We are Faded Farewell.

I started Faded Farewell because I wanted to share not just one message but several. I wanted to sing and play stories that people can relate to and hopefully draw hope from in a world full of mixed messages.

Recently we recorded an EP at the wonderful Tsunami Sound Studios and came away with four of those stories.

Now we want to finish them, so that we can share them with as many people as possible. 

What I'm asking of you is to help us do that. Our EP is complete but we need help to distribute it. The money we raise here will go towards having CDs manufactured (as well as a short run of Vinyl), distributing the music digitally to platforms like iTunes and Spotify and if possible, finding even more ways to share what we do with you.

What We Need & What You Get

The rough breakdown of what we are looking for is this:

  • $1500 will go towards manufacturing the CDs and Vinyl.
  • $100-$200 will allow us to distribute our music to streaming services and sales platforms such as Spotify and iTunes respectively.
  • The rest will help us with out EP release party planned for October.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, any money we raise will first and foremost go to manufacturing the CDs.
  • If we somehow manage to raise beyond our goal, we will look at merchandising or possibly even a music video.
There are plenty of options for you to contribute with some appropriate rewards and some unique rewards for those willing to go the extra mile!

It's Not A Competition

We realise there are a few of these out there at the moment, but it's important that we're clear about not competing.
If you identify with us, our music and our message, then we would love you to contribute however you can. If you feel obligated to support another campaign over us because it means more to you, then we get that too.
This is a means for those who believe in us, our music and our message and want to help us reach our goal, while also being a part of it.
In other words, go with your gut!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that there are those out there who can't help in a financial way but really want to help us out! 

For those of you in this position, please: 

  • Like and share the Facebook page www.facebook.com/fadedfarewellofficial
  • Join the mailing list at www.fadedfarewell.com 
  • Share this campaign as furiously as you can!


If you read all the way here then regardless of whether you contribute, 

Thank You

story:
Hey there!

My name is Kim, and I’ve been a musician my whole life. From piano lessons to high school marching band, and even now as I wrap up my final semesters getting my Bachelor of Arts in Music, I’ve always found a sense of purpose in performing, composing, and sharing in music.

It has become clear over the past few months that my next big step in life has to be to pursue my music career full-time. Having made this decision, I’m super excited for what my future holds, knowing that I’ll be pursuing my passion. I love electronic music, so that's what I'm going to produce!

But this path has considerable start-up costs. This campaign is to raise the funds for the equipment that I need to be able to produce the kind of music that I love.

I came to the idea of crowdfunding these startup costs because, ultimately, my music is as much about the community of fans and supporters as it is about me! I love bringing people together through music, and having shared experiences through music. Crowdfunding the startup costs couldn’t have been a better fit with my goals!

What Your Contribution Goes Towards:

Essentially, I need my instrument. To produce the music that I want, I need:

  • Ableton Live software
  • MIDI controller
  • Studio monitors
  • Microphone
  • Audio interface
  • Tons of extra cables and chords to hook it all up

Your contribution will go directly to the purchasing of these things, no more and no less!

The Impact

Taking this plunge into pursuing music full-time is hands down the biggest thing I’ve ever done with my life. It feels so right and so pure of intention, like the Universe is telling me to go for it, and I’m so excited to finally be taking the first step.

I can’t thank you enough for your donation. You are giving me the first step into making my dream a reality.

And feel free to contact me personally if you have any questions, I’d love to have the opportunity to personally thank you for your contribution!

If you can't contribute, please pass this along to somebody who can!

story:
We had the dream a few years ago of seeing Tucson become a place where songs of prayer for our city were written and shared all across our community. That dream compelled like-minded songwriters and musicians to come to the table to create original songs for our hometown, and City Psalms was born. We're a collaborative songwriting collective of followers of Jesus across our city, writing original music to foster prayer-for and service-to our community. 



Our first album, City Psalms One, was released in January of 2014. Our songwriting process reflected the tension of wanting to be the hands and feet of Jesus in our city, but not really knowing how to do it; and our songs of prayer developed from that posture: From every part of the city, Lord, let Your Kingdom come... Will you do something here, Lord, that's never been done before... We've heard all the words, but we need You to show us how...  

Our new album, City Psalms Two, will build on the prayers of City Psalms One, but with a deeper emphasis on the conviction that it takes a transformed, unified Church to truly make a difference in our community... We will find our strength in You/ Together as we journey through/ Living Water, come and flow!/ Across the desert we call home

So, here's where we need your help:

The music is written and the studio dates are on the calendar, and we need $14,500 to record, master, and duplicate a high-quality, professional album. Every dollar donated will go directly toward the recording and release of City Psalms Two. And in exchange for your generosity there are a number of unique perks on the right side of this page. Also, City Psalms is a project under the direction of 4Tucson, a registered 501c3 non-profit organization, so your contribution is tax-deductible. 

You can also support this project by SPREADING THE WORD via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and email. When we pull this off, we'll be doing it together.

Music is a great unifier, and our hope is that this project will inspire Christians across Tucson to join in singing, writing, and sharing songs of prayer for our hometown. We believe that God responds when we pray, and we want to see His love and mercy sweep across our city like a flood. Thank you for being willing to invest in this dream alongside us!

story:
Hi everyone!

I'm Courtney Hart and I'm embarking on a new journey I want YOU to be a part of! Music has always been a big part of my life and I'm finally ready to share my music with the world! I just released a song, 'White Cadillac' which can be heard on Spotify, iTunes, and Soundcloud to name a few. Aaron Andersen produced this first track and I'm looking to do two to three more songs with him to create a full EP.
For those of you who don't know, an EP is an 'extended play' which basically means it's a few songs long. It's too few to be an album, but more songs than a single. Once an EP is complete, it's what you send out to record labels, which is what I plan on doing.
I grew up in Atlanta, Georgia and my heart is close to the southern, blue-grass, jazz roots of music. I'm inspired by the likes of James Taylor, Stevie Nicks and Lana del Rey. The music I write is very grungy, country, rock, which is what you would see with more songs as well. I'm a big advocate for Mental Healthcare Awareness, because I've had my fair share of hardships and struggled with anxiety and depression. For me, music has always been an escape, a love and a passion. I want to provide that escapism and  the manipulation and projection of feelings for others to hear. 
What this money will do, will allow you to be a part of my journey. By donating, you get a little piece of me back. I have a lot of great packages and you will be the first to hear my new music and rock my new merch. The $5000 goes to studio time, music production, mastering and mixing, and marketing. It would pay the talented musicians I have on my team, as well as my producer for his time and hard work. The money gives me the opportunity to make my thoughts a reality and a song.
My goal with this EP is to take it to Nashville and Los Angeles and scout out potential representatives who would want to sign me to their label, so I could one day create a full album. I would also love to play live shows in Los Angeles, so I can meet each and every one of you and bond over music.
For anyone even taking time to read this, I want to thank you from the bottom of my HART. I look forward to raising this money and working hard to record and play my music for you.
XO- Courtney

story:
Our Story

Frances and the Foundation was founded in 2011. The band has had several member changes over the years, but Samantha Frances has had the same vision and drive throughout.The beginning of 2015 offered the member change the group needed in order to be both artistically driven as well as motivated.


We're finally going to record our first full length record. Although we've been able to record 3 EPs, Frances and the Foundation has not had the opportunity to fully display what we're capable of. We've been given the chance to record at the legendary Sam Phillips recording services. The original Sam Phillips recording studio - the founder of Sun Records. This opportunity is an absolute dream come true for us and we could not be more thrilled to create an album that will show our voice. The recording process will be done live to tape (analogue, like before internet and autotune) to capture the energy we have on stage.


Contributing to our campaign will propel us to where we can show the world what we're artistically capable of. We live in a great era of music. It's everywhere. It's accessible. Unfortunately, there are thousands of amazing groups and people who are unable to share their talent due to the costs of recording and manufacturing a professional record. Thats' where you come in. If you've seen us live, you've experienced the energy and fun. Or if you've just listened to us online, then you've gotten a smaller picutre of who we are.


What We Need & What You Get

Recording, Mixing, Mastering, and Production $12,000                                                          Why does this cost so much? This is actually a low cost for the entire recording process. Typically, this would run around $20,000 to work with people that we are involved with. We are extremely thankful to be working with our producer, Jay Tooke and engineer Matt Ross-Spang.

Pressing, Duplication, Artwork and Packaging $6,000                                                            When pressing to vinyl, you make the master pressing plates, which is where most costly part of pressing vinyl comes in. The good news is, vinyl, itself,is not that expensive. The cost of pressing and packaging 600 vinyl records comes out to $4,000. CDs are certainly cheaper than vinyl. For 500 CDs with packaging, the cost is $600. We're working with amazing digital and physical artists for our record who certainly deserved to be paid for their work.

Perks $2,000                                                                                                                                           We want to make sure that our donors are taken care of. $350 are going to into Tote bags, $1,200 are going to t-shirts. Stickers and buttons will make up the remaning $500.

Promotion $6,000                                                                                                                                 $4,500 is going towards our publicist. The remainder is going to online advertising and radio promotion.                                                                    

The Impact

We believe in a music form that is consistent from the CD to the stage. (Farm to Table Rock) What do we mean by this? Other than a joke that just made us all laugh so hard, we are giving you our hearts and souls. It's authentic. We've dedicated our lives to playing music. We do this because we believe in what music gives to the world. People feel something when they hear our voice. Our music creates support and energy. It's not a one-way dialogue. It's art. 


Risks & Challenges

We've been playing music for our an entire adult lives. This comes with a lot of dissapointment. We know the challenges. We've faced plenty already. We're lucky to have a strong and friendly community around us that we're not afraid of asking for help when needed. The biggest risk for us is giving ourselves to all of you and possibly having no positive result. We're willing to take this risk because we believe in what we're doing.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has money to throw at bands and other artists - that's fine! Please sharing our campaign. You can share on social media or just by telling your friends.


Thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

story:
Releasing the next EP!!

Hello to all who are reading!  My name is Nathan Parent and I am from Ashland, Wisconsin on Lake Superior.  I grew up wanting to become a musician and since graduating from high school almost ten years ago I have worked tirelessly to achieve my dream.  

I have decided to start an online campaign to try and help the people I know and love to get a chance to pre-order and fund my newest release, "Inland Sea - EP"

The album has taken almost 4 years of effort to complete and it is SO close to being done.  The last step requires the financial support of my friends, family, and fans of my music from around the world.  With your help, I can birth the next best set of music I have produced and share it with the world at large.


100 Pre-orders can make the dream a reality!

Since starting the process of writing and recording the album, there have been a lot of financial costs.  Studio time, paying musicians, travel expenses, graphic design work, and more.  In total I have probably spent around $3,000 to do all of this, but I am still in need of a bit more to finalize the printing and release stage of the EP.  

I have worked with some of the most talented people I know to get this all wrapped up and we've discovered that with only 100 sales of the physical copy of the album, we can fund the first 200 printings!   

If we get our full goal, we can pay the graphic design costs of around $400, print up the first 200 physical CD's for $300 and 200 album jacks with booklets for $500.  The last $300 will be used to pay for the transportation and other hidden misc. costs associated with releasing music. 


INLAND SEA - EP 

5 tracks of amazing music crafted in Wisconsin by a band of talented individuals over the course of 4 years.  Besides myself, it includes the expertise of Eric Doane on drums, Nate Bean on lead guitar, Bill Knoblauch on bass, Ed Willett on cello, Andy Dee on lap steel, and Danielle Diamond Nepstad doing female lead vocals!  Recorded, mixed, and produced at Inland Sea studio in Superior, Wisconsin by the one-of-a-kind personality Dave Hill of Crane Song Ltd/Summit Audio from 2013-2015 and co-produced by Ryan Rusch of The Weight Room Studio in Washburn, WI.
Tracks included: "Love Will Be Your Command", "Protest Age", "Energy Bullet", "When Love is Broken", and "Sorry Soul"!

PERKS!

Besides the physical copy of the new EP, I do have other material for sale in the world!  Different levels of contribution will get you a digital copy of either the first EP (the 9 track "In the Shade of Doubt - EP") or the first full length album (the 12 track "Words Without Meaning" LP).  By spending just $5 you can still get the digital release of "Inland Sea - EP", so don't be afraid if you can't afford the physical album copy. 

Your contribution matters! 

With your help you will be doing more than just getting a new album.  You will be supporting independently released and recorded music from a rather unknown area of the world and furthering my career as an artist/musician!  I cannot express how deeply I want to achieve my dream of becoming a full-time musician, but I can say that it is an immense burden emotionally to not be doing it!

When I finished my first full length album in 2010, I had no idea how I would fund its release.  I was already in debt thousands of dollars after spending three years recording, mixing, and finalizing the design.  With the help of my local coffee shop (The Black Cat Coffee House) I was able to sell 120 copies of the album and fund its completion and release!  That was a very small goal back then and I am still hoping to accelerate my career in the coming years with the assistance of my many talented friends, artists, and strangers I have yet to meet.


Risks & Challenges

We are very hopeful that you will all be able to make this dream a reality, but if not, we are still prepared to finish the journey.  I am making this campaign a flexible funded version which means that whatever funds we collect, we will keep.  So, if we do not meet our full goal, I will continue to find ways of selling the EP and getting funding.  We have a pre-order campaign started at the same coffee shop as last time.  So, with these methods it should be enough to push us up to our goal.  All who contribute will still get their album or digital release, it just may take a bit longer.  

Spread the word!!

I hope that if you cannot afford to help us this time, you will at least help us share this campaign!  Tell your friends and family and you might make a huge difference in my life and the lives of my children. Thank you a thousand times!
story_txt:
Releasing the next EP!! Hello to all who are reading!  My name is Nathan Parent and I am from Ashland, Wisconsin on Lake Superior.  I grew up wanting to become a musician and since graduating from high school almost ten years ago I have worked tirelessly to achieve my dream.  
I have decided to start an online campaign to try and help the people I know and love to get a chance to pre-order and fund my newest release, "Inland Sea - EP"
The album has taken almost 4 years of effort to complete and it is SO close to being done.  The last step requires the financial support of my friends, family, and fans of my music from around the world.  With your help, I can birth the next best set of music I have produced and share it with the world at large.
   100 Pre-orders can make the dream a reality! Since starting the process of writing and recording the album, there have been a lot of financial costs.  Studio time, paying musicians, travel expenses, graphic design work, and more.  In total I have probably spent around $3,000 to do all of this, but I am still in need of a bit more to finalize the printing and release stage of the EP.  
I have worked with some of the most talented people I know to get this all wrapped up and we've discovered that with only 100 sales of the physical copy of the album, we can fund the first 200 printings!   
If we get our full goal, we can pay the graphic design costs of around $400, print up the first 200 physical CD's for $300 and 200 album jacks with booklets for $500.  The last $300 will be used to pay for the transportation and other hidden misc. costs associated with releasing music. 


INLAND SEA - EP 5 tracks of amazing music crafted in Wisconsin by a band of talented individuals over the course of 4 years.  Besides myself, it includes the expertise of Eric Doane on drums, Nate Bean on lead guitar, Bill Knoblauch on bass, Ed Willett on cello, Andy Dee on lap steel, and Danielle Diamond Nepstad doing female lead vocals!  Recorded, mixed, and produced at Inland Sea studio in Superior, Wisconsin by the one-of-a-kind personality Dave Hill of Crane Song Ltd/Summit Audio from 2013-2015 and co-produced by Ryan Rusch of The Weight Room Studio in Washburn, WI.Tracks included: "Love Will Be Your Command", "Protest Age", "Energy Bullet", "When Love is Broken", and "Sorry Soul"!PERKS!Besides the physical copy of the new EP, I do have other material for sale in the world!  Different levels of contribution will get you a digital copy of either the first EP (the 9 track "In the Shade of Doubt - EP") or the first full length album (the 12 track "Words Without Meaning" LP).  By spending just $5 you can still get the digital release of "Inland Sea - EP", so don't be afraid if you can't afford the physical album copy. 
Your contribution matters! 
 With your help you will be doing more than just getting a new album.  You will be supporting independently released and recorded music from a rather unknown area of the world and furthering my career as an artist/musician!  I cannot express how deeply I want to achieve my dream of becoming a full-time musician, but I can say that it is an immense burden emotionally to not be doing it!
When I finished my first full length album in 2010, I had no idea how I would fund its release.  I was already in debt thousands of dollars after spending three years recording, mixing, and finalizing the design.  With the help of my local coffee shop (The Black Cat Coffee House) I was able to sell 120 copies of the album and fund its completion and release!  That was a very small goal back then and I am still hoping to accelerate my career in the coming years with the assistance of my many talented friends, artists, and strangers I have yet to meet.
   Risks & Challenges
We are very hopeful that you will all be able to make this dream a reality, but if not, we are still prepared to finish the journey.  I am making this campaign a flexible funded version which means that whatever funds we collect, we will keep.  So, if we do not meet our full goal, I will continue to find ways of selling the EP and getting funding.  We have a pre-order campaign started at the same coffee shop as last time.  So, with these methods it should be enough to push us up to our goal.  All who contribute will still get their album or digital release, it just may take a bit longer.  
   Spread the word!!
I hope that if you cannot afford to help us this time, you will at least help us share this campaign!  Tell your friends and family and you might make a huge difference in my life and the lives of my children. Thank you a thousand times!

story:
Future Shock are proud to announce that they are going to record their second album this year, but they need your help to make it happen!

For those who don't know, Future Shock is a brand new heavy rock band born in the early 2011 in London, UK.

The band,which features Andy Basiola on guitar, Luka "Twitch" Ravase on vocals, Gus Macricostas on bass and brazilian drummer Arnaldo Rogano is intended to re-introduce the power and the vitality of 80's and 90's rock music with a personal touch that surely won't disappoint you.

The band has released their first Self titled EP in 2011, produced by Mel Gabbitas (who worked with artists such as Fast Eddie Clark, Clive Burr, John Payne, Pete Willis, Dan Baird), mixed and mastered by Atila Ardanuy (worked with Luka and Arnaldo's metal band Cavalar, Dr.Sin, etc...).
In 2014 Future Shock released their debut album "Live For Today", produced and mixed by Phil Kinman (Doogie White, Tank, Driven, etc...) and mastered by Ade Emsley (Iron Maiden, Voodoo Six, Steve Harris). The album received outstanding reviews, and it was also included in Powerplay Magazine with a 9/10 rating.

In Future Shock you'll find, not only outstanding musicianship, but also unique melodies and groovy riffs that will immediately make you stomp your foot.

In reward for your funding we can guarantee that you will receive a great product, an amazing rock album (think of of bands like Deep Purple, Black Sabbath, Whitesnake, Led Zeppelin, ACDC, etc...)
We Need to raise £2000 to cover studio costs, mixing, mastering, photos, artwork, distribution

Help us make this happen and spread the word! You can share this on Facebook, Twitter, whenever you like. We are here to keep good rock music alive and kicking!
Let's tell the truth, it's very hard nowadays to make a living out of music, we have the music and the songs but not the money to deliver this album the way we want. Check out our music :
https://soundcloud.com/futureshockuk

Thanks for your time, you will not be disappointed.
Luca, Andy, Gus and Arnie
