story:
• My name is Micah Gaugh, I am a musician, a film maker, visual artist, novelist and 200 hr certified yoga teacher
  • In 2014 I went to Salvador Bahia and Rio to record a record which mixed genres and language.  The record is finished and now I am heading back to Bahia for Carnaval 2016.
  • I am going to seek inspiration for my next recording adventure by playing in Carnaval a total of three times in February 2016, the collective energy of performing to 15 million people should provide a transformation in thought.  I will also host a celebration for Dia do Yemanja on February 2nd for the goddess of the Ocean and teach yoga and jazz to children in Bahia for three months.


What We Need & What You Get


  • I am asking for $5000 to offset my costs of living in Bahia and plane fare as I do not expect to gain money in Brazil, but share my knowledge of yoga and music and learn Capoeira, Brazilian History and lore in hopes of bringing an understanding of their vast culture to other parts of the globe through music and art.  The money will also be used to pay musicians who will participate in the 'Dia do Yemanja' celebration.
  • for a donation of $5 or more you will receive a code to download the album 'Pessego do Veråo' produced by Arto Lindsay, Henry Schroy, Gabriel Cyr and myself.  for a donation of $50 or more you will receive a download code and a drawing from the Micah Gaugh 2015 show 'Caçador de Bonecas' presented at the Luiz Fernando Landeiro Gallery.  for a donation of $100 or more you will receive a music download, a drawing and a private yoga session for no more than 2 people via SKYPE or if I am in your area in person.
  • Any contributions are welcome and appreciated

The Impact

  • This embarkation will change my life and yours, the impact of an African American artist in Salvador is enhanced by the number of homeless children there being able to see someone their hue progressing throughout the art world giving them hope for a positive future.
  • The contributions from my first campaign produced two documentaries and a full Album with 13 songs chronicling Love, political aspects of Brazilian life and the appreciation of a beauty unequalled in any other place in the World.
  • I hope to continue learning from my Brazilian family of artists and share their insight to the modern day culture of art abloom in Salvador Bahia, Rio De Janeiro and Sao Paolo

Risks & Challenges

  • I have been in Dallas, Texas learning about yoga and though it is not too lucrative financially, I believe that a general knowledge taught to the children of Bahia will change the timbre of their society and perhaps soften the violent tendencies that abound there by having the children look inward for Peace.
  • I attend to show these children the aspects of life that have led me to a happier existence in hopes that these practices will enhance their lives and give them hope for a non-violent future and I also intend to learn from them through their sense of creativity.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't contribute, please pass this information along to your friends and family, I assure you that the outcome of this adventure will be fortuitous with art that each member of your family can appreciate and find life giving.
  • Please use the Indiegogo sharing tools to spread the word.  Bahia, here we GO!

story:
Thank you for the campaign momentum... Hear the album here! https://soundcloud.com/glenbourgeois/full-preview-inner-contacts-instrumental-meditations-on-dolphin-whale-dragonfly-seagull/s-nAxh5


NEW PERKS ADDED: Behind-the-Scenes on the Next Simple Calming Music CD, and My Keyboards on Your Song! 


Project Goal

Manufacturing for New Age CD of Instrumental Meditations on Dolphin, Whale, Dragonfly, and Seagull

Summary

Through my Simple Calming Music project, I wish to launch my concept for "meditational" music: the right balance of detail and space. I am focused on recording and distributing music which has enough detail to keep the brain gently engaged and connected (avoiding too much "drift") while being light enough to keep from overly distracting the listener. Through my first recordings, I have been able to record music which calms while helping to remain focused; I myself have benefited from these recordings as well while driving, while working, and even while relaxing.

I chose Indiegogo as my platform following a friend's suggestion that I check it out. I am glad he mentioned it to me, as: 1) unlike other more popular/visible funding sites, Indiegogo allows citizens from countries other than the United States (such as myself) to create projects and receive funding, 2) Indiegogo has respectable visibility and is well reviewed online, and 3) again unlike other more popular/visible funding sites, Indiegogo accepts both credit cards and Paypal payments. (Payment flexibility is a very important option to me here, as I am already aware that some potential funders prefer to keep their payment info secret, while others prefer to avoid the additional fees incurred through the use of services like Paypal, and still others do not have a Paypal account).

Through this Indiegogo project, I hope to launch the first CD based on my focus to create and share Simple Calming Music. "Inner Contacts: Instrumental Meditations on Dolphin, Whale, Dragonfly and Seagull" is already recorded and mastered (and thus ready for release), and I have already launched the www.simplecalmingmusic.com website to promote Simple Calming Music's projects. What remain are the funds to manufacture 500 copies of the CD for distribution and sale, as well as to increase visibility for this and future Simple Calming Music projects. While part of these funds have already been raised, another $800 should cover the remaining cost of manufacturing and shipping from the warehouse to myself. Ultimately, this is pretty much a pre-sale for my album (with most perks containing a CD and/or a digital copy of the album), with smaller perks for those who also wish to contribute but who can only afford to invest less at this time. Should more be raised, I can either increase the number of copies produced from 500 to 1000, or focus on promoting the first CD through targeted online advertising (such as the ones you see on Facebook and Amazon).

Some may be wondering why I don't simply focus on releasing this first project digitally (ie. MP3's and/or other digital audio formats). There are multiple reasons for this:

  • While CD sales of popular music have slowly been replaced by digital sales through iTunes and other digital distributors, there is still a viable market for CDs in genres such as New Age and meditational music. This is especially true within the baby boomer generation, which is less familiar with digital music distribution and still appreciates having actual, tangible copies of their music collection.
  • While the online setup and distribution costs of digital audio files are absolutely minor when compared to CD duplication and shipping, it is my experience that promoting a digital-only release is often more difficult than a physical CD release as there is no copy to hold or see. While I still will be selling digital copies online through retailers such as Amazon, iTunes, CDBaby and others, I will be tying it into a physical CD release as well.
  • And to put it quite honestly, this is a project I honestly believe can recoup its investment and gain sufficient revenue to fund future Simple Calming Music releases. I am thus am putting it forth as my first personal, solo CD release. Funding this CD may very well mean that, with one pledge, you will be funding several of my future albums as well!
  • Having my name on my own CD is a dream I share with many a musician, both professional and hobbyist. While I have participated in several recordings made by other people for a little over two decades, and have also seen my music showcased on compilations, this would be the first project pressed to CD that I could call my very own... and that makes a very big difference to me.
Through CDBaby's Super K Distribution and other affiliates and partnerships, this CD would then be distributed to vendors and clients, virtually worldwide.

(For more information on the album creation process itself, and on Simple Calming Music, check out my pitch video accompanying this campaign.)

What We Need & What You Get

Here's basically what the project entails:

  • I have a history of over ten years' experience in album artwork design and layout, as well as over fifteen years' experience in studio recording and over twenty years' experience in public musical performance. The album's recording stage is complete, and the album has been mastered by a professional sound engineer with whom I have a long-standing relationship. (And for the duration of this Indiegogo campaign, you can hear the entire album online at: https://soundcloud.com/glenbourgeois/full-preview-inner-contacts-instrumental-meditations-on-dolphin-whale-dragonfly-seagull/s-nAxh5 )
  • The digital distribution has already been secured and paid for through CDBaby, a most reputable company which regularly submits a wealth of material simultaneously to digital retailers such as iTunes and Amazon, as well as online streaming services such as Deezer, Sony Music Unlimited and Spotify.
  • What remains is to do the album artwork design and layout (again, for which I have fifteen years' experience working on other people's professional projects, at negligible cost to myself), and the manufacturing and shipment of 500 CD copies (which has been quoted for a total of approximately $1200). As I have already saved up almost $400 of my own for the project, what remains is $800 which will go directly to the manufacturing of my first solo CD project, the album, "Inner Contacts: Instrumental Meditations on Dolphin, Whale, Dragonfly and Seagull".
  • The perks include digital copies of the entire album (in either MP3 or high-resolution 24-bit/44.1-kHz WAV/FLAC formats; more formats may become available, subject to demand), physical CD copies of the album (as well as CD/digital file combinations, all with standard, single CD postage via Canadapost included in the perk), bonus instrumental digital tracks from my previous, similarly-themed work for Kimspirational's album "YES! YES! YES!" (note: these are only the instrumental versions; Kimspirational remains the owner of the versions including her voice and guided meditations), extra digital tracks from the instrumental digital albums previously released by myself (such as "Home: A Reflection" and "Eau de Pâques/Easter Water", even more extra digital tracks from the forthcoming instrumental album "Sun and Storms"... and all funders will be listed (unless otherwise requested) in the Thank You section within the album credits.
  • Ideally, I have kept the funding goal as small as possible to ensure success while meeting all the immediately required costs for this CD to see the light of day (and further pressings can be funded through the sale of the first 500 copies). For example, this goal can easily be met if 40 people contribute $20 apiece (for which they would receive a physical copy of the CD, as well as a digital MP3 copy of the album as soon as the Indiegogo campaign is complete),
  • If the $800 Indiegogo goal is not reached, all monies raised will be invested into the manufacture of the CD once I have secured funding (either through my own funds or through private investors/loans) to cover the entire manufacturing costs. The album will still be launched digitally at the end of the Indiegogo campaign, and any digital download perks will still be available on time. Any funds received through further digital sales of the album would go towards covering manufacturing costs of the CD, until $800 is amassed.
  • Should the Indiegogo campaign surpass the $800 goal, any extra monies will be invested in online targeted advertising through partners such as Amazon and Facebook, as well as in physically distributing copies of the CD to retailers for consignment/sale. Should the goal be surpassed by a sizeable amount (ie. above $1300 total), I may elect to manufacture an extra 500 copies for my first pressing in addition to the original 500, making for 1000 copies.


The Impact

This being my initial Simple Calming Music release, it is important that I make the strongest possible impact.

  • The success of this project will permit me to record and release further albums in the Simple Calming Music vein. If you like music like this (and I presume you do if you're reading this), then you can look forward to getting more of it from me!
  • While CD copies will be made available for future Simple Calming Music projects as long as there is a feasible market, the increased visibility of future releases (thanks to the availability of this first one in both digital audio file and CD formats) will make it easier for future projects to recoup investment and see heightened sales. This may possibly lead to increased digital sales, which would thus lessen the requirement for physical CD copies, or at the least, allow for future albums with reduced packaging (such as digipaks, "CD wallets" and single sleeves)... either way, reducing the impact on the environment!
  • I have over ten years' experience in album artwork design and layout for professionally recorded and manufactured CD's, with all my clients expressing only satisfaction for my work (and some being repeat clients).
  • The album is already completely recorded and mastered (and can be heard at https://soundcloud.com/glenbourgeois/full-preview-inner-contacts-instrumental-meditations-on-dolphin-whale-dragonfly-seagull ). In short, it already exists in full: it just needs to be packaged, manufactured, and released. And with your help, I can accomplish this goal without breaking the bank or eating packaged pasta or ramen noodles for months (and I'm not criticizing anyone who enjoys regularly eating packaged pasta or ramen noodles... just saying).


Risks & Challenges

While there are very limited risks involved in the manufacture of a CD of original music, there are far more obstacles in promoting this project once completed.

  • It is commonly known that the music industry playing field has levelled in recent years, with the arrival of the Internet, digital sales, and the affordability of decent home recording equipment and software, not to mention partners such as CDBaby and DiscMakers. While it is easier to produce one's own album and have it professionally manufactured, this has also made it more difficult for any one artist or album to stand out amongst the myriad of albums being released each year.
  • I have already identified several vendors who specialize in New Age and meditational products, and have solicited interest in carrying my album in their stores. (I am also open to other stores as well, should any potential funders here know of any.)
  • I have also begun to negotiate promotional agreements with online specialists and services which cater to markets identified as being interested in New Age and meditation. (This means you may hear my music appear in unexpected places: fear not, as I am happily making arrangements such as these... though you are always welcome to let me know where you heard my music!)
  • A New Age/meditational music has a much longer "shelf life" than the average commercial recording. Much as a Christmas album or a "Greatest Hits/Best Of" album, a New Age/meditational album stands a strong chance of continued sales way past its original release date, as people interested in these specific types of albums rarely base their purchases on chart positions or the original release date of an album of this genre. This means the manufactured CD copies retain their value over consecutive years and still remain in relatively similar demand, as long as the album is promoted and made available for purchase. You can rest assured that these CDs will be free from any threat of mass destruction past a specific future date... these copies are good until sold or procured.
  • Links to digital copies are only as secure as the practices of those who have access to those digital copies. I will be exploring the best possible model of making digital copies available for easy download (MP3 and WAV/FLAC, with other possibilities according to demand) at least cost and frustration. However, while certain platforms/vendors such as iTunes digitally encrypt information into the MP3s identifying who purchased them, I may have to make my files available in a way that virtually anyone who gets their hands on the download link can access the whole album, or that anyone can then make copies or otherwise share. (While some view this as "promoting" an artist, and I will admit to having downloaded albums and then buying CD copies soon afterwards, this method of "promotion" doesn't usually result in a huge amount of sales, to my knowledge.) This is where I may just have to trust everyone who gets a download link, for the sake of making things easy for everyone downloading a digital copy of the album.


Other Ways You Can Help

As Indiegogo has reminded me, some people just can't contribute, but they can still help otherwise! Should you be one of these people, feel free to:

  • Get the word out to those you feel would be interested in this project... give the link on your blog, on your Facebook wall, in online mailing list groups, to your yoga class... the sky's the limit!
  • Remember the Indiegogo share tools! These make it easy to share the word (and a link) for my Indiegogo campaign. Every bit helps!

Thank you for your time and support!
story_txt:
Thank you for the campaign momentum... Hear the album here! https://soundcloud.com/glenbourgeois/full-preview-inner-contacts-instrumental-meditations-on-dolphin-whale-dragonfly-seagull/s-nAxh5

 pressed to CD that I could call my very own... and that makes a very 
big difference to me.  
Through CDBaby's Super K Distribution and other affiliates and partnerships, this CD would then be distributed to vendors and clients, virtually worldwide.(For more information on the album creation process itself, and on Simple Calming Music, check out my pitch video accompanying this campaign.)   What We Need & What You Get Here's basically what the project entails:  I have a history of over ten years' experience in album artwork design and layout, as well as over fifteen years' experience in studio recording and over twenty years' experience in public musical performance. The album's recording stage is complete, and the album has been mastered by a professional sound engineer with whom I have a long-standing relationship. (And for the duration of this Indiegogo campaign, you can hear the entire album online at: https://soundcloud.com/glenbourgeois/full-preview-inner-contacts-instrumental-meditations-on-dolphin-whale-dragonfly-seagull/s-nAxh5 )

The digital distribution has already been secured and paid for through CDBaby, a most reputable company which regularly submits a wealth of material simultaneously to digital retailers such as iTunes and Amazon, as well as online streaming services such as Deezer, Sony Music Unlimited and Spotify.
What remains is to do the album artwork design and layout (again, for which I have fifteen years' experience working on other people's professional projects, at negligible cost to myself), and the manufacturing and shipment of 500 CD copies (which has been quoted for a total of approximately $1200). As I have already saved up almost $400 of my own for the project, what remains is $800 which will go directly to the manufacturing of my first solo CD project, the album, "Inner Contacts: Instrumental Meditations on Dolphin, Whale, Dragonfly and Seagull".
 The perks include digital copies of the entire album (in either MP3 or high-resolution 24-bit/44.1-kHz WAV/FLAC formats; more formats may become available, subject to demand), physical CD copies of the album (as well as CD/digital file combinations, all with standard, single CD postage via Canadapost included in the perk), bonus instrumental digital tracks from my previous, similarly-themed work for Kimspirational's album "YES! YES! YES!" (note: these are only the instrumental versions; Kimspirational remains the owner of the versions including her voice and guided meditations), extra digital tracks from the instrumental digital albums previously released by myself (such as "Home: A Reflection" and "Eau de Pâques/Easter Water", even more extra digital tracks from the forthcoming instrumental album "Sun and Storms"... and all funders will be listed (unless otherwise requested) in the Thank You section within the album credits.
 Ideally, I have kept the funding goal as small as possible to ensure success while meeting all the immediately required costs for this CD to see the light of day (and further pressings can be funded through the sale of the first 500 copies). For example, this goal can easily be met if 40 people contribute $20 apiece (for which they would receive a physical copy of the CD, as well as a digital MP3 copy of the album as soon as the Indiegogo campaign is complete),
If the $800 Indiegogo goal is not reached, all monies raised will be invested into the manufacture of the CD once I have secured funding (either through my own funds or through private investors/loans) to cover the entire manufacturing costs. The album will still be launched digitally at the end of the Indiegogo campaign, and any digital download perks will still be available on time. Any funds received through further digital sales of the album would go towards covering manufacturing costs of the CD, until $800 is amassed.

Should the Indiegogo campaign surpass the $800 goal, any extra monies will be invested in online targeted advertising through partners such as Amazon and Facebook, as well as in physically distributing copies of the CD to retailers for consignment/sale. Should the goal be surpassed by a sizeable amount (ie. above $1300 total), I may elect to manufacture an extra 500 copies for my first pressing in addition to the original 500, making for 1000 copies.    
The Impact This being my initial Simple Calming Music release, it is important that I make the strongest possible impact.  The success of this project will permit me to record and release further albums in the Simple Calming Music vein. If you like music like this (and I presume you do if you're reading this), then you can look forward to getting more of it from me!
While CD copies will be made available for future Simple Calming Music projects as long as there is a feasible market, the increased visibility of future releases (thanks to the availability of this first one in both digital audio file and CD formats) will make it easier for future projects to recoup investment and see heightened sales. This may possibly lead to increased digital sales, which would thus lessen the requirement for physical CD copies, or at the least, allow for future albums with reduced packaging (such as digipaks, "CD wallets" and single sleeves)... either way, reducing the impact on the environment! 
 I have over ten years' experience in album artwork design and layout for professionally recorded and manufactured CD's, with all my clients expressing only satisfaction for my work (and some being repeat clients). 

The album is already completely recorded and mastered (and can be heard at https://soundcloud.com/glenbourgeois/full-preview-inner-contacts-instrumental-meditations-on-dolphin-whale-dragonfly-seagull ). In short, it already exists in full: it just needs to be packaged, manufactured, and released. And with your help, I can accomplish this goal without breaking the bank or eating packaged pasta or ramen noodles for months (and I'm not criticizing anyone who enjoys regularly eating packaged pasta or ramen noodles... just saying).
    
Risks & Challenges While there are very limited risks involved in the manufacture of a CD of original music, there are far more obstacles in promoting this project once completed.  It is commonly known that the music industry playing field has levelled in recent years, with the arrival of the Internet, digital sales, and the affordability of decent home recording equipment and software, not to mention partners such as CDBaby and DiscMakers. While it is easier to produce one's own album and have it professionally manufactured, this has also made it more difficult for any one artist or album to stand out amongst the myriad of albums being released each year.
 I have already identified several vendors who specialize in New Age and meditational products, and have solicited interest in carrying my album in their stores. (I am also open to other stores as well, should any potential funders here know of any.)
I have also begun to negotiate promotional agreements with online specialists and services which cater to markets identified as being interested in New Age and meditation. (This means you may hear my music appear in unexpected places: fear not, as I am happily making arrangements such as these... though you are always welcome to let me know where you heard my music!)
A New Age/meditational music has a much longer "shelf life" than the average commercial recording. Much as a Christmas album or a "Greatest Hits/Best Of" album, a New Age/meditational album stands a strong chance of continued sales way past its original release date, as people interested in these specific types of albums rarely base their purchases on chart positions or the original release date of an album of this genre. This means the manufactured CD copies retain their value over consecutive years and still remain in relatively similar demand, as long as the album is promoted and made available for purchase. You can rest assured that these CDs will be free from any threat of mass destruction past a specific future date... these copies are good until sold or procured. 

Links to digital copies are only as secure as the practices of those who have access to those digital copies. I will be exploring the best possible model of making digital copies available for easy download (MP3 and WAV/FLAC, with other possibilities according to demand) at least cost and frustration. However, while certain platforms/vendors such as iTunes digitally encrypt information into the MP3s identifying who purchased them, I may have to make my files available in a way that virtually anyone who gets their hands on the download link can access the whole album, or that anyone can then make copies or otherwise share. (While some view this as "promoting" an artist, and I will admit to having downloaded albums and then buying CD copies soon afterwards, this method of "promotion" doesn't usually result in a huge amount of sales, to my knowledge.) This is where I may just have to trust everyone who gets a download link, for the sake of making things easy for everyone downloading a digital copy of the album.
    
Other Ways You Can Help As Indiegogo has reminded me, some people just can't contribute, but they can still help otherwise! Should you be one of these people, feel free to:  Get the word out to those you feel would be interested in this project... give the link on your blog, on your Facebook wall, in online mailing list groups, to your yoga class... the sky's the limit!
 Remember the Indiegogo share tools! These make it easy to share the word (and a link) for my Indiegogo campaign. Every bit helps!
   Thank you for your time and support!

story: Help fund a truly southern gothic record that tells the story of growing up in the deep south. From living in an '86 Oldsmobile and finding happiness to walking away from a life with everything that was a prison. The last words she'd want to leave on this earth and the unconditional love of a father.

story:
Hey guys, Painting Fences here.

We hate to ask, but we need your help. We've been working on our album for some time now, and while we have it completed, we won't own the rights for it until we finish paying off the 2,000 dollars we owe on it.

We've been spending every extra dime we have to pay for it, and so far we're close; really close. Like, halfway there, close. But at the pace we have been going its going to take another 4-5 months for us to get everything in order, and we want to get this product in your hands by February.

There's more than just the songs and album itself, of course. Once we pay the studio, we still have to commission artwork, print CD's, package, and distribution.

We also have music videos and tours we are hoping to plan and save up for, but that can't happen until we get priority one squared away.

Anything you can donate helps us immensely, and helps get you this album faster. Any donations of $10 or more will make you eligible for pre-order, we'll ship the album to you as soon as its packaged and ready. We have other fun rewards for higher donations as well.

This will be 10 song album. Some of the songs have strong blues elements, others recall early heavy metal and rock roots. All songs are Painting Fences' sound and style through and through. The titles for these 10 songs are:

  1. Here I Stand
  2. Southwestern Feel
  3. Disillusion
  4. Pressure
  5. Windowshopper
  6. My Disdain
  7. The Shutdown
  8. Old Man Blues and Cyber Punk Kid
  9. Burden
  10. Hope Is A Feather

$10-preorder digital copy of album

$15-preorder signed physical copy of album.

$20-album plus special, signed print of our Windowshopper artwork with signatures on the back.

$50-- Special framed artwork (Windowshopper) plus album, both signed.

$100-- if you donate a whopping hundred dollars, you'll get the $50 reward PLUS all bonus album artwork ( including limited edition prints )

$200-- Not only would you have our sincere gratitude, but also we would arrange to have either a.) you can join us on stage and perform a song with us or b.) we'll arrange a private concert for you!

$500-- For every $500 donated by a single donor, we will play and record a Rush cover song, and put it out for FREE, plus a special edition of the album with your Rush cover song on it.

story:
Short Summary

Introducing millagram
Born and raised in Nova Scotia, Canada, millagram is cut from Traditional Folk fabric and sewn with Jazz. Her years spent in a bustling metropolis as an adult, exposed her to many genres that she fell in love with including Reggae, R&B, Hip Hop and Electronic music. While her heart was always in the underground, she couldn't help but love the Greats; artists who brought something new and profound to otherwise generic mainstream music. There are many artists who have left a real impression on her soul and millagram hopes that her music will do the same for you. She writes about her own life experiences and reflections of her mind, setting vulnerability aside to share her heart with the world. 
Introducing Nø Fåuxs
Dason Johnson is a Mastermind--No a polymath. I've never met another like him. His drive is multilayerd and complex but exacting and efficatious in the utmost. His skills are continously improving and his creativity is beyond description. In short Dason Johnson is a living zeitgest, a barely contained time-bomb of whirling energy and fantastical talent. 
The Campaign
Great minds sync alike. That's what happened when Nø Fåuxs and Millagram finally sat down and shared music. After two months of sharing and writing, this EP was conceived. They can't wait to share it with the world so we need your help to cover some of the production costs to be able to birth this project. Both artists have a passion for music production and performance and work straight jobs to survive in the city. This is an independent release and we would like you, the fans to have your stake in their future careers. So let's get the ball rolling!

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $2000 for this project. Most of the work has already been done: the beats are made, the songs are ready to be recorded. When you donate you will be contributing directly to the cost of studio rental for the vocal tracks and the mixing and mastering of the entire EP. Pretty simple stuff, but stuff that takes cash. 

When you give, you receive. For a minimum donation of $10 you will receive a free download of the new co-lab EP by Millagram and Nø Fåuxs. You may even get it before it's officially released! cuz we love you that much! As your contributions increase, so does the perks. We got some cool things for you including more albums from Millagram and Nø Fåuxs, some cool handmade merch and some autographed original prints of Millagram and Nø Fåuxs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate but want to support the project anyway, you can simply spread the word! share this project with your friends and family on social media. Subscribe to the millagram and Nø Fåuxs pages to stay in the loop about their future releases and shows. Send us a note for support. Every little thing helps :)

www.millagram.com

www.nofauxs.com

story:
My name is mr mojo

Well, my real name is Morien Jones but many children know me as musician mr mojo. Ive been making music for children for many years and in 2013 I released a CD of all original kids tunes simply titled 'mr mojo'. It has been a huge success and has been well received by both kids and their parents in different countries around the world.

   Now, the time has come to share more music! In my home studio I have almost finished recording another CD for the young and young at heart titled 'Mr Mojo Strikes Again!'.

   To say that I'm excited about these new songs is an understatement. I can't wait to share them with children around the world!

   I am looking to raise at least $2500. Approximately half will cover the costs of mixing and mastering the songs by my good friend and musical wizard John Tucker in Nelson, BC. The other half will be used to manufacture the CD's themselves through DMA discs in Vancouver. 

   Any funding beyond that will be used to rent equipment (electric guitar) and to help pay for the graphic design work with my talented son, Seneca.

   Perks include digital downloads, CD's, wrapped and shipped CDs in time for the holidays, my original bowtie from the 'mr mojo' album cover, live performances as well as writing and recording a song for you, someone you know or your business.

   Your contributions mean so much. Please SHARE this campaign with everyone you think may be interested in supporting it. 

   Thank you for helping me achieve my goals and for helping share this singable, danceable, musical fun with kids all over the world! Visit mrmojo.net

With heart,

mr mojo

Here is a live performance of one of the songs from the new album taken from a performance in beautiful Kaslo, BC during a tour in 2014.


CLICK HERE TO HEAR SONGS FROM MY FIRST CD!

story:
Summary...

My name is Roshani, I am a singer/songwriter currently living in my car while I pursue my dream of bringing my original songs to the world.

What We Need...

I am raising the funds needed to pay for the studio, mixing and mastering, artwork and printing plus paying my the musicians. Any extra funds raised will go towards creating film clips and advancing the cause.

The Impact...

There is something primal about music, something that can stir your soul. My goal is to get my music out to as many people as possible in its purest form and change lives. I want to prove that independent music is good enough to sit amongst the big label driven artists on the charts. I want to bring something fresh to the charts, something authentic, a sound with spirit. 

Why Crowdfunding?...

Being an independant musician has certain challenges. Without the backing of a major label, the artist has to become more resourceful and the crowdfunding platform is a big part of that. Connecting artist directly with fans and providing amazing rewards for everyone along the way. 

Other Ways You Can Help...

It would be a massive help if you could share my campaign with your friends, or grab yourself one or more of the awesome rewards on offer. Together we can do it!!

Thank you from the bottom of my heart, 

Roshani xxx

story:
About PROJECT G

"GREEN SCREEN KID" was originally a name given to singer/guitarist Beau Zachowski by internet critics as an insult. In 2013, the three of us started a band and named it "Green Screen Kid". We vowed to give the name new life, and create music to inspire others. After two years of being together, we built a loyal following and feel the time is right to inspire others by branching out to a national level.

To take this next step, our plan is to professionally record a 6 song EP and make it spread like wildfire. All of the songs are already 100% written; they just need to be recorded. We've been playing shows all summer to raise funds for this project, but unfortunately it just hasn't been enough. That's why we have decided to ask our supporters for help.

What We Need & What You Get

Collectively, we will need to raise $5000.

Here is where the funds will be going :

  • $2000 - Studio Time and Production (Cherry Pit Studios/JTW Recording)
  • $3000 - Post-Production and Promotion
EVERYONE who contributes will be rewarded. Whether you decide to donate $1 or $500 dollars, you will get something special from the band. For details, check out our donation perks in the sidebar.

Why Donate?

Our number one priority is to make it as a band. This is more than just a hobby or side-project to us; it's something we all genuinely want to make a career out of for the rest of our lives. We believe in what we're doing, and we believe in the songs we create. 

Rock music is nowhere near as dominant in the mainstream music industry as it used to be; however, the fans we constantly interact on social media with give us hope for the future. We're in it for them. There are thousands of kids out there (that love listening to bands) who don't even know we are yet, and we're in it for them too. 

By contributing to PROJECT G, you are not only giving us the chance to release music that our fanbase can be excited about; you are helping us get one step closer to our lifelong dream. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to help us out even more, you can:

  • Share the link to this page on Facebook, Twitter, etc.
  • Tell your friends about our story and ask them to help contribute.

Together, we can make this happen!

story:
My Goals

Hello my name is Justin Murphy aka JJ JetPlane, my goal is to raise money to push my CD on a professional level. I have been studying the arts of frequency analysis, video production, photography, graphics, sound engineering and marketing for 5 years now and have been surviving on them since. I record mix and master all my music, do all my cover art, edit my videos and also do this for many other Detroit up and coming artists. Having the means to professionally push my CD will secure that my work will be recognized on higher platforms all over the world 

Remember even if you can not contribute you can always share this campaign with your friends, Indie gogo makes this easy with its share tools.

Check out some of my work at these links

https://soundcloud.com/j-j-jet-plane

https://www.facebook.com/jetplanemedia

https://www.facebook.com/jetplanemusic

story:
Short Summary

The above video is short, sweet, and says it all.  Please take 90 seconds to laugh, cry, and get sick from eating your popcorn too fast.  This record will be full of kick ass new songs, with all kinds of amazing musicians performing on it.  I've never been more excited in my life about making a record!  THIS is the one I have always wanted to make.  We will be FILMING the entire time so you will get a close-up inside look at the making of this killer comeback album.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need 4k for recording, mixing, mastering, filming and paying musicians.  There will also be travel costs associated, and we all like food.  
  • Im SUPER excited about the perks this time around.  The goal here is to actually have you BE a part of the making of this Album/Film.  During and after it comes out!  
  • IF WE GO OVER OUR GOAL, I would really like to work a 3-6 month campaign with a local PR firm.  This would make all the difference in the world to us!  (and it is NOT cheap).  Also, additional funds go to pressing CDs, t-shirts, tour posters, and paying the Cameraman!!! :)

The Impact

Here's the honest truth:  I've been doing this for 20 years and it's always been a struggle.  It's made me who I am, and I am grateful for that.  But, I'm ready for a change.  Something better for me and my loved ones around me.  I want to share the inside of my head with you.  Trust me.  It's really good.  I deeply appreciate all your unyielding support over the years, and i feel like its time to give back.  This is our time.  Let's do this.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please send this to 3 friends.  Any 3 friends you think may want to help out or get involved from the genesis.
  • Please share this on Facebook, Twitter, etc. with people you know who may be interested in being a part of the comeback.

Thank you 1,000,000 times, I love you all.  xoxo-Matthew Pop
story_txt:
Short Summary The above video is short, sweet, and says it all.  Please take 90 seconds to laugh, cry, and get sick from eating your popcorn too fast.  This record will be full of kick ass new songs, with all kinds of amazing musicians performing on it.  I've never been more excited in my life about making a record!  THIS is the one I have always wanted to make.  We will be FILMING the entire time so you will get a close-up inside look at the making of this killer comeback album. story:
This is a once in a lifetime opportunity. . .

My name is Harpdog Brown.  I've been playing blues for more than 35 years touring as far and wide as I possibly can.  I've played Alaska more than once, much of the Pacific Northwest, all across Canada and even Germany.

In my entire career, I have never had an opportunity so great as this. After a cross-Canada tour with Little Victor Mac (The Beale Street Blues Bopper, The King of Grit) he offered to produce my next album.  This is a once in a lifetime chance to do something deeper than all of my previous releases.  Up until now, every recording I released was always done on the "skinny" and in a hurry.  I've never had a producer, let alone someone as qualified as Victor.  This guy knows how to get that original roots sound, even in a digital world.  

To make the opportunity even greater, this album will be cut at Bigtone Records, a studio in San Jose notorious for recording with post world-war-two equipment, capturing the sound of yesterday, but in a modern world.  It’s run by one of the hottest rising blues artists in the US, Big Jon Atkinson.  Victor has also planned a day at Greaseland Records - the dreamchild of Christopher "Kid" Andersen (Charlie Musselwhite, Rick Estrin).  Rumour has it that Kid Andersen will make a guest appearance and we've already confirmed Blues stalwart Rusty Zin.  These guys are some of the heaviest hitters in the blues business these days.  Both studios are putting out some the best blues recordings of our time, with vintage gear and the knowledge of truly recording "the way they used to".  

I'm also in conversation with my friend Charlie Musselwhite.  If the budget allows I plan to have him on two tracks.  One as a duo with him on low-down guitar; and the other joining me with the band on a harp instrumental I have in the works called Moose On The Loose. (He doesn't know that yet).

I want to launch the album this spring.  Harpdog Brown & the Travelin' Blues Show  will then take it on the road to tour North America far and wide with global plans for the future.

This will be a turning point in my career and I would like you all to be part of it. I believe my time is now.  With all I've learned over the years - growing as a person, life experience, the ups the downs, the ins the outs - the one thing I do have is a message I believe in.  And I know you do too.  

My last album What It Is - self produced and recorded on the fly - did very well in 2014 and I know I can do better.  We'll be recording with the same equipment they used back in the day in studios like Chess and Sun.  Jon's Bigtone Records has just aquired a 1954 Ampex 350 that is likely to be the only one remaining in operation. But most of all, having the right ears on the board is essential, and that we have with Little Victor.

I thank you from the bottom of my heart for all your support!


What We Need & What You Get!

The music business has changed a lot over the years.  With the power of the internet we are now more connected to our fans than ever.  No longer are record companies controlling our artistic visions based on marketing stats of what they think will sell and what won't.  Platforms like IndieGogo allow us to involve you in our future.  There are many ways to contribute and we'll be posting throughout the process. 

Here are some of the Perks we've arranged just for you:

  • limited edition autographed photo book 
  • contributor-only t-shirt
  • digital download of the new album
  • autographed CD
  • Instagram account takeover for a day on the road
  • your own private house concert featuring Harpdog Brown & the Travelin' Blues Show
  • Harmonica lesson via Skype - any level
  • Harmonica lessons via Skype - package of 12
  • And much more to come!

Whether you can help us financially or not, we do need your support to share this with blues fans everywhere!  

The more people that know, the more successful the campaign will be.  Please share, and share often!  We appreciate it.

Thank you for your continued support! 



Connect and share with Harpdog Brown:

www.HarpdogBrown.com

facebook.com/Harpdog-Brown

youtube.com/user/Harpdog

twitter.com/HarpdogBrown

www.instagram.com/harpdogbrown

www.bandsintown.com/HarpdogBrown

plus.google.com/HardogBrown

story:
Short Summary

The United Tribulation Choir is not your ordinary R&B Gospel group. Fostering a message of hope and inspiration, UTChoir is dedicated in their quest to unite and empower communities with their R&B-influenced take on Gospel music.

The Montreal-based choir was founded in 2007 by two exceptional men: Brothers Gift and Paul Tshuma. Together, they carry with them years of experience as artists, in addition to their academic backgrounds in jazz music and theory.

Drawing together talented individuals from different walks of life, the UTChoir performs both original and cover songs. They are strong supporters of diversity and extend their reach by singing in multiple languages and performing in a broad array of styles.

The UTChoir was ultimately founded with one goal in mind: to bring about change in local communities and around the world. This goal can only be achieved with your help, by funding our project, it will enable us to cover mixing/mastering costs, graphic designing, as well as CD distribution/duplication costs, which will allow the album to be shared with the world!!

What We Need & What You Get

We have completed tracking the album without incurring any studio costs, thanks to Concordia University for allowing us to use their studio equipment FOR FREE!!  The majority of funds raised will go towards various aspects of the production: mixing and mastering the music, which allows the tracks to sound concise and balanced. The other portion will go towards the printing of hard copies of the album and distributing the music through Itunes, Spotify, Amazon Mp3, Google Play ect., promotion, and paying the musicians, singers, videographer and graphic designer. All of those who contribute to this campaign will receive great perks!!! If we do not achieve the goal, whatever is raised will go towards mixing/mastering costs first. If we happened to go over our goal, we would be able to use the extra money to pay volunteers who contributed to the production.

The Impact

By donating to this campaign, it will allow us to share our music with the world!! Our songs are sung in multiple languages, carrying a message of hope, love and faith, in which we believe the world is in need of.

Risks & Challenges

Life always throws curve balls, creating an album is never an easy feat, there are always setbacks whether it be finances, musicians or singers falling sick, not being able to book a wheelchair accessible studio, ect. all these challenges are part of the journey, they encourage us to work harder to achieve our dream!

Other Ways You Can Help

Those who can't contribute financially to this project, can still make an impact by sharing this campaign with friends and family!! This can be done through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Email etc. Please use the Indiegogo sharing tools on this page to make it easier.

story:
Red Cable Sunday  - Make the debut album happen!


WHEN THIS CROWDFUND CLOSES  - FOR ALL THE LATEST INFORMATION INCLUDING HOW TO SUPPORT THE RED CABLE SUNDAY DEBUT ALBUM PLEASE VISIT:

WWW.REDCABLESUNDAY.COM

Listen to selected tracks of the album play list here

This has been an amazing journey for me! I released my debut single Prelude to the Nocturne which was featured on Radio 2 (Alan Titchmarsh)  and Radio 3 (The Late Junction) and thanks to funders raised thousands of pounds to make a video for new single Relentless.  I have been playing the piano since I was 6 years old and always wanted to record music.  Crowdfunding is giving me that chance.  You can see what I have done with my last crowdfund in the above video :)

Being a DIY artist means taking  a central role in everything which can be pretty exhausting! But the support of funders has meant I can expand the project and involve collaborators, and use a budget to make the video that I've had buzzing around my head for the single Relentless It means I've been able to hire equipment, engage a director, actors and film crew, editor etc.  Now I would like to do the same for the album which will feature Prelude to the Nocturne, Warflowers, Relentless and live favourite, Snowdrifts.

What We Need & What You Get

There are a range of perks to suit every funder, from instant MP3 downloads, signed cds of the new album, vinyl, comics and props from the relentless video to handwritten lyric sheets and lyric picture books, bespoke videos and personal gigs/piano lessons!

Without the backing of a recording company, unsigned artists need to raise money to pay for  recording studio costs.  The album needs to sound cinematic and impressive which is why I would like to have string players for some of the tracks. Score sheets, rehearsal time, recording costs, mixing and mastering all add up as costs. And finally, a good PR campaign will mean that all this hard work and support gets the  potential of being heard in places I cannot reach on my own.

As the album is already written, if I don't hit my £8000 goal, the album will still get made and all rewards will be honoured - but this journey is about expanding beyond being a DIY bedroom artist - and making an album that people will sit up and take notice of

You can help make that happen :) 

The Impact

Making a high quality album or video simply would not be possible without funders. You will have the satisfaction of knowing that this album could not have happened without you and get some cool perks along the way!  My debut single was recorded on a laptop but ended up being featured on national radio, tv and newspapers.  I cant wait to see where this album ends up!

What people said about Relentless  

"Denis Fernando's music is always worth listening to and on this tune his voice and piano is totally beguiling. The thought-provoking dystopian video too creates a tension with the music. I just hope this gets seen and heard by as wide a public as possible"

Max Reinhardt Presenter on Radio 3's The Late Junction
“Red Cable Sunday is where the underground meets everything else. Relentless is a poignant short film that is verging portraying on Britain's modern reality”
Caffy St Luce, TheZineUK

What people said about Prelude to the Nocturne 


              "Red Cable Sunday brings the ol' johanna back into fashion,                                    tickling the ivories (and ebonies!) to great effect while performing a                    self-scored, gershwin inspired yet politically motivated instrumental                    tune"

                Dexter Bentley - Resonance FM

             “Two really beautiful, moving piano pieces on this debut single from                     Red Cable Sunday. Stunning!”

                Piccadilly Records, Manchester

My new single Relentless has a highly creative video which was all down to its funders. Its always fantastic to interact with pledgers at shows or via my email newsletter which will keep you updated on progress :)

Risks & Challenges

The main challenges will be in co-ordinating a team of creatives in the recording process and in promotion.  I have shown with my past releases that I am more than up to this.  If I do not hit my target, the pool of collaborators will have to be reduced - the tracks on my soundcloud page give you an idea of what I can do at the moment without this level of funding so imagine what it could be like if I got funded!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Buy my tracks direct from itunes
  • Please share this page to your friends, on twitter, facebook and other social media  and use the indiegogo share tools
  • You can also download my releases from itunes and buy merch direct from  www.redcablesunday.com

story:
Millimetrik : Fog Dreams

Embarquez dans l'équipe de production de ce nouvel album grâce à un don!

Fog Dreams sera le 9e album officiel de Millimetrik.

Des images de phares, de brume, des entrevues avec un gardien de phares, des odeurs de bord de mer et une ambiance de solitude insulaire seront de la partie, à travers une rythmique plus organique influencé par les courants de trip-hop et hip-hop instrumental des années 90 et 2000.

Un album qui poussera plus loin le travail solitaire avec un arrangeur, de nouveaux collaborateurs et de nouvelles idées qui habilleront l'imagerie et le concept du disque physique.

Embark on the production's team for Millimetrik's new album with a donation!

Fog Dreams will be Millimetrik's 9th album.

Fog, lighthouses, Islands solitude will all float around, with 90's and 2000's trip-hop and instrumental hip-hop inspired rythms.

An album with a bigger team, new people involved and new ideas that will all changed the way Fog dreams will sound and will look.


Le budget demandé ira en totalité pour la production

Toute cette équipe sera rénumérée et la totalité des montants recus serviront à la production du disque au sens large. Pour ceux et celles qui ignorent les couts d'un disque vinyle, sachez que c'est 5 à 7 fois le prix d'un cd à produire, mais se vend en moyenne 1,5 fois plus cher seulement. Le disque sera fait malgré tout si on atteint pas l'objectif mais subira quelques coupures de budget et de délires.

The whole team will be paid and 100% of the donations will be used for the record production. Just to let you know, the production cost for a vinyl is 5 to 7 times more expensive compare to cd and sells only 1.5 more on the market.

The vinyl will be produced no matter how much donations we will received here but we will need to cut on some things.


L'impact des dons, un à un.

Chaque don compte, et contribuera à pousser plus loin que jamais cette parution de Millimetrik! Peu de projets de musiques électroniques au Québec osent pousser le concept aussi loin!

De plus, votre investissement est hyper rentable tout en m'aidant énormément vu les cadeaux offerts pour chaque don et ce même à 2$!!!

Each single donation is important and will help to produce the vinyl the way we want it to be! Your donation is in fact profitable with all the differents gifts packs you can get out of your money, starting at 2$!


Suivre les défis et les imprévus.

Vous aurez la chance de suivre la production de l'album à travers diverses capsules vidéos au cours des 33 jours. C'est un défi pour moi de produire un album dans une période de temps plus courte. Encouragez la création en direct!

D'autres façons d'aider

Le partage de cette campagne est une forme de don pour ceux ou celles qui ne pourraient pas se permettre d'investir.

Partagez, parlez en, soyez participants sur les réseaux!

Sharing this campaign is also a good way to help for people who can't contribute with money!

whole team will be paid and 100% of the donations will be used for
the record production. Just to let you know, the production cost for
a vinyl is 5 to 7 times more expensive compare to cd and sells only
1.5 more on the market.
The
vinyl will be produced no matter how much donations we will received
here but we will need to cut on some things.




L'impact des dons, un à un.


Chaque
don compte, et contribuera à pousser plus loin que jamais cette
parution de Millimetrik! Peu de projets de musiques électroniques au
Québec osent pousser le concept aussi loin!
De
plus, votre investissement est hyper rentable tout en m'aidant
énormément vu les cadeaux offerts pour chaque don et ce même à
2$!!!

Each
single donation is important and will help to produce the vinyl the
way we want it to be! Your donation is in fact profitable with all
the differents gifts packs you can get out of your money, starting at
2$!


Suivre les défis et les imprévus.
Vous aurez la chance de suivre la production de l'album à travers diverses capsules vidéos au cours des 33 jours. C'est un défi pour moi de produire un album dans une période de temps plus courte. Encouragez la création en direct!

D'autres façons d'aider
Le partage de cette campagne est une forme de don pour ceux ou celles qui ne pourraient pas se permettre d'investir.
Partagez, parlez en, soyez participants sur les réseaux!
Sharing this campaign is also a good way to help for people who can't contribute with money!

story:
Hi, my name is Elijah Gilmore; I am a professional jazz drummer from Cleveland Ohio. 

I grew up in the inner city of Cleveland Ohio (Go Cavs) :-)

Life was challenging as an African American boy living in the inner city but My Mother and Father were both educators who helped to keep my siblings and I on a straight path.

Music was an major outlet for Me to expess myself and stay out of trouble.. one could even say that music actually saved my life! Now I find myself using music to save others.. It's funny how the tables turn

I intend on continuing to use music as a tool to rebuild and unify Our world


Over the years I have toured and shared the stage and studio with many international jazz artist such as Joe Mcbride, Gearld Veasly, Dominick Ferinacci, The Yellow Jackets, Reggie Wooten, James Lloyd (Pieces of a Dream), Waymen Tisdale, Chuck Loeb, Bill Ransom, Najee, and Eddie Baccus Jr. to name a few  ..and NOW it's time for me to complete my project! :-) 

I look forward to keeping jazz music alive, because in the times that we live there are not as many jazz recording artist from my generation. To accomplish my mission I will need Your help. 

I know many of my friends and family have anticipated the release of my album, Well now I'm only 2,500 away from my goal! This money will cover my remaining studio time task such as recording, overdubs & editing, mixing, and mastering. I wish to relaese my album by May 5th. I would greatly appreciate Your love and support! 

Thank You, 

 Elijah

"Temple of Luxor" ~ A original from my 2016 Album

story:
ENGLISH VERSION:

Our History:  One summer evening while listening to some music after writing a review for my website Mundo Rock & Heavy, and also appreciate long after the work of metal bands here in Chile since my 15 years old (now I’m in my 37), I understood the great potential of the new Chilean wave of Heavy Metal bands. I got a vision in order to create some refreshing musical effort, guided under two points of view: 1) Show to the world these new bands, such as Battlerage, Caterina Nix, Iron Spell, Thunder Lord, Eternal Thirst, Resilience, Evil Fire, Vastator, SteelRage and many others, with all his big talent, and 2) Pay tribute to the their roots with all whose old names, maybe not so popular and big as the typical Iron Maiden, Judas Priest or Metallica, but still delivering a great dosis of true heavy metal sounds over the decades, and specially in the crazy 80s age. How you can not hallucinate when you hear the old times with bands such as Omen, Griffin, Tyrant, Warbride, Grim Reaper, Angel Witch, Running Wild, Heavy Load, etc etc etc.?? Well, I think this is the time, this is the age for the first Chilean Tribute to the 80s Heavy Metal.


The Project: The music will be recorded in many studios, according the needs and tastes of every band, then we’ll take every song to bring it into a unique mix and mastering process.By contributing to this campaign, you will support us 100% without any help from any label and allow us to spread the Chilean metal scene over the world. Since the first pressing CD only will have a limited edition with 1.000 units, we’ll be open to receive any offering for an eventual license o distribution agreement.

Musicians from all over the world know it: To record and release an album is not  easy, over all if you are from a so distant and not so known country as Chile. All this is an independent project trying to join some musicians and people around one common idea: to promote the Chilean heavy metal bands showing all their love for the classic sounds. The good heavy metal not just is coming from USA or Europe, so give the chance to spread some good  and news names in the heavy metal battlefield. 

Our goal: It's quite a lot of money for us (not even this goal of almost U$9.678 will be enough, but will help!! Hopefully we'll surpass it!!) and we can only get this done with the help of many of you, We know how difficult is try to coming out from the underground with a so ambitious project like this!! Now you can support this idea and get your double CD. How? Check it out:

We need to reach our goal with U$ 9.678.

 What is the detail of all this?

a)  Mix, mastering, post-production: U$ 2.205

b)  Cover artwork: U$ 365  

c)  Booklet design: U$ 440

d)  CD Pressing (1000 copies): U$ 3.028  

e)  Copyrights expenses: U$ 850

f)  Indiegogo, Paypal discounts and other fees: 10 % final amount

g)  T-Shirts Printing (100): U$ 900  

h)  Posters design and printing: U$ 290

i)  International guests: (Steve Grimmett from Grim Reaper & William R. McKay from Griffin) U$ 600 

j)  Incidental Expenses: U$ 1.000

If we don’t reach our total goal, anyway this project will continue ahead, but surely we’ll need more time to fulfill our objectives and re-orient our work to cover the expenses through other ways. All the donations will be spent in every item described above.

Which are our rewards?

1.  Every contributor equal or over U$ 10 will receive a digital download of our album on its release day + their name in the album credits!

2.  Contributors at the U$ 15 level will receive the double CD + Poster (*1). Shipping costs not included.

3.  Contributors at the U$ 30 level will receive the double CD + Poster + T-Shirt (limited edition to 100 units) (*2). Shipping costs not included.

4.  Any contribution of any amount, certainly is welcomed, and we’ll please with the heart. This CD is yours, and your support is vital. It could allow even a second part with new Chilean bands that have not appeared on this occasion. We need you ¡¡¡

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:  Yeah¡¡, We know that surely not all of you will have the means to contribute to our campaign, but would like to help us on this new adventure. We hugely encourage everyone to share this campaign to your friends and family or to someone you know who you think would be interested in what we do! There are some easy share tools available on this page to help spread the word about us and make some noise about this campaign; we would be truly grateful if you used them to help us on this long, epic and dark path

Thank you so much for your good vibes and support, everyone!

- Chilean Tribute To The 80s Heavy Metal crew (the bands Battlerage, Vastator, Evil Fire, Caterina Nix, Resilience, SteelRage, Witchblade, 4Estigma, Dewok, DeathSVn, Aberracion, Eternal Thirst, Mortal Whisper, Abstract Symphony, Thunder Lord, Ironspell, and Miguel Ramírez as Executive Producer)

TRACKLIST:

• IRON SPELL: "Fight for Rock" (originally by WARLOCK from his album "True as Steel" 1986)

• BATTLERAGE: "Heavy Metal Attack" (originally by GRIFFIN from his album "Flight of the Griffin" 1984)

• CATERINA NIX: "Slaves of the World" (originally by WARBRIDE from his album "Demo 1988")

• THUNDER LORD: "Diamonds of the Black Chest" (originally by RUNNING WILD from his album "Under Jolly Roger" 1987)

• EVIL FIRE: "Deseando Destruir y Matar" (originally by V8 from his album "Un Paso Más en la Batalla" 1985)

• RESILIENCE: "Forgotten Heroes" (originally by CLOVEN HOOF from his album "A Sultan's Ransom" 1989)

• ETERNAL THIRST: "Free for all" (originally by TYRANT from his album "Mean Machine" 1984

• VASTATOR: "Rock you to Hell" (originally by GRIM REAPER from his album "Rock you to Hell" 1987)

• ABSTRACT SYMPHONY: "Jet to Jet" (originally by ALCATRAZZ from his album "No Parole from Rock 'n' Roll" 1983)

• DEWOK: "Barón Rojo" (originally by BARÓN ROJO from his album "Larga vida al rock and roll" 1981)

• STEEL RAGE: "Johnny's Back" (originally by RIOT from his album "Thunder Steel" 1988)

• WITCHBLADE "You're a Liar" (originally by RAVEN from his album "Life's a Bitch" 1987)

• 4ESTIGMA: "Hall of the Mountain King" (originally by SAVATAGE from his album "Hall of the Mountain King" from 1987)

• MORTAL WHISPER: "See How it Flyes" (originally by GOTHAM CITY from his album "The Unknown" 1984)

• DEATHSVN: "Daybreak Ecstasy" (originally by HEAVY LOAD from his album "Death or Glory" 1982)

·  ABERRACION: “Heavy Metal Warrior” (originally by PAIN  from his album “Insanity” ,1986)


VERSIÓN EN ESPAÑOL:

La Historia: Una tarde de verano mientras escuchaba algo de música después de escribir un comentario para mi sitio Mundo Rock & Heavy, y también tras apreciar largamente el trabajo de las bandas de heavy metal acá en Chile desde que tenía 15 años (ahora tengo  37), comprendí el gran potencial de esta nueva oleada de las bandas de heavy metal chileno. Tuve una visión en cuanto a crear un esfuerzo importante guiado bajo dos puntos de vista: 1) Mostrar al mundo estas nuevas bandas, como Battlerage, Caterina Nix, Iron Spell, Thunder Lord, Eternal Thirst, Resilience, Evil Fire, Vastator, SteelRage y muchas otras, con todo su gran talento, y 2) Rendir homenaje a sus raíces, con todos aquellos venerados nombres, quizás no tan populares y grandes como los más conocidos Iron Maiden, Judas Priest o Metallica, pero aún capaces de entregar grandiosas dosis de verdadero heavy sonidos metaleros en las últimas décadas, y especialmente en los locos años 80s. ¿Cómo no alucinar cuando escuchas los viejos tiempos con bandas como Omen, Griffin, Tyrant, Warbride, Grim Reaper, Angel Witch, Running Wild, Heavy Load, etc, etc, etc?? Bien, creo que este es el tiempo y la era para el primer Tributo Chileno al Heavy Metal de los 80s.

El Proyecto: La música será grabada en varios estudios, acorde a las necesidades y preferencias de cada banda, luego tomaremos cada canción para llevarla a un proceso único de mezcla y masterizaje. Por contribuir a esta campaña, nos estarás apoyarando 100 % sin que tengamos ayuda de ningún sello, y nos permitirás divulgar la escena del Metal Chileno por el resto del mundo. Desde que la impresión de este CD tendrá una edición limitada solo a 1.000 unidades, estaremos abiertos a recibir cualquier oferta para una eventual licencia o contrato de distribución.

Músicos de todo el mundo lo saben: Grabar y lanzar un album no es fácil, más aún si estás en un lugar tan distante y poco conocido como Chile. Todo esto es un proyecto independiente que intenta unir a varios músicos y personas entorno a una idea común: promover las bandas chilenas de Heavy Metal y mostrar todo su amor por los sonidos clásicos. El buen heavy metal no solo puede venir desde Estados Unidos o Europa, así que danos esa oportunidad de difundir algunos buenos y nuevos nombres para los campos de batalla del heavy metal. Puedes desde ahora apoyar esta idea y obtener tu CD doble. ¿Cómo? Tienes que leer esto:

La Meta:

Es bastante dinero para nosotros (ni siquiera esta meta de casi 9.678 dólares puede que sea suficiente, pero ayudará!! Ojalá se supere!!) y sólo podremos llevar esto a cabo con la ayuda de muchos de ustedes. Sabemos lo difícil que es tratar de salir del underground con un proyecto tan ambicioso como este.

Necesitamos alcanzar una meta de U$ 9.678 ($ 6.654.336 CLP). 
¿Cuál es el detalle de todo esto?

a)  Mezcla, masterización, post-producción: U$ 2.205 ($ 1.517.040 CLP)

b)  Arte de portada: U$ 365 ($ 251.120 CLP)

c)  Diseño de librito interior: U$ 440 ($ 302.720 CLP)

d)  Imprenta de CD (1000 copias): U$ 3028 ($ 2.083.264 CLP)

e)  Costos de derechos de autor: U$ 872 ( $ 599.936 CLP)

f)  Descuentos Indiegogo, Paypal y otros cargos: 10 % del monto total recaudado

g)  Impresión de Poleras (100): U$ 872 ($ 599.936 CLP)

h)  Diseño e impresión de posters: U$ 290 ( $ 199.520 CLP )

i)  Invitados internacionales: U$ 600 ( $ 412.800 CLP)

j)  Gastos incidentales o imprevistos: U$ 1.000 ($ 688.000 CLP)

Si no alcanzamos el total de la meta, de todos modos este proyecto continuará adelante con lo que se recaude, aunque seguramente necesitaremos más tiempo para cumplir nuestros objetivos y re-orientar nuestro trabajo para cubrir los gastos a través de otras alternativas. Todas las donaciones serán gastadas en cada uno de los ítems descritos arriba.

¿Cuáles son nuestras recompensas?

1. Cada contribuyente con aportes iguales o superiores a 10 dólares, recibirá un link de descarga digital de nuestro álbum el día de su lanzamiento + su nombre en los créditos del álbum!

2. Cada contribuyente con aportes de 15 U$ recibirá el CD doble + Poster. Gastos de envío no están incluidos.

3. Cada contribuyente con aportes de 30 U$ recibirá el CD doble + Poster + Polera (edición limitada a 100 unidades). Gastos de envío no están incluidos.

4. Cualquier contribución de cualquier monto, por supuesto que serán bienvenidas, y lo agradeceremos de corazón. Este CD es de ustedes, y por lo mismo su apoyo es vital. Incluso nos podría permitir una segunda parte con nuevas bandas Chilenas que no aparecerán en esta ocasión. ¡¡ Te necesitamos ¡!!

OTRAS FORMAS DE AYUDAR: Síii ¡¡¡¡ Sabemos que de seguro no todos tendrán la posibilidad de contribuir con dinero a nuestra campaña, pero nos gustaría que nos apoyen en esta aventura. Agradeceríamos enormemente compartir esta campaña con tus amigos, familia o con cualquiera que sepas o creas que estará interesado en los que estamos haciendo!. Hay algunas herramientas sencillas disponibles en esta página para ayudar a promover esto y hacer algo de ruido sobre esta campaña; estaríamos muy agradecidos si las usas para esta larga, épica y sombría senda por la que decidimos caminar.

Muchas gracias a todos por sus buenas vibras y apoyo¡¡

-  Equipo del Tributo Chileno al Heavy Metal de los 80s ( las bandas Battlerage, Vastator, Evil Fire, Caterina Nix, Resilience, SteelRage, Witchblade, 4Estigma, Dewok, DeathSVn, Aberracion, Eternal Thirst, Mortal Whisper, Abstract Symphony, Thunder Lord, Ironspell y Miguel Ramírez como productor ejecutivo)
