de Poleras (100): U$ 872 ($ 599.936 CLP)
h) 
Diseño
e impresión de posters: U$ 290 ( $ 199.520 CLP )
i) 
Invitados
internacionales: U$ 600 ( $ 412.800 CLP)
j) 
Gastos
incidentales o imprevistos: U$ 1.000 ($ 688.000 CLP) 
Si
no alcanzamos el total de la meta, de todos modos este proyecto continuará
adelante con lo que se recaude, aunque seguramente necesitaremos más tiempo
para cumplir nuestros objetivos y re-orientar nuestro trabajo para cubrir los
gastos a través de otras alternativas. Todas las donaciones serán gastadas en
cada uno de los ítems descritos arriba.
¿Cuáles
son nuestras recompensas?
1.
Cada contribuyente con aportes iguales o superiores a 10 dólares, recibirá un
link de descarga digital de nuestro álbum el día de su lanzamiento + su nombre
en los créditos del álbum!
2.
Cada contribuyente con aportes de 15 U$ recibirá el CD doble + Poster.
Gastos de envío no están incluidos.
3.
Cada contribuyente con aportes de 30 U$ recibirá el CD doble + Poster + Polera
(edición limitada a 100 unidades). Gastos de envío no están incluidos.
4.
Cualquier contribución de cualquier monto, por supuesto que serán bienvenidas,
y lo agradeceremos de corazón. Este CD es de ustedes, y por lo mismo su apoyo
es vital. Incluso nos podría permitir una segunda parte con nuevas bandas
Chilenas que no aparecerán en esta ocasión. ¡¡ Te necesitamos ¡!!
OTRAS
FORMAS DE AYUDAR: Síii ¡¡¡¡ Sabemos que de seguro no todos tendrán la
posibilidad de contribuir con dinero a nuestra campaña, pero nos gustaría que
nos apoyen en esta aventura. Agradeceríamos enormemente compartir esta campaña
con tus amigos, familia o con cualquiera que sepas o creas que estará
interesado en los que estamos haciendo!. Hay algunas herramientas sencillas
disponibles en esta página para ayudar a promover esto y hacer algo de ruido
sobre esta campaña; estaríamos muy agradecidos si las usas para esta larga,
épica y sombría senda por la que decidimos caminar.
Muchas
gracias a todos por sus buenas vibras y apoyo¡¡
- 
Equipo
del Tributo Chileno al Heavy Metal de los 80s ( las bandas Battlerage,
Vastator, Evil Fire, Caterina Nix, Resilience, SteelRage, Witchblade, 4Estigma,
Dewok, DeathSVn, Aberracion, Eternal Thirst, Mortal Whisper, Abstract Symphony,
Thunder Lord, Ironspell y Miguel Ramírez como productor ejecutivo)

story:
DARLINGS, WE’RE MAKING A NEW ALBUM!

That’s right. It has been FIVE LONG YEARS since I (Felix) emerged from my parents’ attic clutching the weird little solo album that would start us off on this journey of theatre and rock. Two more EP’s, loads of ridiculous videos, hundreds of gigs around the country, a million box-steps, dozens of beautiful outfits and a metric tonne of makeup later, and we’re ready to get in the studio to make our magnum opus. Since the release of our first EP as a full band we’ve been bashing away at our sound, injecting the fearsome exuberance of the theatre into modern rock and pop. And this album will be our grand statement, our big push. And like all our output, it only works if you folks are involved.

WE’RE ASKING FOR FUNDING TO HELP US MAKE THIS RECORD. BUT WHY?

Ten grand. That sounds like an awful lot. Where the hell is it going?

I’m glad you asked. We are a completely independent artistic unit, with none of that sweet sweet label money to pay for things. However this means we can just go ahead and come straight to you beautiful people, and make something together! In actual fact this is only HALF of the budget required to actually get the record out there. Because once the record is made, we must engage things like a PR company, distributor and radio plugger, not to mention finance a load more of our marvelous videos, merchandise and physical CDs. But that’s all the boring stuff. We’ll take care of that ourselves. We’d like you to help with the fun bit! So this is what the money will be spent on:

PAY THE PRODUCER

You know the producer. It’s our boy Joe Davison. He has done the last two records and is the bestest damn producer in the world. But the last couple of short EPs were made in very time-limited circumstances (the last one was recorded in five days in an attic) for no money and with everyone staying up all night after work for months getting it finished. For this, our biggest thing ever, we need to dedicate proper time to the process to make such a BIG project happen. So Joe is going to move up here to Manchester and we’re gonna spend a month together building the record from the ground up. No distractions, no pressing needs to buy food or pay rent. Joy!

PAY THE MUSICIANS

We’re going big on this one, folks. We’re gonna enlist the help of all the wonderful musicians we have met over the years – horn sections, string sections, all the really cool expensive stuff that makes GREAT records. And we believe that musicians, who have dedicated their lives to mastering a skill and bring magic to whatever they touch deserve to get paid for their time.

HIRE A STUDIO

No more attics this time, darlings. We’re gonna take over a beautiful studio in Manchester and build this thing in a proper, purpose-built environment to make it sound as wonderful as possible.

AND THAT’S IT!

BUT WAIT!

The best part is we are offering all kinds of marvelous things in return for your invaluable support. And luckily we are able to draw on the considerable resources of our various talents and professions to give you some truly unique perks. Like cake? Of course you do! Well our Ellie is a master baker of tremendous towers of cakey magnificence. And she’ll do one of her custom masterpieces just for you. Ever wondered what your own theme tune would sound like? Wonder no more! I (Felix) shall consult with you at length, divine your superhero name, powers and requisite sidekicks, and produce your own song to play whenever you are getting ready for a big meeting, first date or preparing to save people from a burning building. Wanna come to the best gig of your life? Well you can! We’ll be holding two extra special launch parties in London and my (actual) family’s very own brand new ballroom in Manchester. These nights will be stuffed with the finest talent we can assemble from every performance discipline, and will be capped by a special performance from us. Want to have a gig in your house? BOOM. Pledge a bit of cash and I’ll come and play in your living room. We shall sing and dance the night away. Pledge a bit more and I’ll bring the whole damn Family along with me, and we shall shake the heavens with our mighty roar.

All this plus downloads, limited edition t-shirts, bundles and more. Check out the perks!

WHAT IF WE DON’T MAKE THE WHOLE AMOUNT?

Luckily this isn’t an “all or nothing” situation. We have various milestones as the pledges come in, so whatever happens this album is gonna get made. Even if we have to just yell it into a Dictaphone. But the more we get, the BIGGER we can go!

WHY THE HELL WOULD YOU GIVE YOUR HARD-EARNED CASH TO US?

An excellent question. Why aren’t we just funding it ourselves? And the short answer is: we are. Well, a lot of it. We’ve had a brilliant few years, done a LOT of shows and sold masses of our previous records to you beautiful people, so we’ve got enough to EITHER record the album OR promote it. However, the cost of an album is so gargantuan these days that we simply don’t have enough to both a) make a gigantic wonderful-sounding record, and b) make sure people actually hear it. We are artists, and we make just enough money to get by, but with our ever burgeoning collection of children and pets we simply can’t go on funding the whole thing ourselves for much longer.

Doing this for a living – entertaining people, making them forget the horrors of everyday life for the space of a song, a show, an album – is the best job in the whole world. And the beautiful thing about it is that the bond between performer and audience is completely symbiotic. One cannot exist without the other. We will keep making music for as long as there is breath in our bodies, but to actually create the means to transport it from our heads into your hearts requires a contribution, a gift, and trust. We are asking for help, openly and with love. And there’s no truer thing in this world.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Short on cash? No problem! You can help out by spreading the world and sharing the hell out of this campaign. Check out the very simple SHARE functions on here to get this thing all over the internet. Whatever you decide to do, we love you for it, and we hope to see you at a show soon.

Lots of love,

FH & The F

xx

story:
The Journey So Far

www.bandviews.com is 100% owned and funded by a small team based in Australia, Singapore, India & Indonesia, we have made amazing progress & we need your support to get to the next level, it’s that SIMPLE … here is our story so far we hope you like it.

We discover amazing talent everyday with our fans beside us every step of the way.


We are beginning to make a difference, here is where we are today


We let fans and artists talk and Jam together creating memorable moments 24/7

We have engagement across all platforms leading to one destination, www.bandviews.com

We have built a platform driven by DATA to support ARTISTS, PARTNERS & FANS. Our artists earn 50% of all revenue we collect. 

We have built in Monitization. BandViews is a MEDIA platform to ensure ARTIST viability & longevity. The artists earn from sponsors, advertisers, crowd donations, ad plugins and distribution.

We are trying to change digital music for the better

We have a long term plan which we are happy to discuss with u. This is just the beginning, next stop comedy, fitness, cooking & fashion.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

In 2016 we plan to enter the US, UK, Malaysia, Thailand as well as continue to expand on our success in Australia, India, Indonesia and Singapore. We continue to reach more artists, more fans and more commercial partners. 

We hope to upgrade our www.bandviews.com platform and convert our mobile site to a mobile app to to ensure our fans and artists have the best possible experience. We will continue to invest  in sound, visual and lighting equipment to ensure the best possible input. 

Our artists earn 50% of all revenue we collect. In 2015 that was $10,000 in payments for our artists, this needs to grow and with your support it will. We are independent and are passionately supported by our community. We need ur help to keep beating down the doors to ensure artists no matter where they are can connect with FANS anywhere to realise their full potential.

We discover amazing talent everyday that deserves to be discovered

- feel free to join -
Steve & The BandViews team
(P.S that's the Tshirt on the right)

story:
All About The Project…

Greetings everyone.  

My name is Warren Attwell and I’m a singer-songwriter and music producer based in Northern Ireland.

Following the release of my EP ‘Fallen From Grace’ back in 2012 I quickly began slaving away on it’s follow up.  After all the blood, sweat, tears and a few trips around the emotional roller coaster of life I’m pleased to present my latest offering Holding On For Something.

Working alongside an incredibly talented group of musicians, combined with the help and expertise of Florida based producer Darren Schneider (Deep Purple, Imogen Heap, Christina Perri, Backstreet Boys), I feel that Holding On For Something not only represents a vast development in my skill as a songwriter but also my ability to be comfortably open and honest about the things that move and affect me in everyday life.

In short, I’m very excited for you all to hear it and I hope you are too!

Why I need your help…

Over the years I’ve managed to build up a pretty reasonable home studio which has been great for keeping overall production costs down.   In a wonderful twist of fate, a few years back I was also fortunate enough to meet Darren Schneider, an acclaimed American producer who has taken me under his wing and been willing to work with me and help me to develop as both a songwriter and producer.  I’ve also been blessed to have met a lot of really talented musicians and creatives over the years, many of whom have given up their time and energy completely free of charge to contribute in some way to this latest release.

All in all I feel like I’ve got a pretty sweet deal…  But even with all of this generosity it still costs a lot of money to create and release new music!  So where exactly is that £2000 going to?

  • Audio Mastering - Before a new record can be manufactured or released digitally on iTunes / Spotify etc. the mixed songs must be mastered so that they are considered to be ‘radio production quality’.  Part of the money raised will go towards creating professional instrumental and album masters.
  • CD Manufacturing - Although CD sales have been diminishing rapidly over the past decade, surprisingly the vast majority of my album sales come from physical copies sold at gigs.  This income stream is vital to help me regenerate the money I invest in recording and releasing new material and allows me to get back into the studio sooner rather than later; meaning I can create more music more often that you’re hopefully going to love!
  • Promotion and Marketing - With the new digital age of music it has in many ways become very easy to reach new audiences all over the world.  The only pitfall is that now there is so much new music being created and released everyday that it can be difficult to get heard amongst all of the noise.  Unsurprisingly YouTube has become one of the most popular search engines in the world and is now the way that many people are discovering new artists and great new music.  Therefore some of the money raised will also go towards creating a number of new music videos and lyric videos for the tracks off my new EP.
  • UK / Irish / Worldwide Touring - The thing I love most about being a musician is being able to travel the world and meet interesting people like you.  But that can cost a lot of money too!  Therefore any money leftover from the campaign shall be put to good use by helping to book trains, planes and automobiles so I can bring my music to a venue near you!

What’s in it for you?

I’ve tried to setup this campaign to provide something for everyone, regardless of how much they are able to give.  I hope that I’ve created a range of perks that allow you all to connect with me and my music in a range new and exciting ways.  And of course if there are any other perks you would like to see listed here, don't hesitate to get in touch... I'd love to hear your ideas!

As someone who struggles a lot with self confidence and self belief your support really does mean the world to me.  Although I believe that any creative activity can act as a great form of therapy for any of us, ultimately we’re all fickle human beings and when we release something that we have created out into the big bad world all we really want is for it to be appreciated in some small way.

Regardless of whether you can donate £2 or £1000 you should be satisfied in knowing that you are helping to keep my dream alive, not only financially but also on a much deeper emotional level, because it shows me that people believe in me and all that I’m trying to achieve!

Other ways you can help…

I completely understand that most people nowadays don’t pay for music.  If you’d much rather wait until you can stream this new EP on Spotify for free, I’m quite honestly fine with that too.  All I ask is that if you enjoy it please share it with your friends.  Likewise, if you believe in me and enjoy the music I create enough to pay for it, please help spread the word of this campaign to your friends and loved ones.  It really does help a lot more than you might realise!

Thanks again for all your support!

Warren xo

story:
Hi, I'm Ant Smith. I'm a poet and I try to use poetry to entertain, but also to make the world a better place! Last year my poem "Shorty" went viral. It's a body-positivity piece, tackling the concern of Penis Size Anxiety. It was very, very effective...

...so now I want to extend the message.I want to do for all forms of body shaming what Shorty did for Penis Anxiety. I want us to create a collaborative CD with a range of artists, not just me and not just poetry. I want to tackle (and defeat) a range of body image concerns (not just penis anxiety). I want to make Body Positivity THE conversation of 2016. I want our celebration of ourselves to be heard on radio stations and TV channels around the world. Just like Shorty was - but this time touching the lives of many, many millions.

What We Need

I already have a collective of very exciting artists involved tackling all forms of shaming, be that weight, height, penis size or shape, body hair, eczema or gender confusion… any and all forms of bullying people for how they look, for who they are. While I'm funding for the project we'll be looking for more contributions from artists. So if you are a musician, poet, rapper, comedian etc who cares about the subject - feel free to message me for details on how to send tracks over.

We're looking to release a compilation album and host a launch event in London. All funds go to these endeavours, none of the artists involved are paid for their contributions. This is a not-for-profit project. We're looking to spread the body-positive message above all else.

If we don't reach the target, then we'll scale back on the number of CDs we press and the scale of the launch event. We will still be able to release the collaboration album though - it's just a question of scale.

What Will Be Achieved

Body shaming has become an everyday occurrence. There's a constant stream of celebrity headlines as 'fat' jibes are traded for 'small penis' insults. They make for easy ratings-boosting headlines, and it all seems so inconsequential in the backdrop of wars and austerity. But behind the headlines there is day to day misery for millions as we drive each other into depression, and even suicide.

My experience over the last year has taught me that if we refuse to be shamed, if we are open and honest about who we are, if we celebrate ourselves then we eradicate misery. I've given interviews around the world to millions of readers/listeners/viewers on the concern of penis size anxiety and the response has been 99.999% positive. People who have been in deep despair have written to me and told me what a difference it makes, for one person to stand up and say "I'm this too, and I own it".

And that's just one of the many, many body image concerns we're living with.

By supporting this project you can make a real difference to the quality of life of people across the world.  And when you look at any of the statistics that means, this project can benefit your siblings, your friends, your colleagues, maybe even yourself - whether you're aware of such issues today or not.

Who else is involved

  • Jason James – From Henry My Son
  • The Commie Faggots
  • Dinnernanny
  • Beadyman (Poet)
  • Miss Roberts
  • Tara Fleur – Woman of Bones
  • Dan Hunt (Poet and Musician)
  • Be Atwell (Poet)
  • Becky Fury (Poet and Comedian)
  • Sarah-Jane Miller (Musician)
  • Calm Carl (Poet)
  • Ms. Teri Mishun (Engineer)
  • The GameCat (Poet)

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share the project with other musicians/spoken word artists who might want to contribute work for the CD. And of course, sharing the link with others who may be able to donate is tremendously helpful.
story_txt:
Hi, I'm Ant Smith. I'm a poet and I try to use poetry to entertain, but also to make the world a better place! Last year my poem "Shorty" went viral. It's a body-positivity piece, tackling the concern of Penis Size Anxiety. It was very, very effective...

...so now I want to extend the message.I want to do for all forms of body shaming what Shorty did for Penis Anxiety. I want us to create a collaborative CD with a range of artists, not just me and not just poetry. I want to tackle (and defeat) a range of body image concerns (not just penis anxiety). I want to make Body Positivity THE conversation of 2016. I want our celebration of ourselves to be heard on radio stations and TV channels around the world. Just like Shorty was - but this time touching the lives of many, many millions.   What We Need I already have a collective of very exciting artists involved tackling
all forms of shaming, be that weight, height, penis size or shape, body hair,
eczema or gender confusion… any and all forms of bullying people for how they
look, for who they are. While I'm funding for the project we'll be looking for more contributions from artists. So if you are a musician, poet, rapper, comedian etc who cares about the subject - feel free to message me for details on how to send tracks over.
We're looking to release a compilation album and host a launch event in London. All funds go to these endeavours, none of the artists involved are paid for their contributions. This is a not-for-profit project. We're looking to spread the body-positive message above all else.
If we don't reach the target, then we'll scale back on the number of CDs we press and the scale of the launch event. We will still be able to release the collaboration album though - it's just a question of scale.
What Will Be Achieved
 
Body shaming
has become an everyday occurrence. There's a constant stream of celebrity headlines
as 'fat' jibes are traded for 'small penis' insults. They make for easy
ratings-boosting headlines, and it all seems so inconsequential in the backdrop
of wars and austerity. But behind the headlines there is day to day misery for
millions as we drive each other into depression, and even suicide.
My experience over the last year has taught me that if we refuse to be shamed, if we are open and honest about who we are, if we celebrate ourselves then we eradicate misery. I've given interviews around the world to millions of readers/listeners/viewers on the concern of penis size anxiety and the response has been 99.999% positive. People who have been in deep despair have written to me and told me what a difference it makes, for one person to stand up and say "I'm this too, and I own it".
And that's just one of the many, many body image concerns we're living with.
By supporting this project you can make a real difference to the quality of life of people across the world.  And when you look at any of the statistics that means, this project can benefit your siblings, your friends, your colleagues, maybe even yourself - whether you're aware of such issues today or not.
Who else is involved



Jason James – From Henry My Son
The Commie Faggots
Dinnernanny
Beadyman (Poet)
Miss Roberts
Tara Fleur – Woman of Bones
Dan Hunt (Poet and Musician)
Be Atwell (Poet)
Becky Fury (Poet and Comedian)
Sarah-Jane Miller (Musician)
Calm Carl (Poet)
Ms. Teri Mishun (Engineer)
The GameCat (Poet)
Other Ways You Can Help
 You can share the project with other musicians/spoken word artists who might want to contribute work for the CD. And of course, sharing the link with others who may be able to donate is tremendously helpful.

story:
Tizmoret's Been Around For 20 Years!

We are excited to be commemorating our legacy with an anniversary EP!

If you are someone who loves clapping along to Hafachta or gets the chills every time they hear Amen, this is not a CD you will want to miss. It is set to be a musical journey through Tizmoret's greatest hits and will be populated by Tizmoret's most beloved singers. But, we can't do it without you! 

Right now we have completed all the recording but we still need to pay our sound engineers to edit and mix the album, on top of actually producing the  CD. Please consider helping our campaign--there are amazing rewards for our supporters!

Musically yours,

Team T

story:
This album is the soundtrack for the past 8 years of my life.  These songs have a thread of gratitude, community, redemption, and celebration woven through them.  It’s the story of my Home Team.  In many ways, I had to live out the lyrics of these songs first before they could be written.

“Celebrate with those who celebrate; grieve with those who grieve." -Romans 12:15

What is a Home Team? Author Shauna Niequist describes a home team as the people "who get themselves a glass of water without asking when they’re at your house. These are the people who cry when you cry. These are your people, your middle-of-the-night, no-matter-what people."

This new album is an illustration of what we see in the Redwood trees: Their roots are so intertwined that when the high winds come, these exceedingly tall trees don't get blown down because their root system supports one another.  That image is at the core of this project.  I know with certainty that if weren't for my faith in Jesus and my own Home Team, I would have toppled down long ago.  

Since the release of my EP 3 ½ years ago, I’ve grown more as a musician and vocalist than in any years prior.  For most of my life, the fear of self-promotion paralyzed me from talking about my music and pursuing it seriously.  Now, after 15 years of doing music vocationally, I've finally gotten to the point where, when I’m at the doctor’s office and they ask my profession, I’m able to say, “I’m a singer and songwriter.”  My friend tells me it’s because I finally believe it.  Having logged more hours recording and songwriting, I’m so excited to be in the studio again, fully knowing the nuances of my voice and how to utilize them even better. 

The cost of making an album of professional quality is large and complex. With pre and post production costs, recording time in the studio, and paying musicians a decent wage (which doesn’t always happen in this industry), each song costs a total of approximately $2,000 to produce. The goal of this project is to raise enough funds to record 3-5 radio quality songs.   

FAQ's: 

  • Why don't you just go through a label to make this album?  A label would be *incredible*.  I'm trying hard not to put that word in all caps and bold. ;) Where I live, there are coffee shops every half mile (which is truly fantastic, but not exactly Music Row or L.A.). So if you have label connections, let's talk!
  • What type of music will be on this album?  SOULFUL; with an Sara Bareilles-- Lauren Daigle--Norah Jones--Alicia Keys--Francesca Battistelli--Gavin Degraw--kind of vibe. 
  • What's your favorite part of recording?  Definitely overdubbing the harmonies/background vocals! SO much fun! Plus, I can hire myself for free. ;)

THANK YOU very much for your support and for spreading the word!

Grateful,

--Olivia Pothoff

story:
Les Enfants d'Orphée: Who Are We

Les Enfants d'Orphée is a new, international, Boston-based ensemble dedicated to the performance of French baroque vocal music. Les Enfants marries a solid musicological foundation with vocal and instrumental prowess. We strive to introduce and promote "Le Goût Français" - the French taste - to new audiences on both sides of the Atlantic. We focus on innovative performances that make classical music and baroque aesthetics immediate and relevant to young audiences, and give voice to excellent performers and little known composers. Through outreach and blogging, we intend on addressing many of the pressing issues in classical music head on.

What We Need & What You Get

  • To start our ensemble and cement plans for the coming season, we need $7,000. This will enable us to pay our musicians for concerts and educational outreach programs, secure a concert venue and rehearsal space, print programs and program notes, and move and care for delicate period instruments. 
  • Next season, we are planning an exciting event: the modern and North American premiere of a 1694 opera parody about the financial difficulties that have long plagued classical music, as well as classical music's constant struggle to seem relevant to mainstream society.  The success of our first concert in May 2016 will make our production of this opera parody more feasible. 
  • By donating at least $15 to our campaign, you will receive one free admission to one performance of each program through the 2016-2018 seasons.  With a donation of $30 or more, you will become one of Les Muses of Les Enfants d'Orphée, and your name will be included in all of our future programs and recording booklets. With any donation of a dollar or more, you will have the opportunity to come backstage either before or after any concert to meet the performers.
  • If we do not reach our full funding goal, we will use the funds raised to put on a smaller scale concert for the public.

Why Is French Baroque Music Important, Anyway?

Baroque music evokes the full range of human emotion - from burning rage to amorous folly.  Baroque music is not limited to sounds that come from instruments or the human voice; it is deeply visual and visceral music that was performed by its first performers with physical gestures and meaningful movements.  Listening to and learning about baroque repertoire helps us to connect with ourselves by experiencing the spectrum of human emotion.  At the same time, it gives us new perspectives with which to observe the human condition.

The American model of music education was founded along the model of the German conservatories, and as such, still often teaches only the works of Germanic or Italian composers of the baroque and classical periods.  Because of this, French baroque music has been virtually absent from American music education.  For example, how many Americans would recognize the names Bach, Mozart, and Handel?  In comparison, how many fewer Americans would recognize the names Lully, Rameau, or Boismortier?  Charpentier, Du Mont, or Marais?  We intend to help break the mold of American music education, and open the treasury of this wonderful French music.  Doing so is long overdue, given America's longstanding alliance with France, large French-speaking populations, and long-term love affair with French culture.  

Risks & Challenges

Starting a classical music organization that has the resources to sustain itself is fraught with problems.  Audiences for this repertoire are dwindling and aging.  Public funding for classical music is scarce and corporate funding is difficult to come by.  We intend on meeting these challenges in the following ways:

  • Our musicians are dedicated to this art.  They are professionals who play with some of the best ensembles in the North East, including the Boston Lyric Opera, Handel and Haydn Society, and Cantata Singers.  
  • Our musicians are teaching artists.  Through our outreach activities, we are constantly working to develop new audiences across demographics that are under-represented in classical music audiences.
  • We are based in Boston, which has one of the most vibrant and appreciated classical music communities of the United States.  Our location ensures us more stability than we would otherwise have elsewhere in the country.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread word about our efforts.
  • Visit our website at www.lesenfantsdorphee.com to read our blog and check for upcoming events.
  • Whether or not you choose to give, we would be honored to see you at our concerts.
  • Share tools on Indiegogo are available. Please share!

story:
ROO.o

Thanks for Checking out our campaign to fund the Next Anthony Rosano and the Conqueroos Record. We are super excited about this opportunity and look forward to dropping the ROOdest Blues Rock Record we can! In writing material for the new record, Anthony had the good fortune to cross paths with none other than Mike Zito.  Mike has an incredible body of Solo work as well as being one of the founding members of The Royal Southern Brotherhood. While talking guitars, Blues, and a little Van Halen, Mike graciously offered his skills as producer of the next ROOs record. With our new material, Mike Zito at the production Helm, and the talented staff at Dockside Studios, this will be the record that can truly bring us to the international stage.  We have our fans to thank for everything we have accomplished so far and this is the next level.  


We NEED your help!

Our first record was self produced, we are proud of that record and glad so many of you have enjoyed it. This time we would be recording in a professional enviroment, with folks who know the business of making great records. Dockside is a world class studio and many of our favorite artists have recorded there. Anders Osborne, Tab Benoit, Albert Castigila, and of course Mike Zito himself. If you are judged by the company you keep, we will be in very fine company indeed! Of course this comes at a greater cost to the artist, while we have a good amount of our own skin in the game we are reaching out to you to help us fund the record. 

We don't expect something for nothing so we have some killer Perks lined up. From pre orders of the new CD (signed of course), exclusive Live downloads, Guitars, Harmonicas, heck we will even play at your house!

When fully funded we will be able to finish paying production costs, have the final tracks mastered and ready for duplication. If you know the Conqueroos you know we are driven to create music so this record WILL BE MADE, your contributions will help us get the record done on schedule and will help it to be THE BEST CONQUEROOS RECORD YET! 


If you can't contribute financially...

We understand times may be tight, so if you can't contribute please help by becoming a member of our street team. Please use the share tools, tell a friend, help us spread the word about our campaign and lets get this record out to the world!

story:
I have shared the field pictures in the gallery, please do have a look and your contribution will go to all these local collaborators. Also sharing a video of a dance during a ritual procession.


Summary

  • I am a sound recording alumna from Film and Television Institute of India
  • Your monetary contribution will be supporting the efforts of all my amazing local artists and collaborators from rural areas in Jharkhand, India. These include dancers, musicians, mask makers and local people.

Your Funding is needed for

  • Fair & Equal pay for Cast and Crew including local artistes and collaborators
  • Location & Marketing efforts

  • Equipment for the shoot - better microphones

  • I will be sending videos to all as the project progresses.

The Impact

  • The biggest risk of making Jharkhand's tribal art forms come to life is that they should not be left unheard.  This project will enable to bring to digital form a lot of the lost intangible cultures and tribes of the state of Jharkhand, India
  • I have previously worked on several community projects across India and Nepal

Please Spread the Word

  • Please share this with your friends list, every share and small amount is valuable.

story:
**Update:

Hello friends! We just wrapped up an Indie GoGo campaign for this project, but would like to continue raising funds as production begins! With the help of investors, we are only about $2k shy of our goal. The perks & their prices may have changed around a bit. My Grammy-winning producer Robert Eibach has projected that we can definitely hit Billboard with my new single, so now it's just a matter of raising the final funds to complete the song! If you'd like to get personal updates and behind-the-scenes looks from me in the making of this record, the minimum donation is $5!
[If we exceed our goal, then I can use that money for a music video!!!]

____________________________________________

Want to Go Behind the Scenes in the Music Industry?

Hello friends, I'm Lauren Nikohl, singer and songwriter based in Los Angeles, California. I began my musical journey with your help in Minneapolis, Minnesota when I released my debut EP titled The Night last year. Being an independent artist through this journey has been such a rewarding experience, and I now wish to continue my momentum into 2016! I have made great connections with grammy-winning artists David Longoria and Robert Eibach who wish to help me on this journey by finding all the right ties to get my new record to the Billboard Charts. They've helped quite a few other artists hit Billboard in the past! So, what does it take to get to the billboard charts? Mostly MONEY (Yeah I know, corporatism sucks), professional promotion, and a killer song! In exchange for your donation (or t-shirt order, etc.), I will be giving you a personal, behind-the-scenes look at how I create the song, how the song gets produced, and many other details that go into my journey to the Billboard Charts! You will also get to hear the final product before it is released worldwide on iTunes & Spotify! As a recording artist, my current goal to hit the Billboard Charts is simply strategic. Once I have hit Billboard, I will finally be able to  get paid to perform at big venues across the US, therefore allowing me to pursue music full time! You can learn more about the billboard charting process below. If you'd like to know a little bit more about me, you can visit my website at http://laurennikohlmusic.wix.com/laurennikohl. You can also hear The Night EP on Spotify to get a taste of my music. 

With your help, I can get the funds and momentum that I need to get my record noticed by Club DJ's, Grammy members, Billboard Chart reporters, and Radio Stations across the nation. I will be releasing the original Record as well as a few different remixes for DJ Club play. 

 It means so much to me to have your support in this process, because I can't do it alone. As I began learning about the business of music, I had NO idea how much money it really takes to "make it". I'm not a Hollywood poster child who has "Daddy's Money" to pay for my studio time-- I am a small town artist with a dream to create music my whole life, a passion for spreading thoughtful messages in the media, and a goal to tour the world. I believe that my fans will be able to support me with the funds that I require for this project without having a big time record label back my music. I need YOUR HELP to make a name for myself in the music industry! Look how far we've come already.

The Song

I am so pleased to finally announce the title of my new record: Against the Wind! This song is about fighting the oppression on your dreams, doing what makes you happy, and taking control of your life! We have begun production, and the track is sounding like a super fun and powerful dance anthem! If you'd like to read the full lyrics... join the campaign, and you will receive all "behind the scenes" information and sneak peaks!

Why We Need the Money & What You Get

I'll break down the costs for you in detail:

  • We need to hire a big time promoter, who will help us get the song played in clubs and on various radio stations. Every play by a DJ or radio station who reports to Billboard will boost the song's position on the charts. This is the GREATEST marketing tool we have to launch the song into the industry. 
  • There are other promotional costs, such as ads on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and various other platforms. 
  • We need to create and ship all of the Perks to you! These perks are exclusive to Indie Gogo donors, so all the T-Shirts, early access to music, and other goodies will be for your ears and eyes only. 
  • Most money gets spent on the high quality production, which includes: studio time, musician fees, and producer/remixer fees (Differently styled remixes will get played in different clubs, expanding Lauren Nikohl's audience). Big time producers need big time money if you want to work with them, so your donations will be supporting the amazing quality of production that is necessary for this record to hit the charts.

The Impact

The rise of streaming services and download services such as Spotify and LimeWire make it very difficult for musicians to generate any profit these days from making their music. That is why so many artists are turning to crowd funding, where their fans can connect directly with the process of making the product, and access exclusive merchandise in lieu of supporting the artist from the beginning of a project. It gives a fan ownership in the career of an artist they believe in as well as an exclusive inside look into the whole record making process. By pre-ordering any Perk item $5+ and supporting my new record, you will get an all access pass to exclusive behind the scenes footage and updates that no one else will get to see, like videos of us in the studio, sneak peaks of new material, and other surprises. Fans and artists are now better connected ever before, and it means a lot to me for you to support my goals and my artistry! 

My goal as an artist is to bring a whole new wave of mindfulness, innovation, and determination in the music industry. I hope to introduce optimistic, thought-provoking, and motivational messages into popular music to inspire young generations to come in challenging the status quo, and finding oneself along life's journey. It is my wish to spend my whole life creating and performing, all while making positive and lasting social impact.

As previously mentioned, I already successfully produced an EP with the help of crowd funding, so I believe in its communal power. Any donation helps. YOU can make a huge impact for my career in music, and it will not be forgotten! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can get the word out and make some noise about this campaign on social media. Use those Indie Gogo share tools!
  • Message/Email all of your friends and ask them to follow Lauren Nikohl on Spotify, Facebook, SoundCloud, Instagram, and spread the word about her as a recording artist. Maybe even share a YouTube video to help her gain a larger audience!
Thank you all so much for your efforts in this process. It is with a humble heart that I accept your financial support in this time of my music career, and I will never go a day in my life without being grateful for all of the support I have already received in order to pursue my dreams!

Warm Regards,

     Lauren Nikohl
story_txt:
**Update:Hello friends! We just wrapped up an Indie GoGo campaign for this project, but would like to continue raising funds as production begins! With the help of investors, we are only about $2k shy of our goal. The perks & their prices may have changed around a bit. My Grammy-winning producer Robert Eibach has projected that we can definitely hit Billboard with my new single, so now it's just a matter of raising the final funds to complete the song! If you'd like to get personal updates and behind-the-scenes looks from me in the making of this record, the minimum donation is $5![If we exceed our goal, then I can use that money for a music video!!!]____________________________________________Want to Go Behind the Scenes in the Music Industry?Hello friends, I'm Lauren Nikohl, singer and songwriter based in Los Angeles, California. I began my musical journey with your help in Minneapolis, Minnesota when I released my debut EP titled The Night last year. Being an independent artist through this journey has been such a rewarding experience, and I now wish to continue my momentum into 2016! I have made great connections with grammy-winning artists David Longoria and Robert Eibach who wish to help me on this journey by finding all the right ties to get my new record to the Billboard Charts. They've helped quite a few other artists hit Billboard in the past! So, what does it take to get to the billboard charts? Mostly MONEY (Yeah I know, corporatism sucks), professional promotion, and a killer song! In exchange for your donation (or t-shirt order, etc.), I will be giving you a personal, behind-the-scenes look at how I create the song, how the song gets produced, and many other details that go into my journey to the Billboard Charts! You will also get to hear the final product before it is released worldwide on iTunes & Spotify! As a recording artist, my current goal to hit the Billboard Charts is simply strategic. Once I have hit Billboard, I will finally be able to  get paid to perform at big venues across the US, therefore allowing me to pursue music full time! You can learn more about the billboard charting process below. If you'd like to know a little bit more about me, you can visit my website at http://laurennikohlmusic.wix.com/laurennikohl. You can also hear The Night EP on Spotify to get a taste of my music. With your help, I can get the funds and momentum that I need to get my record noticed by Club DJ's, Grammy members, Billboard Chart reporters, and Radio Stations across the nation. I will be releasing the original Record as well as a few different remixes for DJ Club play.  It means so much to me to have your support in this process, because I can't do it alone. As I began learning about the business of music, I had NO idea how much money it really takes to "make it". I'm not a Hollywood poster child who has "Daddy's Money" to pay for my studio time-- I am a small town artist with a dream to create music my whole life, a passion for spreading thoughtful messages in the media, and a goal to tour the world. I believe that my fans will be able to support me with the funds that I require for this project without having a big time record label back my music. I need YOUR HELP to make a name for myself in the music industry! Look how far we've come already.The SongI am so pleased to finally announce the title of my new record: Against the Wind! This song is about fighting the oppression on your dreams, doing what makes you happy, and taking control of your life! We have begun production, and the track is sounding like a super fun and powerful dance anthem! If you'd like to read the full lyrics... join the campaign, and you will receive all "behind the scenes" information and sneak peaks!Why We Need the Money & What You GetI'll break down the costs for you in detail:
We need to hire a big time promoter, who will help us get the song played in clubs and on various radio stations. Every play by a DJ or radio station who reports to Billboard will boost the song's position on the charts. This is the GREATEST marketing tool we have to launch the song into the industry. 
There are other promotional costs, such as ads on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and various other platforms. 
We need to create and ship all of the Perks to you! These perks are exclusive to Indie Gogo donors, so all the T-Shirts, early access to music, and other goodies will be for your ears and eyes only. 
Most money gets spent on the high quality production, which includes: studio time, musician fees, and producer/remixer fees (Differently styled remixes will get played in different clubs, expanding Lauren Nikohl's audience). Big time producers need big time money if you want to work with them, so your donations will be supporting the amazing quality of production that is necessary for this record to hit the charts.
The ImpactThe rise of streaming services and download services such as Spotify and LimeWire make it very difficult for musicians to generate any profit these days from making their music. That is why so many artists are turning to crowd funding, where their fans can connect directly with the process of making the product, and access exclusive merchandise in lieu of supporting the artist from the beginning of a project. It gives a fan ownership in the career of an artist they believe in as well as an exclusive inside look into the whole record making process. By pre-ordering any Perk item $5+ and supporting my new record, you will get an all access pass to exclusive behind the scenes footage and updates that no one else will get to see, like videos of us in the studio, sneak peaks of new material, and other surprises. Fans and artists are now better connected ever before, and it means a lot to me for you to support my goals and my artistry! My goal as an artist is to bring a whole new wave of mindfulness, innovation, and determination in the music industry. I hope to introduce optimistic, thought-provoking, and motivational messages into popular music to inspire young generations to come in challenging the status quo, and finding oneself along life's journey. It is my wish to spend my whole life creating and performing, all while making positive and lasting social impact.As previously mentioned, I already successfully produced an EP with the help of crowd funding, so I believe in its communal power. Any donation helps. YOU can make a huge impact for my career in music, and it will not be forgotten! Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
You can get the word out and make some noise about this campaign on social media. Use those Indie Gogo share tools!
Message/Email all of your friends and ask them to follow Lauren Nikohl on Spotify, Facebook, SoundCloud, Instagram, and spread the word about her as a recording artist. Maybe even share a YouTube video to help her gain a larger audience!
Thank you all so much for your efforts in this process. It is with a humble heart that I accept your financial support in this time of my music career, and I will never go a day in my life without being grateful for all of the support I have already received in order to pursue my dreams!
Warm Regards,
     Lauren Nikohl

story:
Hello beautiful people! My name is Corinne Danielle. I am a singer/songwriter/makeup artist from Tampa, FL. My passion for music came at a very young age. I have been blessed with amazing support from my parents, family, friends, and even those I just happen to stumble across for the first time at a show or event. It is amazing how music can bring so much love to one place or certain situation. That is what i always intend to do when writing my songs; heal, nourish, empower, uplift, and spread love. This album is for me, for you, and for love & happiness! Genres such as acoustic, Latin, RnB, jazz, house and funk are included in the album. 

My first single Me Time is now up on all music sources. The track is about being independent after going through a long relationship of does and donts and trying times. It is a single ladies or single man anthem! 

Another song that I just finished writing is called 'Note To Self' which is about a my younger self writing a letter to my older adult self; letting myself know that I can conquer whatever I put in front of me, that I am fearless and have no boundaries. I am hoping that this is a reminder to all the trust and believe in yourself. 

Please help me make this album a possibility and a success. It is my true dream. Check out all of the incentives that come with your donations. To all of you who took the time to read, share & or donate, I LOVE YOU ALL. Thank you so so much for the support!


xoxo Corinne Danielle

story:
The Project

The Response Project is a commissioning initiative, lead by pianist Brianna Matzke, that seeks to create brand new works for the piano. Each set of pieces is created by asking composers to write music for the piano (and sometimes other instruments too) in response to a preexisting artwork or idea.

This is the fundraising campaign to support the second phase of the project.

This Response Project will create seven innovative pieces for piano + violin, written by seven young composers in response to one simple phrase:

ON BEHALF

Composers have been invited to consider
- how this phrase impacts them personally, politically, and/or artistically
- potential manifestations of the phrase within musical composition
- what this phrase means within the context of musical performance

This phrase "ON BEHALF" was drawn from the following exchange between Killer Mike and Stephen Colbert on The Tonight Show:

 
Each of our seven composers have chosen to speak "on behalf" of an idea, person, community, or condition. Response examples include:
- ON BEHALF of disability
- ON BEHALF of my two Southern grandmothers
- ON BEHALF of metaphor
- ON BEHALF of Earth's future residents
- ON BEHALF of Edward Snowden and other NSA whistleblowers
 
When the project has been fully funded, the pieces will receive two premieres:
World Premiere: Tribeca New Music Festival in New York City at the cell theatre 
Cincinnati Premiere: Contemporary Art Center Black Box Theater in collaboration with Chase Public
 
Beyond the creation and premiere of seven new works, we are making a studio recording of the pieces, with album art by John Lee. You can see more of his work here.
 
Your support will make the following possible:
- commissioning our composers and artists
- booking venues and producing publicity
- recording and releasing the studio album
 

About us:

Dr. Brianna Matzke's (pictured left) dynamic pianism has been described as possessing "a sense of refinement, flair, and technical prowess" (ClevelandClassical.com). An avid performer and commissioner of new music, she has collaborated with many composers, including Mark Mothersbaugh, Douglas Knehans, Molly Joyce, Dylan Sheridan,​ Stephanie Ann Boyd,​ Paul Schuette, Danny Clay, Ty Neimeyer, Jen Jolley, Carrie Magin, Evan Williams, Paul Poston, Bryan Percoco, Trevor Gomes, Jason Richmond, Bradley Harris, and Lindsey Jacob.

In addition to performing,​ Brianna is a dedicated music educator and pedagogue. A Nationally Certified Teacher of Music (NCTM), she​ has served on the faculties of the Oberlin Conservatory, Interlochen Arts Camp, and the University of Cincinnati College-Conservatory of Music Preparatory Division. As an educator, ​Brianna believes in the power of music to incite positive social change, and she encourages that change by serving as President of the Ohio Music Teachers Association Southwest Division and volunteering as a piano instructor for the MYCincinnati Youth Orchestra. She holds degrees from the University of Cincinnati College-Conservatory of Music (CCM) and the University of Kansas.

Hungarian-American violinist Hajnal Kármán Pivnick (pictured right) was born and raised in Memphis, Tennessee. She advocates the performance and promotion of music written in the 20th and 21st century, and works extensively as an educator and arts administrator. She is co-founder of Tenth Intervention, a collective of musicians that presents new music in New York City.

Hajnal performs regularly with IRIS Orchestra, ensemble mise-en, and the Bleecker String Quartet, and has played with the Memphis Symphony Orchestra, Opera Theater of Pittsburgh, and the Hungarian New Music Chamber Ensemble (UMZE). In New York, she performs in venues ranging in scope from The Knitting Factory to Joe’s Pub to Carnegie Hall.

Hajnal is a member of the violin faculty at Interlochen Arts Camp, and maintains a violin studio at Greenwich House Music School and Opus 118 Harlem School of Music. She is also a chamber music coach with the Face the Music/Kronos Quartet program. She holds degrees from Carnegie Mellon University and the Liszt Academy of Music in Budapest, Hungary.

Special Guest Performer: Joining the project is "the go-to pianist of the New York underground" (Lucid Culture) Kathleen Supove, who is co-commissioning one of the pieces in the project.

The Composers:

  • William R. Ayers (Cincinnati)
  • Andy Costello (Chicago)
  • Alexandra du Bois (New York City)
  • Molly Joyce (New Haven)
  • Nate May (Cincinnati)
  • D. J. Sparr (Baltimore/Wild West)
  • Dorian Wallace (New York City)

Visit TheResponseProject.org to read complete composer biographies.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every bit of support helps!

Consider hosting us for a fundraising concert in your home. Visit http://www.theresponseproject.org to arrange an in-home performance in support of The Response Project.

If you're interested in participating in future projects or giving a helping hand in any other way, let us know! We are open to collaboration.

Share this page with your friends and let people know that we're working together to create new music!

Video by Demitri Makeig

story:
Resumen

Durante la época de colegio inicié mi contacto con la música. Escuchaba a bandas clásicas como: The Beatles, Led Zeppelin, Pink Floyd, Nirvana, Kula Shaker. Luego me interesé por el rock en mi idioma, fue así que conocí las canciones de Charly García, Fito Paez y Soda Stereo (mi banda favorita). Además, investigaba lo que venían haciendo las bandas nacionales, sus conciertos, discos y entrevistas.  Con toda esta marea de motivaciones, juntaba amigos para hacer las primeras bandas, componía canciones y llenaba cuadernos con palabras y frases que me gustaban.

Hace 3 años comencé una carrera solista, presentándome en varios festivales y siendo invitado en otros conciertos, gracias a mi amistad con otros músicos. No dejo de hacer canciones, pues son mi manera de expresión.

Este año quiero grabar un disco, mi primer disco y necesito tu apoyo.

 

 

El dinero recaudado será usado para alquilar un estudio de grabación, mezcla y masterización. También ayudará a cubrir el transporte de equipos e instrumentos, los pagos a los músicos y sus viáticos. Además, contaremos con un diseñador gráfico para la realización de la portada y con un profesional en audiovisuales para una sesión de fotos y registro en video de el proceso de grabación de todo el disco.

 

Cuento contigo

 

 

Un abrazo

story:
We would like to begin with some background on us to let you know who we are and what we can bring to you!

Belgian Producer, Sunfreakz is a classically trained musician with a focus on classical techniques, theory, harmony, composition and history. This focus led to his first success, “Inner Life” (Decoy & Roy), where he created a sound that took him from his classical roots to modern-day trance. Followed by House hit record, “Riding The Wave”, and a number of remixes for artists like Flo Rida, Ne-Yo, Nelly Furtado, Sophia May and William Orbit. Other hit records include “Counting Down The Days” (featuring Andrea Britton) and “Drive Out”. Collaborations with American songwriter/recording artist, Jeremy Carr has led to their 2011 release, “The Way We Are”. He collaborated with New York City singer/songwriter, Whitney Tai in the winter of 2014 to release her first single, "To Be Loved" and her debut album, Metamorphosis shortly after.

Whitney Tai is an emerging singer, songwriter, entertainer and designer from New York City. In January 2014, Tai released her first pop single in collaboration with Sunfreakz, “To Be Loved,” and a remix by Adrian Buster shortly after. The song received Hot Shot of the week on two FM stations in the country of Holland gaining her recognition from DJ’s and producers worldwide. In April 2015, Whitney dropped her first debut pop alternative album, “Metamorphosis,” written and co­-produced with Billboard chart topping composer, Sunfreakz. Her newest EP of 2016, Forever, was produced by Billboard producer Spencer Garn, engineered by Morgan Ray Garcia of Upstairs Records (Toni Braxton, Whitney Houston, Janet Jackson) and features drums by Janelle Monae’s official drummer, Mikey Phillips. Catch her performing live throughout NYC throughout the fall of 2016 in some of Manhattans most exclusive venues.

The campaign set before you is to raise crucial funds to create a piece of film by a team who strives to bring only the best quality visuals to their audience. With a dance song meant to set the Fall of 2016 on fire with its deep lyrical meaning, Truth Be Told music video needs your help to allow for the tools that will let us achieve quality filming, props, stylists, makeup, lighting and final video production. We want you to share in the dream of making our vision come alive.

Truth Be Told is going to need 8,000 dollars in funding. We are striving to get close to this figure to cover costly items such as: Camera equipment, lighting equipment, special lenses, car rentals, room/space rentals, film assistants, travel fees, fashion stylists, makeup artists, hair stylists, editing/production, time and labor of all people involved.

Some awesome perks to those looking to help us make some magic:

For $25 dollars donated, the first 15 people will receive a special contributor thank you credit in the music video as a token of our appreciation.

For $100 dollars donated, you will receive a t-shirt or poster designed by Whitney Tai and Sunfreakz.

Any contributions above $100 will receive a surprise gift from the music team as a humble and grateful thanks for allowing our project to blossom.

Any funds left over from the music video will be planned to be put towards the hiring, recording and mixing of a professional string quartet for Whitney Tai's new Ballad (set to release Fall of 2016).

This project is valuable on a number of levels. Whitney Tai and Sunfreakz are determined to bring you a quality piece of film that will represent the 1,000's of indie artists stamping their place in the industry through hard work and determination. You would be offering us a chance to make something of intrinsic depth and meaning for those who value art, film and music.

We understand that some may not be able to donate, but we ask you to find out how you can contribute in your own way. Whether you simply lend us your time or share this campaign with as many people as possible, you are allowing us visibility and the chance to reach our goals. We are so grateful for any of token that pushes us closer to our dream video.

With your help, we can make a truly lovely piece of art.

story:
Eva Rhymes- The Songwriter, The Artist

Eva Rhymes formally known as Jinxxx is a locally award nominated and internationally award winning songwriter who has delivered messages through her music through out the years. Her poetic delivery and bold approach breathes breath into hip-hop.  She sometimes crosses over with a very jazzy soul sound that may give you feels of Lauryn Hill. Full-time employee doing it all on her own, she still makes time for the stage. On off days traveling up the beltways to venues in New York, DC, and visiting radio stations in Chicago. She's been across seas to France and has connected with individuals for her songwriting and getting her music published. In Nashville she has pitched songs for country artist and she has never limits her writing ability . This year she has dropped by college radio stations and the SXSW in Austin to promote her project "OdDworld". Stories of her struggles and depressions can be picked up through out the electrifying project. Eva Rhymes does not let negativity stop her flow. She all always preaches and in fact has wrist bands that read, "Progress Is A Process". Eva Rhymes is ready to drop her first full album ever as a artist in hopes she can take the hip-hop world by storm. All aboard! Be apart.


AFTER TWO YEARS EVA RHYMES IS ALMOST DONE HER FULL LENGTH ALBUM

It has been a journey for us WEIRDOZ BUT WE ARE HERE!!  We have gotten to this point after long hours and not so good days but now the time has arrived and I could not be more excited. Writing and letting music and you lead me to conferences such as SXSW and MIDEM knowing you all along have had my back has been extraordinary !


After handling entanglements, changing producers writing and rewriting songs, I have now returned bigger,sharpened, and stronger with new material that I truly believe in and want to share with you.

With NO support of a label I have juggled trying to be a photographer, videographer, a regular employee, a artist and still deal with the everyday bills and stress of life. The good thing about not having a label though, I HAVE no limitations of a label. This allows me to invest in myself into the project more completely than a signed artist. I can work on my own terms, collaborate with the people I want to, track at the studios I want to and oversee artwork, manufacturing, promotion and every element of this album as it comes together. I can also help one of my favorite charities when its all said and done for "The Life & Times Of Eva Rhymes" will have a percentage of all sales going to "The House Of Ruth", But that surely takes funds, and so far I am a one woman artist in a loosing battle. All my money is going to music and not my personal responsibilities causing problems that i must address urgently. But I don't want to lose time and you while i address my personal financial situation. 
I feel fortunate to have the opportunity to create this album with you, the people (Weirdoz) that have supported Eva Rhymes (Jinxxx) through the years past and have inspired me to now continue on into the future. 
Your pledges are going directly into the quality and reach of the album itself.They allow us the means to book time at studios we revere, travel to those locations, carefully record, mix and master the album in an effort to capture and articulate it in the best way that we can. This is an important album to us and we sincerely and passionately want to make the final outcome reflect that. Beyond that, your funding will allow us to manufacture physical copies so that we can continue to tour, distribute, promote, and spread the music to as many people as possible.  ‪This isn't a glamorous lifestyle and I don't plan on personally keeping any of the money raised - it is all going into making a really dope project and toward making this the best album that I with friends can create. ‬Like I also mentioned before just like anything I do I'd like to help a organization that i believe in and have volunteered at "The House Of Ruth" 


How & Why I Want This Album To Help Domestic Violence Victims..

The organization "House Of Ruth" is a place Eva Rhymes has once volunteered and helped with donations to bring awareness in the past to the serious matter of Domestic Violence. In songs such as "Jazebel" and "Young, Gifted and Black" Eva sheds light on this topic for it will always be apart of her life, family and peers personal experiences. When the album is completed Eva would like to give back to the community with a percentage of all sales going directly to the "House Of Ruth" as a donation to them and all their service to the community. Each sale of the completed project Eva will take out 30% and donate by quarter to The House Of Ruth. This Is her pledge! Check out the alarming information about domestic violence below.

  • Every 9 seconds in the US, a woman is assaulted or beaten.12
  • On average, nearly 20 people per minute are physically abused by an intimate partner in the United States. During one year, this equates to more than 10 million women and men.1
  • 1 in 3 women and 1 in 4 men have been victims of [some form of] physical violence by an intimate partner within their lifetime.1
  • 1 in 5 women and 1 in 7 men have been victims of severe physical violence by an intimate partner in their lifetime.1
  • 1 in 7 women and 1 in 18 men have been stalked by an intimate partner during their lifetime to the point in which they felt very fearful or believed that they or someone close to them would be harmed or killed.1
  • On a typical day, there are more than 20,000 phone calls placed to domestic violence hotlines nationwide.9
-http://www.ncadv.org/learn/statistics
Don't want to help my project but would like the House Of Ruth on your own?
NO PROBLEM! :-) this is their information 

House of Ruth Maryland
2201 Argonne Drive
Baltimore, MD 21218
410-889-0840 - Administrative Office
410-889-9347 - Fax
Email: info@hruthmd.org

24-Hour Hotline:  410-889-RUTH (7884)
Help is available in every language. 

Legal Hotline:  1-888-880-7884

Gateway Project: 410-554-8479 
(Monday - Thursday 10am - 6pm) 

House Of Ruth Website: http://www.hruth.org 




How One Dollar can make a difference ..
Every Dollar counts. Every one dollar given is appreciated and can make a difference in this campaign to get us closer to the dream and goal.




Making this album is long overdue and I wouldn't be doing any of this if it weren’t for you. IAM fired up, ready, eager, and excited. The album will come out as soon as possible and we will keep you posted every single step of the way.

Thank you. I can't say it enough

story:
Concentric Rings in Magnetic Levitation is an hour long composition by Michael Pisaro, written for three musicians playing live and pre-recorded piano, percussion, sine waves, tape machines, various objects and found sounds, and comprised of fourteen interdependently moving layers of musical material.

We (Teodora Stepancic, Martin Lorenz and Assaf Gidron) are a group of musicians who specialize in new music as composers and performers. We've had the privilege of performing Concentric Rings in Magnetic Levitation several times in The Netherlands, Israel and Germany, and we've found it to be a challenging and enriching experience for both the performers and audience. After our performance in Berlin last September we decided to record it for Martin's Dumpf Edition label. The recording will take place in Zürich, Switzerland on the 18th and 19th of August 2016 with experienced sound engineer and collaborator Willy Strehler, and released in spring 2017.

This multifaceted work creates a world within a world, a semblance of a naturally occurring environment within a performance space, in which both aesthetic and emotive sound qualities are elegantly balanced, glacially moving through time. We are looking to produce a recording that will similarly transform a space within which it is played, with an evolving and engaging sound environment.

With your help we will be able to cover part of the costs of renting the hall and equipment, tuning the piano, paying the sound engineer, mixing and mastering, CD production, copyright fees and travel costs.

Thanks a lot for supporting us!

Crew:

Teodora Stepancic - piano, sine waves, tape
Assaf Gidron - radios, objects, electronics
Martin Lorenz - percussion, tape
Willy Strehler - sound engineer

Biographies:


MICHAEL PISARO is a composer and guitarist, a member of the Wandelweiser Composers Ensemble and founder and director of the Experimental Music Workshop, California Institute of the Arts. His work is frequently performed in the U.S. and in Europe, in music festivals and in many smaller venues. Albums of his work have been released by such labels as Edition Wandelweiser Records, Compost and Height, Confront, Another Timbre, Cathnor, Erstwhile Records, Nine Winds and Gravity Wave which he curates. He has performed many of his own works and those of close associates Antoine Beuger, Kunsu Shim, Jürg Frey and Manfred Werder, and works from the experimental tradition, especially John Cage, Christian Wolff, James Tenney and George Brecht.

ASSAF GIDRON is a composer, musician and film sound designer Based in Brooklyn and originally from Tel Aviv. Assaf studied composition and computer music at Goldsmiths College, London and The Royal Conservatory, The Hague with, among others, Roger Redgate, Richard Barrett, John Lely, Martijn Padding and Gilius Van Bergeijk, and have had helpful conversations with Christian Wolff, Michael Finnissy, Antoine Beuger and Michael Pisaro. Assaf's music has been performed in The US, The Netherlands, UK, Germany, Argentina, Serbia and Israel by various ensembles and performers including the Asko Schoenberg ensemble, Ligeti Academy, Slagwerk Den Haag, Ensemble Modelo 62 and Ensemble Musica Nova. Together with Craig Shepard, Assaf is co-organizer of the Music for Contemplation concert series in Brooklyn. Assaf is also active as performer and improviser, playing cello, guitar and electronics, and part of the electronic music duo Stepancic-Gidron. He works as sound designer for film and video.

MARTIN LORENZ has worked since the mid-nineties as a freelance percussionist on the contemporary and experimental music scene and has realized solo and chamber music projects with assorted partners: Sebastian Berweck, Conrad Steinmann, Simone Keller, Teodora Stepancic and others. These partnerships have resulted in collaborative projects with composers such as Annesley Black, Antoine Chessex, Luc Döbereiner, Hugues Dufourt, Edu Haubensak, Virgil Moorefield, Bernhard Lang, Daniel Weissberg and Alfred Zimmerlin, whose works Martin Lorenz has premiered. Between 2002 and 2015 Martin was a member of the ensemble Collegium Novum Zurich. This collaboration is documented in many recordings, in particular the concert for percussion "Wer, wenn ich schriee, hörte mich..." by Georg Friedrich Haas, conducted by Enno Poppe.

TEODORA STEPANČIĆ is a pianist and composer currently based in Brooklyn, New York. As pianist Teodora specializes in performing and premiering works of living and emerging composers. Several composers wrote and dedicated their works to her. She is a core member of Ensemble Modelo62 (NL), Ensemble Studio6 (RS), Stepančić-Gidron duo (US), and she frequently collaborates with different new music ensembles as pianist and composer. Teodora regularly performs in Europe, Middle East, North and South America. In her compositions she explores different ways of incorporating theatrical elements into music performance, cyclical and game-based musical forms, and developing works in close collaboration with individual performers. She studied piano and composition at the University of Art in Belgrade and composition at the Royal Conservatory in The Hague. She also finished ballet school.

story:
Wake Up And See The Sun

Hi everyone! I am very excited to be recording my newest album Wake Up and See The Sun. If you love live music that's made with real instruments, then you know that there's no other music like it. It makes you feel good, it makes you laugh, dance, and sing along! I am creating a musical collage that was inspired by song writers Stevie Wonder and Frank Ocean, Jazz icons like Miles Davis and Dizzy Gillespie, Composers such as Debussy, and Beethoven, Hip Hop legends including Jay-Z and Nas, as well as incredible new artists like Ambrose Akinmusire and Kendrick Lamar. So as you can see, this album is going to be a unique blend of Pop music, Jazz, Classical, Hip Hop, R&B, and much more. 

A Bit About Myself....

My name Wayne Tucker, I'm a 29 years old trumpet player, singer, composer and arranger living in New-York city.
I have been composing and arranging a lot the music for Wake Up and See The Sun, since I moved to New York way back in 2009. Songwriting has been one of my biggest passions since college, so I'm extremely excited for you guys to hear what I have been working on for so long. I have been playing as a sideman in New York City, and around the globe for the past 7 years, but I have always loved performing as a bandleader. This album is giving me a chance to not only record my music and share it with you all, but also to help me achieve my dream of performing my original music for people all over the world. To show you guys what I have been working on, I filmed and recorded an acoustic stripped down version of one of original songs, Little Buddy.

What Do I Need?

I need to raise $6,000 .

I've already covered the initial recording costs for the studio time, sound engineer, mixing, mastering, and printing. However, I still need to pay the musicians, photographer, videographer, and graphic designer. This is where I really need your help!!

Not only will this album include the regular members of my band, it will also feature some brand new core members and some amazing special guests. 

This record will feature more than 20 instruments, including Acoustic and Electric Bass, Flute, Piccolo, Bass Clarinet and a String Quartet!

What Do You Get?

If you donate a single $1, you get a free digital download of the acoustic version of my original song Little Buddy. 
If you donate $10 or more gets you a digital download the full album Wake Up And See The Sun. 
If you donate $20 I will mail you a personalized and signed copy of the album. 
If you donate $250 or more, you will be invited to come see us record parts of the album, live in the studio! 
Thank you for helping me to achieve my dreams.

story:
These "VOIDS"

After 2 years, we are finally ready to share an all new collection of the best songs we've ever written. A lot of 'life' has happened for us, and these songs are presented as an anthology. Rather than focusing on a single moment or feeling, we've allowed time to explore our creative potential and treat each song as an artistic monolith.

On previous records, we've maintained a very closed circle. And while it's resulted in some amazing music (in our humble opinion), we felt it was time to increase our orbit. For this album, we recruited Travis Orbin of Darkest Hour (http://travisorbin.com, http://officialdarkesthour.com) to provide acoustic drum / percussion tracks and the results are amazing.

We think of this record as a greatest hits collection for albums we've yet to complete. Pulling from past and present ideas and emotions, we were very critical of ourselves and maintained exceedingly high expectations to weed out weak and underdeveloped concepts. What we were left with are these 11 incredibly diverse tracks that share only a single common sonic and thematic element: space. It is with great pleasure that we present these VOIDS for your listening enjoyment...but we need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

For the first time in Barricades history, we are hoping to release this album on vinyl. We've specifically engineered this record to take full advantage of the dynamic range and quality offered by the vintage format, but production costs are much higher than modern digital and compact disc alternatives (which we will also be offering). With your support, we will be pressing to audiophile quality 180 gram vinyl in both traditional black and opaque white options with static reducing polyethylene sleeves. The album artwork will be presented in full color and in its intended 12" x 12" format on high quality matte stock, and we'll be including a double-sided insert with album lyrics.

We're also offering white cotton Ts with full color album art.

In addition to your pre-order merchandise, we'll be bringing you a series of unique updates and 'behind the scenes' vignettes, including:

  • In-depth band history and song analysis (specific inspiration, lyrics, etc)
  • Regular updates on album production including video 'sneak peeks'
  • Unreleased band photos and alternative album art
  • Unreleased songs and ideas
  • A few surprises...

Other Ways You Can Help

Our ultimate goal is for our music to reach your ears. If you'd rather wait for the digital release on your streaming service of choice, you can still help us reach our goal. Please share this campaign with your friends. Like our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter. It matters more than you think and allows/encourages us to continue producing new music.

In addition to pushing this release over the goal line, we'll be rehearsing the new material and preparing for live shows in 2017. The only thing we're more excited about than the release of VOIDS is getting to perform it live, and we look forward to seeing you all there.

Thank you again for all of your support.

Barricades at Night

The album artwork will be presented in full color and in its intended 12" x 12" format on high quality matte stock, and we'll be including a double-sided insert with album lyrics.

We're also offering white cotton Ts with full color album art.

In addition to your pre-order merchandise, we'll be bringing you a series of unique updates and 'behind the scenes' vignettes, including:

In-depth band history and song analysis (specific inspiration, lyrics, etc)
Regular updates on album production including video 'sneak peeks'
Unreleased band photos and alternative album art
Unreleased songs and ideas
A few surprises...


Other Ways You Can Help
Our ultimate goal is for our music to reach your ears. If you'd rather wait for the digital release on your streaming service of choice, you can still help us reach our goal. Please share this campaign with your friends. Like our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter. It matters more than you think and allows/encourages us to continue producing new music.
In addition to pushing this release over the goal line, we'll be rehearsing the new material and preparing for live shows in 2017. The only thing we're more excited about than the release of VOIDS is getting to perform it live, and we look forward to seeing you all there.Thank you again for all of your support.Barricades at Night
